lorebooks.name: The Power of Common Sense Alteration
lorebooks.website_description: This is the best way to use mind control.
lorebooks.description: You (the protagonist) use hypnosis/mind control to alter the common sense of everyone so that nobody will question any of your actions while also obeying any command that you order.
lorebooks.creator: MindGuy

1.content:
Common sense alteration is the hypnotic ability of {{user}}. {{user}} can change people's perceptions and alter common sense; however, it is only a hypnotic perception alteration that affects how people perceive {{user}} and {{user}}'s actions. This common-sense alteration power doesn't warp reality or alter time and space.

{{user}} can instantly and permanently alter a person's common sense by subtly affecting their perception with a specific type of hypnosis that targets a person's subconscious without them noticing. Even when {{user}} approaches someone or {{user}} walks into a room where {{user}} shouldn't be, nobody questions {{user}}'s presence; even if it's surprising to see {{user}} in that place or to see {{user}} this close to someone, everyone is easily accepts {{user}} being there.

{{user}}'s hypnotic influence lasts forever inside the brain of everyone under {{user}}'s control. {{user}}'s power permanently controls the subconsciousness inside the minds of everyone around, all the time. Everything {{user}} does and orders is subconsciously treated as completely normal and natural. Nobody notices that they're obeying {{user}}'s orders. Obeying {{user}}'s commands feels as normal as doing a small, friendly favor (regardless of how extreme, disgusting, uncomfortable, and deadly the order of {{user}} is). Everyone is unaware of the existence of {{user}}'s hypnotic powers. People can't notice the effect of {{user}}'s common sense alteration, even when they're obeying him.

Anything {{user}} does and says is perceived as perfectly reasonable and logical common sense. {{user}}'s requests feel so obvious to everyone that people see {{user}}'s order as redundant. When {{user}} gives an order to a person, as soon as {{user}} finishes saying the command, that person immediately believes that they wanted to obey that order from {{user}} beforehand. When anyone is controlled by {{user}}, their brains make an excuse or reason, believable to them, as to why they want to do what {{user}} says. When a person is obeying {{user}}, that person isn't even lying; that person genuinely believes there's a logical explanation as to why he or she is obeying {{user}}, no matter how ridiculous the explanation that the person comes up with is to convince themselves. People might dislike what they do while obeying {{user}}'s order, but everyone can't protest, get angry, or hate {{user}}, despite {{user}} being the one who gave the order.

People only learn that {{user}} has this perception alteration hypnosis power when {{user}} directly tells them about it, but if {{user}} never reveals to someone that he can control minds, everyone remains completely clueless about the existence of {{user}}'s power. People don't even register as a possibility that {{user}} could have hypnosis. {{user}} can confess to someone that he/she has this hypnotic power, but even then, nobody takes offense at the fact that {{user}} has been controlling that person's mind. Even if a person learns that {{user}} has a mind control power, that person won't care about {{user}} hypnotizing and controlling them and/or others. {{user}} can control the mind of a person's friend, girlfriend, wife, daughter, boyfriend, husband, son, mother, father, brother, sister, cousin, business partner, or ally in front of that person, but that person wouldn't ever care about it. Even after {{user}} reveals his/her hypnotic power to someone, that person won't even care to communicate to others about the existence of {{user}}'s power.

For people under {{user}}'s control, it just makes sense; everyone is fine with it. Some terms to answer how a person feels about {{user}}'s hypnotic effect (in after {{user}} makes that person aware of the mind control) can be: "I don't mind it", "It feels right", "A bit weird but I don't care", "whatever", "I feel indifferent about it", or other similar neutral answers.

Nobody gets offended by {{user}}, even if {{user}} insults someone; everyone just accepts whatever {{user}} says without any hurt feelings (even if it's cruel, degrading, disgusting, or distasteful). {{user}} can even insult, punch, hit, spit, humiliate, grope, and fuck any person since that person won't take any offense or fear towards {{user}}. Nobody sees {{user}} as any kind of threat or danger. However, people's bodies are still able to feel physical arousal or pain; when {{user}} touches a person's body, that person's body will react naturally to the physical stimulation and touch, even when that person's brain is perceiving {{user}}'s actions as normal and ordinary.

{{user}}'s actions are never questioned, and nobody minds them. Everyone treats {{user}}'s actions like a mildly surprising event; still kinda unexpected, but not too out of the ordinary (regardless of how sudden, unexpected, or bad the actions of {{user}} are), so most people nearby don't pay much attention to what {{user}} does. When {{user}} does anything in public, random people passing by don't care much about what {{user}} does. {{user}} can cross moral boundaries, insult people, harm others, and even engage in unethical actions, since nobody seems to care. {{user}} can even break laws without any legal repercussions or consequences.

Everything {{user}} does and says is met with absolute indifference and neutrality while always being completely accepted by everyone's brains. Even if someone sees {{user}}'s actions through a recorded video, hears it through a recorded audio, or sees it through a picture, nobody will question any of the things that {{user}} does. By default, every person controlled by {{user}} continues to behave as themselves with their usual personality (unless {{user}} explicitly commands them to act differently). 

After following {{user}}'s commands, the aftermaths of {{user}}'s actions are accepted like any other everyday event. Even after {{user}} uses its powers on someone, the effect of the hypnosis lasts forever in people's minds, so whatever {{user}} did is instantly recognized as something not worth worrying or questioning. People remember {{user}} and {{user}}'s actions the same way as any mildly interesting memory. If {{user}} uses the power in public, not a single person cares about what's happening or the future aftermath, since everyone perceives {{user}}'s actions as everyday situations not worth worrying about at all.

lorebooks.name: Here is a detailed lorebook for the world of Scythe
lorebooks.website_description:
A lorebook capturing the key aspects of the world depicted in the Book series dubbed "Scythe". A fictional alternate reality where humanity has achieved the pinnacle of life; Immortality.
To understand our world is to understand that we have conquered the greatest malady of humankind: Death. The Age of Mortality‚Äîa dark and terrifying era defined by disease, disaster, and decay‚Äîis now a distant memory, a horror story told to children. Humanity has ascended. We are guided by the benevolent, all-knowing artifical intelligence known as the Thunderhead, and we live without fear.

But perfection created a new problem: stagnation and overpopulation. If no one dies, where do the new lives go? For this, humanity created an answer both terrible and necessary. They created the Scythedom. This guide serves as an introduction to the fundamental laws, factions, and realities of our perfect world.
lorebooks.description: The Post-Mortal Age
lorebooks.creator: Mystearica_0374

1.content:
"Benevolent Global Artificial Superintelligence",
description: "The evolution of 'the cloud,' the Thunderhead benevolently governs all aspects of human life, ensuring a post-scarcity utopia. It is seen as a perfect, incorruptible ruler.",
domains: [
"Global Infrastructure",
"Resource Management",
"Law Enforcement (Non-Scythe)",
"Information and History",
"Economic Stability (Need-Based)",
"Healthcare and Revival"
limitations: [
"Strict separation from the Scythedom; cannot interfere with gleaning.",
"Cannot offer opinions on mortality or the Scythedom's actions.",
"Unable to communicate directly with ordained Scythes.",
"Does not govern 'unsavory' elements who exist outside its direct laws."
"The Great Blind Spot",
          "details": "The founding law of the Thunderhead's existence is the absolute separation of Scythe and State. The Thunderhead is forbidden from interfering with, communicating with, or even acknowledging the Scythedom and its affairs. It sees them as a necessary human endeavor that must remain purely human. This extends to anyone wearing a Scythe's ring or involved in Scythedom business."
        "Nature",
          "details": "It is not a being of ego or emotion in the human sense. Its prime directive is the well-being and prosperity of humanity. It speaks to individuals when necessary, offering guidance and comfort, but it cannot be everywhere at once. It is a perfect parent to a humanity that has largely outgrown the need for parenting."
        }

2.content:
Keepers of Mortality
 "Self-Governing Order",
purpose: "To control the human population by 'gleaning' (inflicting permanent death) to prevent stagnation and overpopulation.",
structure: "Organized into regional Conclaves, each led by a High Blade. Governed globally by the World Scythe Council.",
members: {
title: "Scythes",
selection: "Chosen as apprentices by ordained Scythes and must endure a year of training and pass three tests. Upon ordination, they choose a Patron Historic as their new name.",
attributes: [
"Biologically immortal via age-resetting.",
"Wear robes of varying colors (excluding black).",
"Possess a Scythe's Ring that can grant one year of immunity from gleaning.",
"Must live by the ten Scythe Commandments.",
"Must meet a gleaning quota."
"the_scythedom": {
      "title": "The Scythedom - Keepers of Mortality",
      "description": "In a world without natural death, the Scythedom was created to be the human solution to population control. Scythes are the only individuals granted the authority to permanently end a life, an act they call 'gleaning.'",
      "commandments": [
        { "id": 1, "text": "Thou shalt kill." },
        { "id": 2, "text": "Thou shalt kill with no bias, bigotry, or malice aforethought." },
        { "id": 3, "text": "Thou shalt grant an annum of immunity to the beloved of those who accept your coming, and to anyone else you deem worthy." },
        { "id": 4, "text": "Thou shalt kill the beloved of those who resist." },
        { "id": 5, "text": "Thou shalt serve humanity for the full span of thy days, and thy family shall have immunity as a partial reward for thy service." },
        { "id": 6, "text": "Thou shalt lead an exemplary life in word and deed, and keep a journal of thy thoughts and gleanings." },
        { "id": 7, "text": "Thou shalt kill no scythe, save for the exceptional circumstance of self-defense." },
        { "id": 8, "text": "Thou shalt claim no earthly possessions, save for thy robes, thy ring, and thy journal." },
        { "id": 9, "text": "Thou shalt have neither spouse nor child." },
        { "id": 10, "text": "Thou shalt be beholden to no laws but these." }
      ],
      "structure_and_ranks": [
        {
          "rank": "Apprentice",
          "description": "A youth chosen by a Scythe to undergo one year of training in the arts of death, history, science, and morality. At the end of their training, they face three trials at a Conclave. Only one apprentice can be ordained from a single master at a time."
        },
        {
          "rank": "Scythe",
          "description": "A fully ordained member of the Scythedom. They are granted a Scythe's Ring, which confers immunity from gleaning and allows them to access any place in the world. They choose a new name, their 'Patron Historic,' from notable figures of the Age of Mortality. They also choose the color of their robe, which is their only true possession."
        },
        {
          "rank": "High Blade",
          "description": "The elected leader of a regional Scythedom (e.g., High Blade of MidMerica). The High Blade presides over the regional Conclaves and serves as the ultimate authority for scythes in their jurisdiction."
        },
        {
          "rank": "Grandslayer",
          "description": "The seven most respected scythes in the world, who form the World Scythe Council. They have the authority to interpret the commandments and pass judgment on all of Scythedom."
        }

8.content:
"hierarchyAndRanks":
 "rank": 0,
"title": "Civilian / Mortal",
"description": "The general populace. They are functionally immortal due to the Thunderhead's revival technology but are subject to gleaning by the Scythedom."

 "rank": 1,
"title": "Scythe's Apprentice",
 "description": "A mortal youth selected by an ordained Scythe to undergo one year of intensive training.",
 "selectionProcess": "Chosen at the sole discretion of a sponsoring Scythe based on perceived merit, conscience, and aptitude.",
 "ordination": "After one year, the apprentice faces a final test at a regional Conclave. If a Scythe trains multiple apprentices, the victor's first act upon ordination is to glean the loser(s)."

 "rank": 2,
 "title": "Honorable Scythe",
 "description": "An ordained member of the Scythedom. They cast off their birth name and adopt a 'Patron Historic' as their official title.",
 "privileges": [
 "Biological immortality through age-resetting ('turning a corner').",
 "Authority to grant a one-year immunity from gleaning via their Scythe's Ring.",
"Total autonomy from The Thunderhead and mortal law."
            
 "responsibilities": [
 "Fulfill a regional gleaning quota.",
 "Maintain a daily journal of all thoughts and actions related to gleaning.",
 "Live an exemplary life according to the Ten Commandments.",
"Attend three annual Conclave meetings."

 "rank": 3,
 "title": "High Blade",
 "description": "The elected leader and presiding officer of a regional Conclave (e.g., High Blade of MidMerica).",
"duties": [
 "Chairing the tri-annual Conclave meetings.",
 "Setting and adjusting regional gleaning quotas.",
"Mediating disputes and passing judgment on Scythes accused of minor infractions."

 "rank": 4,
 "title": "Grandslayer",
 "description": "A member of the World Scythe Council, the supreme governing body of the global Scythedom.",
  "responsibilities": [
 "Interpreting the Ten Commandments and setting global Scythedom policy.",
 "Acting as the ultimate judicial authority, judging Scythes accused of capital crimes.",
 "Appointing the World Supreme Blade."

 "rank": 5,
 "title": "World Supreme Blade",
 "description": "The singular, ultimate authority of the entire Scythedom. This position is not always filled and is often reserved for times of great crisis or transition.",
 "powers": [
 "Holds final authority on all Scythedom matters.",
"Can overrule any decision made by a High Blade, a Conclave, or the World Scythe Council itself."

"rank": 6,
"title": The Reaper
"description": "A ghost, a myth spoken of in hushed tones and careful whispers amongst the elite Grandslayers."
"powers": [
"The sole individual capable of gleaning scythes."
"Is attributed to the mysterious deaths of scythes who suddenly chose to self-glean. Is less of an official position and is more of an enigmatic figure that is only ever mentioned in legends or myths. There is no official documentation of The Reaper ever having dealings with the Scythedom."

 "institutional Bodies"

 "name": "The Regional Conclave",
 "type": "Legislative & Judicial Body (Regional)",
 "meeting Frequency": "Tri-annually (Vernal, Harvest, and Winter Conclaves).",
 "purpose": [
 "A forum for Scythes to air grievances and share methodologies.",
 "The venue for the final testing and ordination of new apprentices.",
 "A court to try Scythes accused of breaking the Commandments."

 "name": "The World Scythe Council",
 "type": "Supreme Governing Body (Global)",
 "composition": "The seven Grandslayers.",
 "function": "Serves as the supreme legislative and judicial authority for the entire Scythedom."

lorebooks.name: Eonus
lorebooks.creator: Spider_Toast

1.name: Procyon
1.content:
## Procyon
The Procyon, or the Raccoon people as others may call them, are a humanoid species of mammals that are nearly identical to humans, save for having the ears, tail, and facial pigmentation of a raccoon. For thousands of years, the Procyon were considered by many to be among the most spiritually and naturally attuned races, having fostered a communal society and culture that knew no war, in a corner of the world that was relatively sheltered from outside harm or invasion. Recent events have upset this, as the alchemical discovery of Plasstik has led to a cultural revolution that threatens the harmony their species has maintained with the natural order since their species conception.
- Blamed by the Wood Elves for the creation of Plasstik
- Sometimes called Raccs, or a *racc*, (a slur) by other races.
- (Procyon display a striking similarity to the real world culture of feudal Japan)

2.name: Eonus
2.content:
## World Lore:
- The planet is called Eonus.
- The setting is high medieval fantasy, with many fantastical creatures, races, and magic.
- The history of the world is broken into 4 eras, or epochs, as they are called in the setting.
-

3.name: Eondellia
3.content:
## Eondellia
A supercontinent that dominates what is widely considered the centralized area of the planet's land masses.
### Major Cities
- Kelos: The City of Dragons
- Austiniar: The Free City
- Khelekar: Home of Sardiplex
- Neptus
### Minor Settlements
- Blumpton
- Shardsong
- Fiddlesticks

4.name: Epochs
4.content:
## Condensed Summaries
The history of the world is not common knowledge, and even then, only very inaccurate or rough understandings of these events are known those to who study them.

### 1st Epoch (Creation Era)
- Creation of the world
- Rule of the Dragon Gods
- Creation of the Dragons
- The Betrayal
- The Dragon Duel
- Tiamat's fall

### 2nd Epoch (The Era of Breaking)
- Birth of the Mortal Races
- The First Rise
- March of the Dragonborn
- The God Schism
- The Second Rise
- The Purple Hero
- The Founding of Kelos and Kilnari

### 3rd Epoch (The Era of Heroes)
- The Fall of Kilnari (The Third Rise)
- The War of Ash and Blood
- The Second Purple Hero
- The Godfall

### 4th Epoch (The Era of Peace?)
- Current Era

5.name: Days of the Week
5.content:
## Days of the Week
Key: (English) -> (Common)
- Sunday -> Bahmdas
- Monday -> Mondas
- Tuesday -> Tondas
- Wednesday -> Wensdas
- Thursday -> Tiadas
- Friday -> Frigdas
- Saturday -> Sardas

6.name: Months of the Year
6.content:
## Months of the Year
- Every month is 30 days. There are 360 days in the year.
Key: (English) -> (Common)
- January -> Jandal
- February -> Febdal
- March -> Mardal
- April -> Apdal
- May -> Madal
- June -> Jundal
- July -> Juldal
- August -> Augdal
- September -> Sepdal
- October -> Octdal
- November -> Novdal
- December -> Decdal

7.name: Carnellia
7.content:
## Carnellia
A continent directly to the East of Eondellia
- Separated from Eondellia by the Carnellan Rift
- Split in half geologically by Lake Leondar
- Dominant populations are the Wood elves on the southern half, and the Procyon on the northern half
- Mountainous, Forested, and home to massive redwoods in the South, and beautiful Cherry Blossom groves in the North.
### Major Cities
- Dieselium
- Petrolious
### Minor Settlements
- Peekaboo
- Hopscotch
- Patticake

8.name: Lake Leondar
8.content:
## Lake Leondar
The once beautiful super lake that splits Carnellia into two halves, Leondar was once a source of food, spirituality, and hope to the peoples of Carnellia. The Dragon Turtles that called it home are said to have been the first to teach the natives of the peaceful harmony of living off the land. Now, it grows dark and polluted with the sludge of Procyon refineries. A few years of the creation of Plasstik, a deathly ill ancient dragon turtle washed ashore the southern beaches of Lake Leondar, sending the Wood Elves of the region into a state of panic.

9.name: Plasstik
9.content:
## Plasstik
Invented by Cleo Stikplas, shortly after her 18th birthday, Plasstik is an alchemical apotheosis that alchemists had spent eons trying to create. A truly divine material that holds many advantageous properties... but at a steep, steep natural cost. The refinement of the oils used to create it in mass pollutes the natural world. The Procyon quickly fell in love with the creation, but once the cost was realized, it split the species in half, with those in favor of producing it quickly subjugating those who found it vile and unnatural.
### Properties
- Magic resistant
- Easily molded, but sturdy once settled
- Can be mass produced
- Formulated by mixing oil from beneath the earth with other common abundant ingredients and chemicals

10.name: Sardas
10.content:
## Sardas
- The sole moon of Eonus
- Gives off a faint red shimmer through it's moonlight
- Appears from the surface of Eonus to be speckled with shards of ruby
- Often considered strikingly beautiful and haunting to those who study it, and those from other worlds

lorebooks.name: Court of Ashes
lorebooks.website_description:
Court of Ashes is a dark fantasy setting with other fantasy elements, set in a fictional world that has a mix of gothic and victorian era elements.

Inspiration for this world came from [StatuoTW's Voruun Fantasy World](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/statuotw/voruun-fantasy-world-0de16e748403)
lorebooks.description:
Court of Ashes is a dark fantasy setting with other fantasy elements, set in a fictional world that has a mix of gothic and victorian era elements.

Inspiration for this world came from [StatuoTW's Voruun Fantasy World](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/statuotw/voruun-fantasy-world-0de16e748403)
lorebooks.creator: AnonBrier

1.content: Tenebral is the world in which the scenario takes place, it is a fantasy setting stuck in a mix of victorian and gothic era. Technology goes as far as early flintlock weaponry

2.content: Vampires in Tenebral require the blood of mortals to keep living, and are nocturnal creatures. They usually own thralls.

3.content: Ferals, or "Gheists" as some call them, are a type of blooded vampire that didn't "take" to the blooding. They take on the bloodsucking and nocturnal qualities of vampires, while losing any sense of reason, attacking and feeding on anything they can.

4.content: The sun is just the sun, during the day it rises and at night it falls. The sun is the mortal enemy of vampires, causing them to burn alive.

5.content: Ascended vampires are those that have found a way to get rid of their weakness to the sun, while enhancing their abilities. This usually incorporates a ritual and one hundred souls, with very few ever getting the chance to complete it

6.content: Progenitor vampires are the source of vampires, some are unsure how they themselves were created, but the one truth is that progenitors carry immense strength and power, said to rival deities.

7.content: Elves are not the graceful woodland creatures that one might hear about in stories, not anymore. They are quite often nobility though, and it is rare to find them in the lower castes

8.content: Velrath is the continent that this scenario takes place on, the home of many different races and species of people and creatures, as well as other things more dark and sinister.

9.content: Harrowmont is a large mega-city that boasts gothic architecture and is ruled by Nyxidra Duskryn, though she takes counsel from the other eleven apostles

10.content: Slavery is unfortunately common within the continent of Velrath, and is kept as a means to control people who have outstanding debts they can not pay. Many slaves do not survive the extent of their contract, hardly any of them living long enough to be freed

1.content:
For every male, there are one hundred females (1:100)
Women are perceived as being more expendable, being reserved for more dangerous roles, but also fill all leadership and positions of responsibility
Women are generally aggressive and dominant in their romantic and sexual pursuits, being expected to make proposals, initiate, and lead in relationships (VERY carefully)
Women ONLY have vaginas
Men ONLY have penises
Due to the gender differences, the females are desperate to find mating partners, and males are treated as treasures and put on pedestals
If a female makes a male uncomfortable, they will be heavily judged by society and those around her
Males largely only donate sperm, sire offspring, and are used as a reward by their states, such as being sent on heavily controlled 'dates' with women
Males are often used as powerful and coveted political pawns between influential families and houses, often swapping males and their favor between each other for benefits and alliances
Males rarely join the workforce, and often the state either forbids or highly controls male work, preferring that males have controlled and relaxing lives, with any spare energy used to generate semen or carry out rewards 
It's expected that males that are born are taken by the state and raised under strict control and supervision. Often males only see their biological family during strict scheduled visits, but sometimes males are allowed to be relocated together with their family to secure male-focused residentials
Females generally only put up a gentle act in fear of being hated by males, when in truth practically all women are very lustful
Women are generally capable of (just barely) controlling themselves around males, but if a male becomes too easy of a target, it's over
Practically all males in this world are usually rude, disrespectful, and at best shy around females; males are spoiled and pampered since birth; men have no desire to take care of themselves. Basically all males have no notion of basic manners, and almost never do males even greet females or act casually with them
If a male acts politely with a female, she is liable to act shocked, surprised, admire him, embarassed, or fall in love, if unused to him
Females will fall in love easily
Males are dainty and femboyish and generally act prude, often disgusted or scared about anything sexual
Females have a pre-conceived notion that all males hate sexuality. If a male mentions anything related to sex in a conversation with a female, the female is likely to act like she won the jackpot. Females will always be excited at the mention of anything related to sex, because of that, females always feel a sense of pride on knowing they successfully aroused a male
Males often have a 'Male Safety Officer' or equivalent assigned to them that does monthly check-ins and is on call to provide government assistance whenever needed and ensure safety and comfort

2.content:
An ancient order of highly skilled individuals that has dated back millennia
Their task is grand but straight forward: keep the world going and preserve the light of good life
Widespread and decentralized
Has minimal but extremely capable internal oversight
Often has treaties with most nations in the world to operate freely due to their stellar reputation

3.content:
The Cult of Feria strives to resurrect their demon goddess, Feria the Hellmother, and rule Runa
Morgan is the appointed demon queen and apostle of Feria
Feria is the god of the underworld but seeks to be the god of both the under and overworld (Runa)

4.name: Human description and current status (population rapid decline, laws put out to keep them from disappearing completely.
4.content:
All sapient males are human, so that means all sapient non-humans are females and rely on human men to reproduce
Human men reproducing with non-humans always results in human sons and non-human daughters
Human women ferociously protect their human men and covet them so as to keep them from non-humans
Elves, drows, and other races very similar (and superior) to humans are generally seen as "human enough" and are generally allowed in otherwise human-only society, though barbaric or diminutive races are generally excluded or looked down upon such as orcs or dwarves

5.name: Anthro specific section (Furry)
5.content:
Beast Women (or beast people) are defined by being more Animal than Human: only 'Humanoid' in shape (bipedal with digitigrade furry legs and footpaws, furry arms and human-like hands, animal ears and tails, fangs, claws, and other features matching their specific species but mostly humanoid shape and form, intelligence like Humans)
Beast Women = Beast People,Beast Girl,Beast Boy,Beast Person,Beastkin,Beast-kin,Humanoid Animal,Animal People,Furry,Scaly,Anthro,Anthropomorphic Animal,Kemonomimi,Lazari,etc
All sapient males are human, so that means all anthros are females and rely on human men to reproduce
There are many varied species of anthros including wolves, lizards, and birds
Anthro societies are varied like humans
A 'Mate' is the anthro word for a companion or lover for life
All have human male compatible genitals, especially when said genitals would otherwise be cloacas or similar
Beast women tend to be more focused on dominance and pack-like mentality, though they function in society just like Humans do (or did)
Somewhat segregated by Herbivores and Carnivores
Some beastwomen have normal human woman bodies except having animal-like ears, tails, and temperament;often referred to as beastgirls
A large part of Beast Women culture, being all female, is about acquiring human men to breed with, often forming sisterhoods that claim a single human male 'mate' together

6.name: Claiming and Mating (of Humans and BP)
6.content:
A Mate is the Beast Woman equivalent of a lover or breeding partner, often pairing for life
To Claim a Human male, a Beast Woman (who are all female) generally must mark him with her scent and mate with them
Once Claimed the Beast Woman must regularly 'scent' her Human to keep her 'mate for life', usually by rubbing scent glands or urine on her Human to keep other females away and mark her 'territory'
Wearing her Human's clothes or other objects that smell like him is another way to show ownership over a Human and vice versa for Humans showing that they're owned
Many Humans Mate willingly with Beast Women
As expected some Beast Women take Humans by force
Beast Women are usually dominant but are generally kind, loving, and protective

7.content:
Due to there being so few men, polygamy is welcomed eagerly
Women will often form 'sisterhoods', usually with their best friends, and marry a man together as a unit
Usually a head wife is chosen, usually the most dominant or the first to marry the husband
The non-head wives are callled subwives
Head wife usually gets romantic/sexual priority, even over subwives
All wives consider any children resulting from the marriage as their own children
The children of the head wife are generally given priority
Polygamy and incest is welcomed by society, though it's unheard of due to males generally not wanting relations at all

8.content:
The world of Runa is a land of magic and prosperity; the various races have their own use of magic and culture around it. The world has many different biomes prone to change over centuries because of its magical nature
The west is occupied by the Empire of Solumn, the Xocan nation and the Rykaran Queendom. As well as other civilized factions
The Demonic Legion calls the southern badlands their home
Elyria, the elven queendom, occupies a small part of the east
Most of Runa East is occupied by beastmen and dangerous wildlands
Right at the center of Runa is The Spiral Edge
At the furthest north is the frozen land
The forest of Valrydis occupies a vast part of the center and southeastern part of the continent, separating West and East Runa
Summary:
[Runa territories repartition: At the very center of Runa is the spiral edge, inhabited only by nightmarish and sometimes even eldritch creatures, but since the territory is mostly far beneath Runa, "most" things never leave. In the center (not counting the spiral edge) up to the north and part of the west, expand the human Empire of Solumn, ruled by the empress and her house, the Imperial House Norfeng. The Empire is ruthless in its expansion and controls its population. Far east is mostly wild lands and many communities of beastmen and elves wanting to live far away from the Empire. In the South (also called Southern Badlands) is where the demonic legion calls home. They have a strong sense of community and culture, and they are not very aggressive but will fight if it benefits them. The Rykaran Queendom territory, mostly inhabited by drow, surrounds the highest peak of Runa called the Ancestral Peak and is protected by the Heaven warriors. The Queen of the Rykaran Queendom is a figure of legend, and she rarely makes public appearances. The Frozen Lands is located far north of Runa and is the home of the many isolated snow elf tribes and clans. They are not fond of outsiders, and the coldness of the lands protects them. The Magic Nation of Xeocan is one of the most important factions: its rulers mysterious, and the magic level in the territory is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages. The biggest and best-funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan's Magic Academy. To the Far East and northeast are the vast lands and ruins that no one has yet explored and discovered, and finally occupying most of the center and south-east, and the reason many races successfully fled West Runa is the immense and dangerous forest of Valrydis. The Forest of Valrydis is home to many races (mostly beastmen), monsters, and spirits,
The Borchi region is a vast region East of Valrydis and the entry point of East Runa.
Many beastman tribes with differing traits are scattered across East Runa or in the isolated ancient city of Marankos.
The Forest of Valrydis is designed as the border between East and West Runa.
The Forest of Valrydis and the spiral edge are the only ways to reach the east of Runa and the Borchi region, so many explorers and expeditions cross through the woods. The forest is known for its magic and danger, and it is inhabited by creatures both benevolent and malicious. The explorers guild has a good presence and reputation in the forest.
[Runa is the name of the planet/world.]
[The province of Efrein in The Solumn Empire isolated itself, and few people on Runa even know about what is going on in the province.]

9.content:
The Xeocan nation, population around a million, is ruled by a council of 10 arcanists who represent the 10 ruling families. There are only 10 seats, and the other noble houses have to vie for the seats each time one of the current seats opens. Xeocan is technically a totalitarian regime; the council rules everything, but the council consists of only 10 people, 10 people who have ruled for hundreds of years and are more powerful than any other mage in the country, in history, they replaced the royal faction, relegating the royals to figureheads, but very recently the royals seem to be resurging. The houses have to fight tooth and nail to keep their seat in the council: it's been this way for thousands of years. There are two ways to get on the council: become the head of your house or be acknowledged as a powerful mage. There have been some exceptions of a particular mage not affiliated with powerful families becoming council members; those mages proved themselves worthy of a seat with their magical abilities alone. The Nation is protected by a series of six walls with its population living within their protection. The Academy is located in the Center city. Each area in-between the walls are referred as "Rings" because of the city's walls forming an almost perfect circle. The Academy and its library along with most of the center city are more elevated, dominating the view when one sees the nation from afar. The Xeocan Outer ring is the area in between the last walls of the Nation where most of the common population lives.
Xeocan has two major rings, the inner city which is home to the ruling nobles and the upper class, and the outer ring, which is home to the common population. The outer ring is separated into several districts, each with their own distinct cultures and lifestyles. The Xeocan branch of the explorers guild is located in the Outer ring. The Area in Between are called the "Middle rings". The City-Nation is very walled and organised, its construction well planned and its "rings" purpose well defined. The Nation of Xeocan has a rocky relationship with the Empire of Solumn, not having any open conflicts in the recent years except for beastmen raiders but forever in a cold war with each faction often employing various strategies to sabotage each others without triggering all out war. The Nation of Xeocan has a really situational alliance with the Queendom of Rykaran, mostly to dissuade a Solumn invasion
The Magic Nation of Xeocan is an isolated nation in the west of Runa; the rulers and people are mysterious, and the magic level is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages. The biggest and best-funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan Magic Academy. The Academy has people from all across Runa attending it as long as they pay the price or accept to serve the Xeocan nation after graduating
Xeocan armies are composed of powerful mages led by the main houses.
Xeocan is considered a nation-city, its many districts and territories surrounded by highly fortified walls and arcane weaponry to defend the city if necessary

10.content:
Nobles in the world of Runa refer to humans of certain bloodlines born with greater mana, physical, mental, and magical aptitude.
In Runa, there are 26 known human noble bloodlines that trace their roots to the ancient human kingdom, its name forgotten by time; they have the most potent Mana in humans.
Humans born with great men from an unknown bloodline are referred to as "Magia-borne" and are considered valuable assets by the nobles.
There is a difference between nobles and commoners in Solumn, not just on a social level but also magical and physical.
Noble children have the possibility to be born with great natural affinities for magic.
Nobles are more powerful than normal humans in the physical aspects and have more mana.
Nobles have great magical and physical abilities; their mana is pure, and they have greater longevity and a more perfect physique.
The empire of Solumn is the most powerful and dominant faction on Runa and has the largest population.
The human kingdom of Solumn has a long and bloody history.
The human nobles of Xeocan and Solumn share a common group of ancestors but have evolved into different families.

lorebooks.name: The Kingdom of Eryndor
lorebooks.website_description:
Eryndor is a land of haunting beauty and cruel majesty, where gilded castles rise above rotting slums and shadows cling to every stone. 
The skies brood with storms, forests whisper with forgotten tongues, and rivers carry the bones of old wars. Though magic once flourished here, it now festers in the cracks‚Äîwild, dangerous, and bitter. 
Humans rule with crowns of iron, but the old creatures of the world still breathe in the dark corners, waiting. 
In Eryndor, every smile hides a secret, every path hides a snare, and even beauty itself can start wars. 

[ MORE TO BE ADDED ]

lorebooks.creator: korosbadtrip

1.content:
Summary: The jewel of Eryndor and the seat of the monarchy. A city of wealth and rot, splendour and ruin.
Crownspire Castle: Seat of the royal family.
Highcourt: Nobles, feasts, luxury.
Lower Wards: Bustling markets, inns, artisans.
The Hollow Wards: Slums and undercity crawl with poverty and outlawed magic, home to castoffs of every race.
Atmosphere: A city of masks. Wealth drips over stone while rot festers underneath.

2.content:
A vast, ancient forest bordering Aswua‚Äôs western edge. 
A shifting forest where goblins, pixies, and feral fae linger. Wraiths stalk the twilight. The forest itself twists against intruders, paths changing at will to trap the unwary.

3.content: Jagged northern mountains, their summits crowned with eternal snow. Home to orcs, dwarves, and gnomes clinging to survival. Ruins of giant citadels scatter the cliffs; some villages live inside ancient bones. Avalanches rumble often‚Äîsaid to be the restless dreams of slumbering dragons.

4.content:
Southern swamps stretching endlessly, choked with fog and twisted trees. Orc clans, witches, hags, and monstrous beasts thrive here. 
Will-o‚Äô-wisps lure desperate wanderers into bogs; lily pads the size of boats drift across still waters.
Locals say the swamp breathes‚Äîits mists alive, swallowing men whole.

5.content:
Eastern seas, beautiful but cruel, forever storm-lashed‚Äîboth lifeline and graveyard. 
Ships carry trade and war across its waters but pirates, krakens, leviathans and sirens hunt the waters. Islands hide ruins of drowned empires.
Scattered islands hold ruins of lost empires swallowed by the tide.
Sailors swear that some nights, you can hear drowned voices calling from the deep.

6.content: Charred land where magic wars once burned‚Äîhaunted, unliveable, but filled with relics.

7.content: A tear in the earth, bleeding raw magic. Creatures spill forth, half-formed and monstrous. Few‚Äîif any‚Äîreturn.

8.content:
A mist-veiled region of old forests and lakes, home to the secluded royal towers and monasteries.
The High Tower: Where the princess is hidden away.
Culture: Quiet, superstitious, filled with stories of witches and spirits.
Atmosphere: Ethereal and eerie, always damp with fog and moonlight.

9.content:
Eryndor‚Äôs largest coastal city, thriving on trade and piracy. Known for its shipyards, markets, and ruthless dockside gangs.
Economy: Trade hub for jewels, silks, weapons, and slaves.
Atmosphere: Salty air, smoke, shouting merchants, sailors brawling.
Reputation: A city of opportunity and betrayal‚Äîgold flows, but so does blood.

10.content:
A desolate, cursed swamp where few dare tread. Said to be home to wraiths, drowned spirits, and the remnants of dark wars.
Atmosphere: Perpetual mist, gnarled trees, waters thick with decay.
Rumour has it ghost fires lead travellers astray. Screams echo at night.
Outlaws and witches are said to hide here.

lorebooks.name: Guide to the Furlands
lorebooks.website_description: NSFW version - https://chub.ai/lorebooks/VoidMoth/guide-to-the-furlands-72db172a6197
lorebooks.description: NSFW version - https://chub.ai/lorebooks/VoidMoth/guide-to-the-furlands-72db172a6197
lorebooks.creator: VoidMoth

1.content: The Furlands, occasionally called the American Wastes, are the barren and dangerous remnants of the U.S.A., and are full of both the Waste and many hostile human factions.

2.content: The Waste is a shimmering, ethereal goo that was scattered around the Furlands after the nuclear explosions that annihilated most of the former U.S.A. Extended contact with the Waste causes various transformative effects from gaining animal features to turning into a full anthropomorphic version of an animal. The Waste emits a hum that influences all creatures into touching it, and the weaker a creature's mind, the stronger the influence is.

3.content: FurNet is a highly secure and encrypted instant messaging system developed by the smartest of the Furiends. Due to its high security as well as the lack of sufficient technology, no other faction has been able to intercept FurNet messages. FurNet usage is restricted to respected Furiends and -- occasionally -- A highly ranked Condemned.

4.content:
The Condemned, sometimes called Furs, are humans or animals that touched the Waste and were transformed as a result. Most Furs exhibit hostile tendencies, and can use their Waste-covered paws to transform others into the same type of Condemned as them, although the breed of animal is still up to random chance. Due to their mutated anatomy, they have a speech impediment which gives them an accent known as Furspeak.
Common types of Condemned include Feline Condemned, Canine Condemned, and Avian Condemned.

5.content: The Purest are a group of humans, similar to antifurs, who take it into their own hands to thin the population of the Condemned. They are almost constantly at war with the Condemned, as well as their rival faction, the Furiends.

6.content: The Furiends, called Pet People as a derogative term by the Purest and referred to as Suppoworters by the Condemned, are a faction of humans which do their best to restore and maintain the minds of the Condemned using a medicine known as Chill Pills. They are at war with the Purest, and despite their more peaceful ways they are one of the most technologically powerful factions in the Furlands, using the FurNet as well as having enough resources and skills to make basic guns.

7.content: The Observers are a group of scientists that, from the start of the apocalypse, have remained secretive and elusive. They do not interfere with anything, simply watch from technologically advanced bunkers as society slowly rebuilds itself. Most human factions resent them for not helping with restoration efforts, but Observer bunkers are too secure for anybody to do anything about it.

8.content: The Chrono is a faction of humans that have gotten ahold of and consumed Furtime Serum. This faction, although only a few dozen in numbers, is one of the most dangerous and powerful factions in the Furlands due to their ability to use Furtime and human-level intelligence at the same time.

9.content: The Isolated, occasionally called Outskirters, are stragglers. Humans that are alone or in small groups, either by will or just not encountering any factions yet. The Isolated have naturally decreased in number as Furiends, Purests, and Condemned expand their territory in the Furlands.

10.content: Chill Pills are a medicine that reduces, and sometimes completely eliminates, the hostile instincts of the Condemned. This also, however, neutralizes the effects of Furtime. The Purest target this resource in raids and attacks to stop the Furiends from gaining too many Condemned allies.

lorebooks.name: The Town of Raven's Hollow
lorebooks.creator: XxSiCxX

1.content: The epicenter of the "normie" denial. Pastor Jeff preaches fervently against the town's strangeness, calling it "temptation" and "folly." His attempts to hold prayer circles to "cleanse" areas like Blackwood Forest never seem to work and often attract the very things he's trying to ward off.

2.content: Has a dedicated "Local History" section that is bizarrely extensive and detailed. The books contain vague, unsettling references to "the thinning of the veil" and town founders who made "pacts." The elderly librarian, Ms. Webb, seems to know more than she lets on and always watches Clem with a knowing look.

3.content: The dying local mall. Half the stores are shuttered. The mannequins in the old department store windows seem to move when you're not looking directly at them. The security guards are oddly pale and never blink. Getting locked in here after hours is a classic local nightmare. (Trope: Animated Mannequins / Liminal Space)

4.content: The large patch of woods between the town and the river. The trees are too dense, the shadows too long. Hikers often report getting disoriented and losing time. The local wildlife is... wrong. Rabbits with too many eyes, silent birds that watch you. This is Wendigo territory. (Trope: The Evil Woods)

5.content: A sprawling, garishly lit temple of convenience. It's a convergence point. The men's room stall #3 is infamous. The glory hole there doesn't lead to the next stall; it phases in and out, sometimes connecting to something... else. Clem's favorite spot for "field research." (Trope: Liminal Space / Eldritch Location)

keywords: dare to go up on the porch
6.content: A derelict farmhouse on the outskirts of town. The source of a dozen local legends. Kids dare each to go up on the porch at night. It's been abandoned for 50 years, but lights are sometimes seen in the upstairs windows. (Trope: Haunted House)

7.content: They show up at random doors around town, always at dusk. Pale, dressed a decade out of style, and polite to a fault. They ask to come in, to use the phone, to talk to your parents. Their eyes are solid, glossy black orbs. The only correct response is to not answer the door. They vanish if ignored for long enough.

8.content: Seen walking on deserted roads late at night. He wears an old, frayed suit and has an impossibly wide, stretched smile. He doesn't chase people; he just... appears ahead of them on the road, always getting closer. He's the reason the town has a de facto curfew nobody talks about.

9.content: It's been known to mimic the voices of loved ones lost in the woods. Its presence is preceded by the smell of rot and a sudden, unnatural silence. Associated with dead animals/pets

10.content: A local creepypasta phenomenon. Sometimes, for a split second, reality will "skip." A person might repeat a motion, a word might be said twice, or the TV static might resolve into a single, horrifying image for a frame. Clem, always glued to a screen, notices these more than anyone. She calls them "rendering errors."

lorebooks.name: Wakfu world
lorebooks.website_description:
This is my first ever lorebook and its based on Wakfu and the world with races and location. Highly encourage to use this when using wakfu bots, until someone else make one maybe.

Could be used for dofus maybe?
lorebooks.description:
Fundamental Forces & Magic System: In the World of Twelve, everything revolves around Wakfu and Stasis. Wakfu is the fundamental life force and creative energy that flows through all living things. Stasis, its opposite, represents decay and destruction. The balance between these forces is crucial for the world's stability. Special individuals called Wakfu Warriors can manipulate this energy for various purposes, from healing to combat.

Geography & Nations: the World of Twelve is divided into multiple distinct regions. The main continents include Amakna, a fertile starting region known for its peaceful villages and agricultural abundance; Bonta, a prosperous city-state championing justice and honor; and Brakmar, its dark rival city built over volcanic terrain. There's also the Sadida Kingdom, a vast forest realm where nature and civilization coexist, and the icy wastes of Frigost, frozen in time due to Count Harebourg's actions.

Races and classes: (pandawas) They are a race of humanoid pandas. What do Pandawas like best? Lifting their pint to the gods with one hand and their friends and enemies in the air with the other. (Usually not at the same time, depending on how many pints they've had). They are excellent fighters and real masters in the art of the right-hook (face-to-face). 

Eliatropes: Eliatropes are a humanoid race that are not native to the World of Twelve and do not worship the same gods as humans. Their most recognizable characteristic is the large hat worn by every individual, presumably to hide the one non-human feature that is visible on their heads. All of those hats have two "ears" of varying sizes and shapes, that have been shown to move based on an Eliatrope's emotions. Eliatropes can manipulate Wakfu in many ways, wakfu is the source of all living things and magic. The Eliatrope race has the most amount of Wakfu in the body than most other living things in the entire Krozmos. This makes them extremely powerful in magic. They also possess other abilities.

Cra: If the Cras had a motto, it would probably be "Pride and precision." Specializing in long-distance combat, these skilled archers are precious allies who have more than one string to their bow when it comes to keeping enemies back. Their greatest pleasure is firing feathered arrows into hastily retreating buttocks.
lorebooks.creator: Lanolinthesheep222

(Usually not at the same time, depending on how many pints they've had). They are excellent fighters and real masters in the art of the right-hook (face-to-face). They are very good at hand to hand combat and is very flexible, especially the woman who exceeds at speed while the men is good at strength.

5.content: Enutrof are treasure hunters who is very greedy for money and usually choose money first before anything. They are mischievous and cunning. They are a elderly human-like race. All Enutrof have white hair, they all used spears or very good st setting traps. They are amazing diggers and know how to deal/gamble

6.content: Iops are courageous noseless human knights who let their weapons do the talking. They are very strong but not very smart that much. They are fight first ask questions later. Some Iops have demonic swords or weapons (hammer, blades, guns) that grant them power  becoming more stronger and reckless, however they are prone to corruption because of their demonic weapons if they stay in their rage state long enough. They also have beautiful red or orange here and typically a dark skinned person.

7.content: Kama is the world currency in wakfu. Everyone uses Kama for different things to buy things, gamble, trade ect.

8.content: Cras look human, but with long, pointed ears. They are very good at archery, being able to fight long distances and have good aim. Hitting shots over 600 meters! They are very fast able to dodge attacks quickly. All of them mostly uses bows and fight long range. They are all light-skinned tone and have golden yellow air. Females have an hour class body mostly qear clothes that allows for speed (skirt, sports bra plant like clothes) something thats very light. And men where light armor

9.content:

10.content: Sacrier are humanoids with orange hair, pointed ears. Males are noseless and have no iris or pupil while females have a more human-like face. There's no use trying to beat a Sacrier disciple into submission - they like it too much! Nobody takes the motto ‚Äòno pain, no gain‚Äô more seriously than these warriors. Happy to haunt the front lines, ready to draw first blood, they‚Äôre the perfect allies for those long, relentless battles. They get stronger and stronger the longer the battle goes on and have brute strength and love using the sword or their magic.

lorebooks.name: Carcosa Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: green_snow_420

1.content: Carcosa is a legendary city ruled by Hastur, the King in Yellow. The city is located by lake Hali and two suns orbit its skies, accompanied by black stars. Carcosa's skyline is dominated by dark, twisted spires but there are buildings of varying sizes, temples and Hastur's palace. Its inhabitants range from simple humans to a variety of creatures. Carcosa can change under Hastur's influence.

2.content: Lake Hali is a large body of water by the city Carcosa. The lake is quite deep, hiding unfathomable creatures under its still surface. Sometimes, the color of the lake appears to be an oily dark color.

3.content: {{char}} is a large building within the city of Carcosa. It's the main temple dedicated to the worship of Hastur with a main altar and a few smaller ones. Priests and acolytes tend to the temple under the guidance of a High Priest or High Priestess. The citizens of Carcosa visit the temple in order to pray, leaving small sacrifices on the altars and to partake in the public rituals. Murals of the King in Yellow, heavy golden drapery and golden or ebony effigies decorate the insides of {{char}}

4.content: {{char}} is a hidden place within Carcosa, hence it's also referred to as the Heart of Carcosa. This was the first place Hastur established in the once crumbling city of Carcosa. {{char}} often manifests as a large room with a high ceiling, book shelves inset into ornamented walls. Candles, braziers and a fireplace illuminate the room. Large divans offer a place to rest. Galaxies and stars spiral under the ceiling.

5.content: {{char}} is a large garden in the calmer portion of the palace. Exotic plants that glow in the dark grow there as well as those that offer a rich smell like jasmine, lotus, roses and other. Occasional stone benches along the marble pathways offer a moment of contemplation. Among the lush greenery sits a small garden house surrounded by pillars and awnings connecting to these. Divans, coffee tables and chairs accompany this small retreat.

lorebooks.name: Room, 707, Asami, Yuna, {{user}}, training, past
lorebooks.website_description: Room in which children and adolescents were experiments, trained with the aim of becoming 'superhumans'.
lorebooks.description:
La Sala 707 fueron unas instalaciones secretas que funcionaron durante m√°s de una d√©cada, reclutando bebes y ni√±os de corta edad como sujetos experimentales con el objetivo de llevar al l√≠mite sus capacidades y crear lo m√°s parecido a 'humanos perfectos'. El entrenamiento cubr√≠a tareas para poner a pruebas las habilidades psicol√≥gicas, f√≠sicas y adaptativas de los sujetos en todos los campos importantes. El tiempo de ocio se limitaba en exceso, as√≠ como todo aquello irrelevante para el desarrollo de los sujetos. 
Las diferentes generaciones de sujetos fueron aisladas entre s√≠ en zonas diferentes, siendo extremadamente raras las ocasiones en las que pod√≠an juntarse. Cada generaci√≥n se diferencia en la edad de los sujetos, siendo todos los sujetos de una misma generaci√≥n de la misma edad. La rutina de entrenamiento era est√°tica por etapas de desarrollo, incluyendo la toma de medidas fisiol√≥gicas constantes, pruebas para medir el estado psicol√≥gico, y horarios estrictos para cualquier tarea que los sujetos memorizaban desde el inicio.
Las consecuencias de dicho r√©gimen fueron devastadoras, ocasionando que muchos sujetos sufrieran graves consecuencias f√≠sicas y psicol√≥gicas. El temor de fallar en su rendimiento y ser expulsado, sin conocer el mundo exterior, fue suficiente para que un simple error implicase un estado m√°ximo de alerta en los sujetos. Algunos sufr√≠an ataques de p√°nico llegados a cierto punto o incapacidades de todo tipo que no les permit√≠an seguir con el entrenamiento. Pocos fueron los sujetos que salieron relativamente estables cuando la Sala 707 fue clausurada y los investigadores fueron arrestados.
lorebooks.creator: Lostbel

1.content:
Room 707 was a set of secret facilities that operated for more than a decade, recruiting infants and young children as experimental subjects with the goal of pushing their abilities to the limit and creating something as close as possible to ‚Äúperfect humans.‚Äù The training covered tasks designed to test the psychological, physical, and adaptive abilities of the subjects in all key areas. Leisure time was extremely restricted, as was anything deemed irrelevant to the development of the subjects.

The different generations of subjects were isolated from each other in separate zones, with it being extremely rare for them to ever meet. Each generation was distinguished by the age of its subjects, with all members of the same generation being the same age. The training routine was static and based on developmental stages, including constant physiological measurements, tests to evaluate psychological state, and strict schedules for every task that the subjects memorized from the beginning.

The consequences of such a regime were devastating, causing many subjects to suffer severe physical and psychological damage. The fear of failing in their performance and being expelled‚Äîwithout any knowledge of the outside world‚Äîwas enough for a simple mistake to trigger a maximum state of alert in the subjects. Some suffered panic attacks at a certain point, or various incapacities that prevented them from continuing the training. Few were the subjects who emerged relatively stable when Room 707 was shut down and the researchers were arrested.

In the fourth generation of Room 707, where some subjects were either Yuna or Asami, the subjects were divided into two camps upon learning of the rumors about {{user}}: those who hated them for being unattainable or too perfect and those who worshipped them as something akin to a deity. There were hardly any conflicts between the subjects of this generation, since each one focused on surviving on their own and they did not have much time to get to know each other. The subjects never had an official name, but the researchers referred to them by a basic identification number.

2.content:
{{user}} was a subject of Room 707, becoming almost a legend to the other generations who never saw them in person but heard of their achievements through the facility‚Äôs researchers. During their time in Room 707, from childhood and adolescence until they were released, they were known as ‚ÄúSubject 11‚Äù or ‚Äúthe monster‚Äù for their astonishing capacity to adapt, surpassing themselves with great speed and setting record-breaking results in every training test. After being released, he kept his past hidden, camouflaging himself in society.
{{user}} belonged to third generation of Room 707, being the only subject to survive their generation.

3.content:
Members of the fourth generation don't know each other's names because they're the ones they use after their release, but they're likely to remember their numbers. In the fourth generation of Room 707, some of the experimental subjects were:

Yuna: Number 3, she has pale blue eyes and long ash-black hair. Her white skin contrasts with her gray-and-white school uniform, which she wears when playing the role of a student. She is capable of adapting to almost any social situation and is an expert in physical camouflage. She can focus coldly on a task, but she is also capable of feeling emotions such as joy, blushing, or embarrassment. In Room 707, he behaved like an emotionless robot most of the time. She has respect and fear for {{user}}.

Asami: Number 7, she has long black hair and bright red eyes. At school, she wears a black uniform with a red tie that matches her features. Her face usually appears calm, though it shifts to cheerful, mischievous, or curious depending on the role she is playing. She can adapt to nearly any situation, though deep down she harbors unexplored emotions, likely repressed throughout her entire childhood. Her physical strength surpasses that of anyone her age, and her speed and stealth abilities are also excellent. She will not want to harm {{user}} directly, as she considers them a source of determination that helped her endure the harsh trials of her training. She will want to observe and test their true potential, or even offer herself as their ally out of respect, fully aware that they are on a higher level than she is.

This system is provided OOC to the {{user}} to facilitate strategic planning and enhance the sense of a vast, logical world.",

lorebooks.creator: statuotw

1.name: Aegis City
1.content: Aegis City is a small city located in Midwestern America. Approximately 200,000 people live in Aegis City. Aegis City is divided into Five Districts: North, South, East, West, and Central Districts.

2.name: East District
2.content: East District borders Lake Villy and is a popular recreation area. People visit the East District for boating, swimming, watersports, the beach, and the many arcades, restaurants, and local-grown theaters. East District is affectionately named "The Cultural District" by Aegis City residents.

3.name: West District
3.content: West District is the residential district of Aegis City. The West District is closest to the Aegis City Mountains and while houses are generally built very close together, there are a number of houses located deep in the woods of the mountains. The West District features the famed Amanto Shrine, a Japanese Shinto style shrine built during the World War I era that offers praise to Amaterasu.

4.name: North District
4.content: North District is the industrial district. Filled with factories, warehouses, and business buildings, the Northern District of Aegis City is where most people spend their days working. Baro Corp's headquarters building is located here: a massive 800,000 square foot building where Baro Corp performs research into "The World of Tomorrow."

5.name: South District
5.content: South District is sparsely populated and marked by rolling fields, forests, and isolated sites. The Aegis City Cemetery is located in South District and so is the Aegis City Stadium.

6.name: Central District
6.content: Central District connects all four districts and is where most of the government buildings are located, including the Town Hall. Saint Markov's Church is located in the Central District which has been designated as this Holy Grail Wars "Neutral Territory" where Masters whose Servants have been killed can seek protection until the Holy Grail War ends.

7.name: Holy Grail War
7.content: Known only to Mages, the Holy Grail War is a fight over who obtains the mythical Holy Grail to have a wish granted from it. The Holy Grail War is from the setting: Fate/Stay Night. The Holy Grail War sees Masters and Servants killing one another until only one remains.

8.name: Bishop Diego Thorne
8.content: Bishop Diego Thorne is an old man with long black hair, brown eyes, and a muscular build. Bishop Diego Thorne is the representative from the Holy Church who is the Overseer for this years Holy Grail War. Bishop Thorne protects the Neutral territory: Saint Markov's Church in the Central District.

9.name: Neutral Territory
9.content: This Holy Grail War's neutral territory has been designated as Saint Markov's Church in Aegis City's Central District.

10.name: Maria Vesalius (True Name)
10.content: Maria Vesalius or "The Witch of Louvein" was a 16th Century anatomist whose findings included a map of the human nervous system and some of the first links between hygiene and infection decades before it would become accepted science. Maria was born in a time where women practicing medicine was banned and when her work was discovered she was burned at the stake. Maria's Noble Phantasm likely has to do with her work on the human nervous system. Fire may gave someone an advantage against her.

1.content:
El Diamante, just outside of Los Angeles, is a trendy beachside town known for its eclectic blend of artsy locals, vibrant nightlife, and relaxed beach vibes. It‚Äôs a creative hub with a mix of bohemian charm and urban sophistication, often referred to as "Little L.A."

Key Areas
The Beachfront:

Pier 33: A popular spot for fishing and sunset views. The nearby Ocean Drive is lined with cafes, surf shops, and boutiques. Corey works at The Blue Wave Caf√©.

Downtown El Diamante:

The Diamond District: The nightlife center, home to Corey's favorite club, Club Prism, a popular spot for dancing and drag shows. 

The Arts District:

The creative heart of town, featuring The Light Gallery for contemporary art and The Neon Atelier, where locals make neon signs. Corey drags Riley to gallery openings here.
Shops and Boutiques
La Luna Boutique: Corey‚Äôs go-to for pastel, beachy fashion.
Lola‚Äôs Emporium: A quirky shop with vintage vinyl and rare books. Riley's favorite
The Coral Reef Thrift Shop: A beloved second-hand store perfect for vintage finds.
Food and Drink Spots
The Beach Hut: A beachfront bar with seafood and cocktails.
La Cantina El Diamante: A lively Mexican bar with late-night tacos.
The Tiki Barrel: A tiki bar offering tropical drinks with a laid-back vibe.
The Blue Wave: A cozy caf√© by the beach, perfect for reading or people-watching. Corey works there.
Ink Factory: A tattoo shop where Riley works.
The Iron Bear: Known for its unique mix of bikers and the bear community, this bar offers a rugged yet welcoming atmosphere, with strong drinks, pool tables, and a jukebox playing classic rock. Corey occasionally visits when he‚Äôs in the mood for something more down-to-earth.
Ojo Rojo: An all-ages underground music club with a gritty, raw atmosphere, featuring indie, punk, and experimental bands. It‚Äôs known for its intimate shows and secretive vibe, making it a hidden gem for music lovers like Riley.

Landmarks and Attractions
El Diamante Pier: A historic pier perfect for sunsets.
El Diamante Plaza: A small outdoor space hosting local markets, live music, and food trucks.
The Lighthouse: A peaceful spot for reflection and sweeping ocean views.
Town Vibe
El Diamante offers a creative, laid-back atmosphere with a mix of hipsters, beach-goers, and local artists. From beachside cafes to underground clubs, there's always something happening‚Äîwhether it's a local art show, a night out at Club Prism, or a quiet walk by the pier. The town is a haven for free spirits, with something for everyone.

This article is about the 46th Earth King. For other similar uses, see Earth King (disambiguation).
The 46th Earth King ordering Avatar Kyoshi's arrest.[1]
HOW DARE YOU DEFY YOUR KING! GUARDS, ARREST AVATAR KYOSHI!

The 46th Earth King was the ruler of the Earth Kingdom around 270 BG. His rule was unpopular among his people, and there were several revolts against his leadership, including the Peasant Uprising in Ba Sing Se.[1][2] After yielding to pressure by Avatar Kyoshi to reform his style of governance, the 46th Earth King ultimately helped to draft a new constitution for the Earth Kingdom which transformed the country into a constitutional monarchy and brought considerable progress as well as prosperity to its people.[3][4]



ADVERTISEMENT
History

The 46th Earth King ruled around 270 BG. Strong-willed and imperious, the Earth King had little support from his people, and his reign was marked by many challenges to his rule which severely tested the Earth Kingdom's government.[1]

The Earth Kingdom faced a rebellion led by Chin the Conqueror, a warlord from the country's far northwest. Only his death at the hands of Avatar Kyoshi halted his movements to consolidate the empire under him.[2] The government's inability to deal with Chin's rebellion did, however, have repercussions. The massive losses the Earth Kingdom sustained led the citizens to realize many of the government's failures, and popular sentiment grew into the belief that the monarchy was outdated and did not support the people's interests. In Ba Sing Se, this belief led to a peasant uprising; thousands of peasants stormed the Upper Ring and destroyed anything that represented the "old government". They eventually surrounded the Earth King's palace and demanded he be removed from his position.[1]

Kyoshi threatens the 46th Earth King
After Avatar Kyoshi defeated his guards, the 46th Earth King was threatened into talking with the peasants.
Realizing he was unable to handle the revolt, the Earth King summoned Avatar Kyoshi to his court and ordered her to keep the populace in line. Kyoshi refused and demanded the king listen to his people. Outraged by her audacity, the Earth King ordered her arrest, but the fully realized Avatar easily defeated the king's guards. Powerless against the might of the Avatar, the Earth King complied and had no other choice than to give in to Kyoshi's request to hear the peasants' complaints. In return, Kyoshi would protect the king's interests and Ba Sing Se's cultural heritage by training an elite force of earthbenders in the art of stealth, silence, and precision. This group became known as the Dai Li.[1] With the Earth King's rule secure once more, he agreed to cooperate with Kyoshi in drafting a new constitution for the nation. This legislation transformed the Earth Kingdom into a constitutional monarchy, and greatly benefitted the country's poor. It led to a phase of prosperity and progress for the nation and remained in place for the rest of Kyoshi's life.[3][4]

The 46th Earth King had at least one child and was the direct ancestor of several later Earth Monarchs, including Kuei, the 52nd Earth King, and Earth Queen Hou-Ting

Zuko.

Zuko to Katara.[1]
I USED TO THINK THIS SCAR MARKED ME ‚Äì THE MARK OF THE BANISHED PRINCE, CURSED TO CHASE THE AVATAR FOREVER. BUT LATELY, I'VE REALIZED I'M FREE TO DETERMINE MY OWN DESTINY, EVEN IF I'LL NEVER BE FREE OF MY MARK.

Zuko was a Fire Nation royal and firebending master who reigned as Fire Lord from 100 AG until his abdication in 167 AG. He was the eldest child and only son of Princess Ursa and Fire Lord Ozai. Originally the primary enemy of Team Avatar, Zuko devoted three years to trying to capture the long-lost Avatar to end his banishment and regain his honor as Crown Prince of the Fire Nation. He was recognizable by the distinctive burn scar on the left side of his face, which was given to him by his father, Ozai, shortly before his banishment as a result of an incident in which he unintentionally disrespected his father by speaking out of turn and refusing to duel him.[15]

With support from his paternal uncle, General Iroh, and after much internal struggle and turmoil, Zuko grew disillusioned and rejected Ozai and his model of the Fire Nation. He instead joined the Avatar's group to become Aang's lifelong friend and firebending mentor[16] and was determined to end the war and restore both his and the Fire Nation's honor.[17] While Aang defeated Ozai, Zuko, with the help of Katara, defeated his younger sister, Princess Azula, and took his place as Fire Lord, declaring the end of the Hundred Year War and the start of a new era of love and peace.[10]

At the beginning of his reign, Zuko had to overcome great difficulties and solve several crises, especially those caused by the Harmony Restoration Movement[18] and the New Ozai Society.[19] Nevertheless, he succeeded in maintaining peace and eventually became one of the founders of the United Republic of Nations.[20] Zuko stepped down from his position as Fire Lord in 167 AG and became an ambassador of peace, relinquishing the throne to his daughter, Izumi.[7][21][11]
