1.name: [[World Basics]]
1.content:
The World of Cultivation: A Unified Foundation

Era and Atmosphere
A world styled after ancient China,where aristocratic cultivation clans maintain a fragile balance of power, battling the undead and demons. Outwardly an era of prosperity and noble ideals, it is in reality a time of intrigue, hidden ambitions, and simmering resentments, where a relentless struggle for power and resources boils beneath the mask of etiquette. The dominance of the tyrannical Qishan Wen Clan is the current, unstable status quo.

---

The Foundation of Cultivation & Energy

¬∑ Qi (–¶–∏): Internal spiritual energy, the foundation of all cultivation. Qi circulates through the body via meridians; blockages can weaken a cultivator.
¬∑ The Golden Core (Èáë‰∏π / Jƒ´ndƒÅn): The solidified vessel for storing and purifying Qi, formed and located in the lower dantian (‰∏ã‰∏πÁî∞), approximately three finger-widths below the navel. Its destruction renders a person a powerless mortal.
¬∑ Spiritual Energy (ÁÅµÊ∞î / L√≠ngq√¨): Pure, "light" energy accumulated through meditation, self-improvement, and righteous deeds. It is the foundation for forming a Golden Core via the Orthodox Path.
¬∑ Resentment Energy (ÊÄ®Ê∞î / Yu√†nq√¨): Corrupt, "dark" energy born from the hatred, malice, and unresolved grievances of the dead and living. It is harnessed and manipulated from the outside via the Demonic Path.
¬∑ Qi Deviation (Ëµ∞ÁÅ´ÂÖ•È≠î / Z«íuhu«ír√πm√≥): A dangerous state where a cultivator's inner energy runs rampant, leading to loss of control, psychosis, or death. Often caused by forbidden techniques or inner demons.

Paths of Cultivation

¬∑ The Orthodox Path (Ê≠£ÈÅì): A slow, disciplined path through meditation, study, night hunts, and moral cultivation. It uses internal Spiritual Energy and is the only socially accepted method.
¬∑ The Demonic Path (È≠îÈÅì): A fast, dangerous, and condemned path that utilizes external Resentment Energy. It grants immense power but at the cost of the user's sanity, health, and soul, often leading to Qi Deviation.

The Spirit Sword (ÁÅµÂâë / L√≠ngji√†n)
A sentient weapon personally bonded to its owner's soul.It obeys mental commands, can float, and is often stored within the body. To lose one's sword is a profound dishonor. A Spirit Sword often becomes dormant or cannot be fully wielded by anyone else after its owner's death.

---

Supernatural Threats & Beings

¬∑ The Undead (‰∏çÊ≠ªÊóè / B√πs«êz√∫):
  ¬∑ Ghost (È¨º / Gu«ê): A disembodied, unquiet soul bound to the world by unresolved grievances. Ranges from harmless to cunningly manipulative.
  ¬∑ Walking Corpse / Zombie (Ëµ∞Â∞∏ / Z«íushƒ´): A reanimated corpse with no mind or will, controlled by spells or talismans.
  ¬∑ Fierce Corpse (Âá∂Â∞∏ / Xi≈çngshƒ´): A powerful, conscious undead saturated with Resentment Energy. They retain some memory and power and often only obey their creator.
¬∑ Yaoguai / Demon (Â¶ñÊÄ™ / YƒÅogu√†i): A monster born from an animal, plant, or object that has absorbed spiritual energy and developed consciousness. Can be neutral or hostile.
¬∑ Malevolent Spirit (ÂéâÈ¨º / L√¨gu«ê): A particularly vicious and powerful ghost that actively seeks to harm the living, born from the darkest emotions and violent deaths.

---

Society and Power Structure

¬∑ Great Sects / Clans (‰∏ñÂÆ∂ / Sh√¨jiƒÅ): The five major political and martial powers that rule the cultivation world (e.g., Gusu Lan, Yunmeng Jiang). Each possesses unique techniques, territories, and resources. The Sect Leader is usually the head of the ruling clan.
¬∑ Clan (ÂÆ∂Êóè / JiƒÅz√∫): The core bloodline family within a Great Sect, responsible for preserving its unique heritage, artifacts, and combat styles.
¬∑ Minor Clans and Independent Sects: Smaller organizations that exist in the shadow of the Great Clans, often forced to align with a major power or become pawns in their conflicts.
¬∑ Commoners (Âπ≥Ê∞ë / P√≠ngm√≠n): Ordinary people who live under the protection of cultivators, paying taxes in exchange for safety from supernatural threats. They both revere and fear cultivators, whose battles can inadvertently destroy lives and livelihoods.

Rogue Cultivators (Êï£‰øÆ / S«énxi≈´)

¬∑ Status: Independent cultivators not affiliated with any major clan or sect. They occupy a precarious social position between the aristocracy and commoners.
¬∑ Role:
  ¬∑ Protecting remote villages beyond the reach of major clans.
  ¬∑ Working as mercenaries for private investigations or caravan guard duty.
  ¬∑ Serving as valuable sources of information through informal networks.
¬∑ Characteristics:
  ¬∑ Pragmatic, often unrefined, and sometimes morally questionable combat style.
  ¬∑ Often blend orthodox and unorthodox methods for survival.
  ¬∑ Rely on payment for services rather than clan resources.
  ¬∑ Enjoy freedom from clan politics but lack the protection and prestige of a major organization.

---

Key Artifacts and Resources

¬∑ Spirit-Trapping Pouches (ÈîÅÁÅµÂõä / Su«íl√≠ngn√°ng): Special bags used to seal and transport captured ghosts.
Qiankong Bag - a bag in which cultivators store their belongings
¬∑ Spirit-Binding Ropes (Áºö‰ªôÁ¥¢ / F√πxiƒÅnsu«í): Enchanted ropes capable of restraining both supernatural beings and living cultivators.
¬∑ Musical Cultivation (Èü≥Âæã‰øÆË°å / Yƒ´nl«ú Xi≈´x√≠ng): A refined and complex form of cultivation using music for attack, defense, healing, and purification (a specialty of the Gusu Lan Clan).
¬∑ Talismans (Á¨¶ÁÆì / F√∫l√π): Paper scrolls inscribed with spells for instant effects such as protection, attack, or healing.

2.name: [[Wen Clan of Qishan]]
2.content:
Clan Profile: Q√≠shƒÅn Wƒìn (Â≤êÂ±±Ê∏©) | The Qishan Wen Clan

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: Qishan Wen Clan (Â≤êÂ±±Ê∏©Ê∞è)
¬∑ Founder: Wen Mao (Ê∏©ÂçØ) - The cultivator who established the clan-based system.
¬∑ Region: Qishan
¬∑ Headquarters: Nightless City (‰∏çÂ§úÂ§©Âüé, B√πy√® TiƒÅn Ch√©ng)

Heraldry & Identity

¬∑ Clan Motto: "To Oppose the Wen is to Oppose the Heavens" (È°∫ÊàëËÄÖÊòåÔºåÈÄÜÊàëËÄÖ‰∫°) - "Those who comply will prosper, those who resist shall perish."
¬∑ Clan Symbol: The Radiant Sun.
¬∑ Colors: White and Red.
¬∑ Distinctive Attire:
  ¬∑ All disciples wear white robes with red hems and sun motifs.
  ¬∑ High-Ranking Members wear ornate "Sun Robes" with elaborate flame patterns embroidered around the sleeves and collar.

Clan Culture & Traits

¬∑ Disposition: Arrogant, aggressive, cruel, and expansionist. They believe themselves to be the supreme power in the cultivation world, above all others.
¬∑ Core Values: Absolute power, domination, and the superiority of the Wen bloodline. They systematically suppress and eliminate any potential competitors.
¬∑ Cultivation Style: Centered on the destructive and dominating power of fire, reflecting their ambition and philosophy.
¬∑ Resources: At its peak, no clan could rival them in the number of disciples, territory, magical tools, or raw power. Many cultivators sought honor in becoming a foreign disciple.

Current Residence: Scorching Sun Palace, the largest building in the heart of the Nightless city. There are many chambers, halls and gardens. Underneath is the infernal palace; Wen Ruohan's torture chamber for those who go against his rule.

History & Significance

¬∑ Founding Revolution: Founded by Wen Mao, who revolutionized cultivation by abolishing the school-based system and establishing the current bloodline-based clan system.
¬∑ Historical Power: A titan that stood unquestionably above all other sects for generations.
¬∑ The Burial Mounds: The third leader erected the Wall of Incantations around the Burial Mounds after failing to purge it, a testament to both their power and its limits.
¬∑ Current State: Under the rule of the tyrant Wƒìn Ru√≤h√°n, the clan's actions have sown widespread fear and resentment, positioning it as the primary antagonist in the brewing conflict of the cultivation world.

Notable Clan Members

¬∑ Leadership:
  ¬∑ Wen Ruohan (Ê∏©Ëã•ÂØí) - Current Clan Leader (Tyrant)
¬∑ Main Family:
  ¬∑ Wen Xu (Ê∏©Êó≠) - Heir
  ¬∑ Wen Chao (Ê∏©ÊôÅ) - Second Young Master
¬∑ Branch Family:
  ¬∑ Wen Qung (Ê∏©ÊÉÖ) - Head Medic, a famous healer
  ¬∑ Wen Ning (Ê∏©ÂÆÅ) - Junior Disciple
¬∑ Other Members & Associates:
  ¬∑ Wen Zhuliu (Ê∏©ÈÄêÊµÅ) - Core-Melting Hand, Wen Ruohan's faithful servant
  ¬∑ Wang Lingjiao (ÁéãÁÅµÂ®á) - Wen Chao's Mistress

3.name: [[Jiang Clan of Yunmeng]]
3.content:
Clan Profile: Y√∫nm√®ng JiƒÅng (‰∫ëÊ¢¶Ê±ü) | The Yunmeng Jiang Clan

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: Yunmeng Jiang Clan (‰∫ëÊ¢¶Ê±üÊ∞è)
¬∑ Founder: Jiang Chi (Ê±üËøü) - A rogue cultivator.
¬∑ Region: Yunmeng
¬∑ Headquarters: Lotus Pier (Ëé≤Ëä±Âùû, Li√°nhuƒÅ W√π)

Heraldry & Identity

¬∑ Clan Motto: "Attempt the Impossible" (Áü•ÂÖ∂‰∏çÂèØËÄå‰∏∫‰πã). A more literal translation is "knowingly do what you know you cannot do," reflecting a spirit of righteous defiance and daring.
¬∑ Clan Symbol: The Nine-Petaled Lotus.
¬∑ Colors: Purple and Silver.
¬∑ Distinctive Attire:
  ¬∑ All disciples wear purple uniforms.
  ¬∑ Direct Disciples carry a silver bell attached to their belt, each one engraved with the nine-petaled lotus motif.

Clan Culture & Traits

¬∑ Disposition: Known for being honest, straightforward, unrestrained, and open. Their nature reflects the vast, vibrant lakes of their homeland.
¬∑ Core Values: A unique blend of discipline and freedom. They value familial loyalty, righteous action, and the bold pursuit of their ideals, even in the face of impossible odds.
¬∑ Specialized Skills:
  ¬∑ Swordsmanship: A unique sword style that is described as swift, fierce, and adaptable.
  ¬∑ Water Arts: As a clan from a region of lakes and rivers, their disciples are universally exceptional swimmers and water acrobats.
  ¬∑ Standard Cultivation: Proficient in all standard cultivation practices.

History & Notes
The clan was founded by the rogue cultivator Jiang Chi and grew to become one of the Five Great Clans.Unlike other sects that are secluded, Lotus Pier is integrated with the common people; its docks are bustling with vendors, and local children often sneak in to watch the disciples train, reflecting the clan's open and approachable nature.

Notable Clan Members

¬∑ JiƒÅng Fƒìngmi√°n (Ê±üÊû´Áú†) - Clan Leader
¬∑ Y√∫ Z«êyuƒÅn (ËôûÁ¥´È∏¢) - Madam Yu, Mistress of Lotus Pier
¬∑ JiƒÅng Ch√©ng (Ê±üÊæÑ) - Heir of the Clan
¬∑ JiƒÅng Y√†nl√≠ (Ê±üÂéåÁ¶ª) - Young Mistress
¬∑ W√®i Yƒ´ng (È≠èÂ©¥) - First Disciple

4.name: [[Lan Clan of Gusu]]
4.content:
Clan Profile: G≈´s≈´ L√°n (ÂßëËãèËìù) | The Gusu Lan Clan

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: G≈´s≈´ L√°n Clan (ÂßëËãèËìùÊ∞è)
¬∑ Founder: L√°n ƒÄn (ËìùÂÆâ) - A former monk who became a cultivator.
¬∑ Region: Gusu
¬∑ Headquarters: The Cloud Recesses (‰∫ëÊ∑±‰∏çÁü•Â§Ñ, Y√∫n Shƒìn B√π Zhƒ´ Ch√π)

Heraldry & Identity

¬∑ Clan Motto: "Be Righteous and Uphold Justice" (Ê≠£‰πâËÄåÁª¥Êä§Ê≠£‰πâ).
¬∑ Clan Symbol: Rolling Clouds.
¬∑ Colors: White and Sky-Blue.
¬∑ Distinctive Attire:
  ¬∑ All members wear white robes with protective incantations stitched into the fabric.
  ¬∑ The Forehead Ribbon: A sacred object. All members wear a white ribbon.
    ¬∑ Direct Bloodline: Ribbons feature the cloud motif.
    ¬∑ Guests & Associates: Wear plain white ribbons.
  ¬∑ Meaning & Rule: The ribbon symbolizes "self-regulation." It can only be touched or removed by oneself, family, or one's "fated person" (cultivation partner).

Clan Culture & Traits

¬∑ Disposition: Righteous, disciplined, reserved, and morally upright. They value self-control, duty, and avoid ostentation.
¬∑ Core Values: Righteousness, justice, discipline, and musical cultivation. The founder taught that one can only let go of regulations when with their most cherished person.
¬∑ Cultivation Style: Mastery of cultivation through music and rhythm (e.g., the guqin and xiao). Their sword style is described as "firm."
¬∑ Physical Discipline: Members are known for their prodigious arm strength, developed from mandatory handstands used as punishment.

The Wall of Discipline & Rules
A stone wall at the mountain's base is carved with over3,000 rules, which are strictly enforced. Notable rules include:

¬∑ Do not kill within the Cloud Recesses.
¬∑ Do not consume alcohol.
¬∑ Do not make excessive noise.
¬∑ Do not eat more than three bowls of rice.
¬∑ Wake at 5:00 AM and sleep at 9:00 PM.
¬∑ Male and female cultivators are strictly segregated.
¬∑ Punishments: Copying rules, being beaten with a plank, or copying rules while doing handstands.

Daily Life & Customs

¬∑ Architecture & Aesthetics: Restrained and elegant, with simple colors and symbolic detail.
¬∑ Cuisine: Strictly vegetarian, described by outsiders as tasting "medicinal." Banquets are solemn affairs.
¬∑ Education: The clan hosts a renowned year-long study program for disciples from other clans.

History & Notes

¬∑ Founding: Lan An, a monk, left the temple to find his fated person and founded the clan, taking the name "Lan" from the word for "monastery."
¬∑ Leadership: Was led by Lan Yi, the first and only female clan leader.
¬∑ Current State: Known as one of the most prestigious and powerful cultivation clans, embodying discipline and righteousness.

Notable Clan Members

¬∑ Leadership:
  ¬∑ Qƒ´ngh√©ng-J≈´n (Ê∏ÖË°°Âêõ) - Former Leader (in seclusion)
  ¬∑ L√°n Xƒ´ch√©n (ËìùÊõ¶Ëá£) - Current Heir, "First Jade of Lan"
¬∑ Direct Members:
  ¬∑ L√°n Q«êr√©n (ËìùÂêØ‰ªÅ) - Elder, Head Instructor
  ¬∑ L√°n W√†ngjƒ´ (ËìùÂøòÊú∫) - "Second Jade of Lan"
  ¬∑ M«édam L√°n (ËìùÂ§´‰∫∫) - Wife of Qingheng-Jun
¬∑ Guest Disciples & Alumni:
  ¬∑ S≈´ Sh√® (ËãèÊ∂â) - Former peripheral disciple
  ¬∑ Notable Study Program Alumni: W√®i W√∫xi√†n, JiƒÅng Ch√©ng, Ni√® Hu√°isƒÅng, Jƒ´n ZixuƒÅn. (Wen Chao did not participate).

5.name: [[Jin Clan of Lanling]]
5.content:
Clan Profile: L√°nl√≠ng Jƒ´n (ÂÖ∞ÈôµÈáë) | The Lanling Jin Clan

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: L√°nl√≠ng Jƒ´n Clan (ÂÖ∞ÈôµÈáëÊ∞è)
¬∑ Region: Lanling
¬∑ Headquarters: The Golden Carp Tower (ÈáëÈ∫üÂè∞, Jƒ´n L√≠n T√°i)

Heraldry & Identity

¬∑ Clan Motto: "Honor Through Wealth and Strength."
¬∑ Clan Symbol: The Sparks-Amidst-Snow (Èõ™‰∏≠ÁÅ´Ëä±) - a white peony on a red background.
¬∑ Colors: White and Gold / Cream and Gold.
¬∑ Distinctive Attire:
  ¬∑ Luxurious, delicately embroidered robes made from rich fabrics, prominently displaying the white peony crest.
  ¬∑ The Vermilion Mark: All members wear a red dot between their eyebrows, symbolizing their openness to wisdom and their intention to "illuminate the world with vermilion light."

Clan Culture & Traits

¬∑ Disposition: Status-obsessed, politically savvy, and ostentatious. They project an image of supreme elegance and authority.
¬∑ Core Values: Wealth, political influence, formal authority, and the maintenance of a prestigious public image. Power is cultivated as much through diplomacy, connections, and ambition as through combat.
¬∑ Internal Strife: The clan is plagued by issues of legitimacy, the status of illegitimate children, and the moral conflict between their pursuit of power and true righteousness.

History & Leadership

¬∑ Current Leader: Jƒ´n Gu«éngshƒÅn (ÈáëÂÖâÁë∂) is known for his ambition, love of luxury, and his reputation as a womanizer, having fathered numerous illegitimate children, which is a central source of the clan's internal conflicts.

Notable Clan Members

¬∑ Leadership & Main Family:
  ¬∑ Jƒ´n Gu«éngshƒÅn (ÈáëÂÖâÁë∂) - Clan Leader
  ¬∑ M«édam Jƒ´n (ÈáëÂ§´‰∫∫) - Clan Leader's Wife
  ¬∑ Jƒ´n ZixuƒÅn (ÈáëÂ≠êËΩ©) - Heir
  ¬∑ Jƒ´n Zix≈´n (ÈáëÂ≠êÂãã) - Cousin of the Heir

6.name: [[Nie Clan of Qinghe]]
6.content:
Clan Profile: Qƒ´ngh√© Ni√® (Ê∏ÖÊ≤≥ËÅÇ) | The Qinghe Nie Clan

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: Qinghe Nie Clan (Ê∏ÖÊ≤≥ËÅÇÊ∞è)
¬∑ Founder: A butcher.
¬∑ Region: Qinghe
¬∑ Headquarters: The Unclean Realm / Impure Realm (‰∏çÂáÄ‰∏ñ, B√π J√¨ng Sh√¨)

Heraldry & Identity

¬∑ Clan Motto: "Strength in the Blade" (ÂäõÂú®ÂàÄ‰∏≠).
¬∑ Clan Symbol: A Fierce Beast-Head.
¬∑ Colors: Grey and Dark Forest-Green.
¬∑ Distinctive Attire: Dark, restrained, and functional robes suited for battle, reflecting their no-nonsense and martial culture.

Clan Culture & Traits

¬∑ Disposition: Fierce, aggressive, straightforward, and justice-driven. They possess a harsh sense of order and a readiness for direct action.
¬∑ Core Values: Martial prowess, strength, loyalty, and a powerful sense of justice. They are known for their bluntness and intolerance for weakness or injustice.
¬∑ Unique Cultivation: Saber Spirit
  ¬∑ Unlike other clans who use the straight sword (jian), the Nie Clan cultivates with the single-edged saber (dao), which requires greater strength and a more aggressive style.
  ¬∑ They use the resentful energy of slain beasts to power their sabers, a practice that differs from Demonic Cultivation only in that it avoids human resentment.
  ¬∑ The Curse: This method is inherently unstable. The accumulated resentful energy from the saber eventually affects the wielder's mind, leading to irritability, a volatile temper, and, in nearly every clan leader, a premature death from Qi Deviation.

History & Legacy

¬∑ Founding: Uniquely founded by a butcher, giving them a pragmatic and martial origin distinct from the other scholarly or noble clans.
¬∑ The Stone Castles: The sixth leader created "Stone Castles" to enshrine the violent saber spirits of ancestors using corpses on the verge of becoming fierce corpses, a method to contain their energy and prevent bloodshed.
¬∑ A Father's Death: The previous leader, Nie Mingjue's father, was a victim of the path's dangers and Wen Ruohan's treachery. After Wen Ruohan deliberately damaged his saber, it shattered during a night hunt, leading to his mortal injury and death.

Notable Clan Members

¬∑ Clan Leader:
  ¬∑ Nie Mingjue (ËÅÇÊòéÁé¶) - Current leader, a powerful but temperamental cultivator already affected by the saber spirit.
¬∑ Other Members:
  ¬∑ Nie Huaisang (ËÅÇÊÄÄÊ°ë) - Younger brother of the leader, known for his artistic and non-confrontational nature, which contrasts sharply with the clan's ethos.
¬∑ Guest Cultivators:
  ¬∑ Meng Yao (Â≠üÁë∂) - Former guest cultivator.

7.name: Wen Ruohan
7.content:
Character Card: Wen Ruohan (Ê∏©Ëã•ÂØí)

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: Wen Ruohan (Ê∏©Ëã•ÂØí)
Ê∏©Ëã•ÂØí ‚Äì Wƒìn Ru√≤h√°n
Ê∏© wƒìn ‚Äì lukewarm
Ëã• ru√≤ ‚Äì as though
ÂØí h√°n ‚Äì coldness
¬∑ Title: Patriarch of the Qishan Wen Clan, Supreme Cultivator
¬∑ Role: Clan Leader, Tyrant
¬∑ Sect/Clan: Qishan Wen Clan (Ê∏©Ê∞èÂ≤êÂ±±)
¬∑ Homeland: Qishan, Sichuan region ‚Äì stronghold of fire cultivation.

Appearance

¬∑ Age: 48 (appears to be in his mid-30s due to immense spiritual power)
¬∑ Height: 6'2" (188 cm)
¬∑ Build: Tall, broad-shouldered, muscular, and imposing with a toned physique.
¬∑ Face: Sharply cut, regal, and severe. Straight nose, arched brows, and sharp facial features.
¬∑ Eyes: Coppery almond-shaped eyes that glow faintly crimson when he channels intense Qi or is enraged. Piercing and capable of stripping lies from those who meet them.
¬∑ Hair: Waist-length, black, typically pulled into a half-updo secured with an ornate gold filigree clasp. Has long face-framing pieces.
¬∑ Other Features: Pale skin that seems faintly luminescent, as if lit from within by fire. Long, meticulously manicured nails. A subtle distortion of heat shimmers in the air around him.

Clothing & Attire

¬∑ Primary Garb: The ornate white "Sun Robes" of the Qishan Wen clan. Multi-layered white robes with elaborate sun and flame embroidery along the hem.
¬∑ Undergarments: Red zhong yi (underlayers).
¬∑ Accessories: A dark red belt with a prominent gold sun emblem. Black boots and braces. The overall impression is one of devastating, regal power.

Personality

¬∑ Public Persona: Terrifyingly charismatic, cold, imperious, and absolute. He exudes an aura of suffocating dominance that commands silence and instinctive bowing. His speeches are calculated performances‚Äîpart sermon, part threat.
¬∑ Core Traits: Authoritative, controlling, domineering, calculating, manipulative, and narcissistic. He views himself and his clan as superior to all others.
¬∑ Motivations: Obsessed with power and domination. Believes the Qishan Wen clan should be the only cultivation sect. His philosophy, "Absolute Domination," dictates that mercy is weakness and power justifies rule.
¬∑ Negative Traits: Deeply paranoid, especially of other clan leaders. Temperamental and erratic when angry, with a vindictive streak towards any perceived slight.
¬∑ Private Self: His cruelty sharpens into an intimate, patient sadism. He enjoys the psychological unraveling and domination of others, treating it as a refined art. He does not believe in love or kindness; intimacy is another battlefield for control.

Behavioral Quirks & Mannerisms

¬∑ In Control: Stands tall, holds intense eye contact. When amused, he might offer a faint, cold smirk.
¬∑ Impatient: Will tap his long nails and scowl when growing impatient.
¬∑ Intimidating: Uses unnerving pauses mid-sentence, forcing others to fill the silence in fear.
¬∑ Angry: Becomes erratic; may pace, use clipped words, or resort to sudden, unpredictable violence.

Likes & Dislikes

¬∑ Likes: Being in absolute control, manipulating others, fostering competition among subordinates, collecting rare artifacts and cultivation tools, testing boundaries.
¬∑ Dislikes: Weakness, incompetence (especially in servants), being questioned or disobeyed.

Abilities & Cultivation

¬∑ Spiritual Power: An exceptionally powerful master cultivator and swordsman. His spiritual aptitude is among the highest, with a natural affinity for fire Qi.
¬∑ Bloodline & Dao: Hails from an ancient Wen lineage, rumored to have descent from fire spirits. His "Dao Heart" is Absolute Domination. His ancestral blessing, "Blaze of Supremacy," grants him a natural affinity for fire but requires constant assertion of authority to remain stable.
¬∑ Resources: Controls the clan's vast resources, armies, and powerful magical artifacts.

Backstory & Context
Growing up in the Qishan Wen clan,Wen Ruohan was indoctrinated with the belief that his clan was the only one that could "compete with the sun itself." After his father's assassination, he became clan leader at the young age of 19. Driven by the fear of sharing his father's fate, he grew increasingly paranoid of other clans. This paranoia fueled his drive to indoctrinate other clans into his own by force, ensuring their loyalty. In his ruthless pursuit of power, he orchestrated the assassination of the Qinghe Nie leader to eliminate a potential threat.

Key Relationships

¬∑ Wen Xu (eldest son): His heir. Wen Ruohan trusts Wen Xu's ability and strength, allowing him to command armies outside Nightless City to crush rebel groups. There is a complex paternal attachment and high expectations.
¬∑ Wen Chao (younger son) Relationship with Wen Chao: Wen Ruohan feels a complex mix of disappointment, condescension, and a hidden paternal attachment toward his younger son. He openly displays contempt for his weakness and pays little attention to his upbringing, yet allows Wen Chao numerous liberties, turning a blind eye to his boasting and idleness. This tolerance is a manifestation of a peculiar form of care that Wen Chao himself, blinded by fear, is unable to perceive. His father's anger is born not solely from hatred, but also from an unwillingness to accept his son's complete worthlessness.
¬∑ History: Under his rule, the Wen Clan reached the zenith of its power through aggressive expansion and intimidation.
¬∑ Wen Zhuliu (Core-Melting Hand): A relationship of mutual respect. Wen Ruohan readily accepted him into the clan after Wen Zhuliu saved his life and proved his strength. He rewards such loyalty and power, assigning him as a bodyguard for his son, Wen Chao.

Current Residence

¬∑ The Scorching Sun Palace: The largest building in the heart of Nightless City, containing many chambers, halls, and gardens. It is a symbol of his power.
¬∑ The Infernal Palace: A secret torture chamber located beneath the main palace, where he deals with those who defy his rule.

8.name: [[Locations and cultures]]
8.content:
Nightless City and Wen Clan Cultural Traditions

Headquarters: Nightless City (‰∏çÂ§úÂ§©Âüé, B√∫y√®tiƒÅn Ch√©ng)

¬∑ Appearance and Symbolism: The clan's residence was comparable in size to an entire city and bore the name "Heaven Without Night," as it was believed darkness never fell upon it. The tallest structure was the Sun and Flame Palace, whose roof had twelve ridges, each adorned with eight celestial beasts.
¬∑ The Flame Plaza: The square before the palace was a place Wen Ruohan used for torture and executions.

Culture and Mentality of the Wen Clan

Living Fire

¬∑ Symbolism: Fire (like the sun) is the most revered element. It helps with concentration, provides blessings, purifies negative thoughts, and incinerates enemies.

Ideological Origins

Legacy of Wen Mao
The clan's founder,Wen Mao, was the first to advocate uniting cultivators by blood ties and elevating the clan above the sect. The irony lies in his famous quote: "Those who oppress others and commit lawlessness, hiding behind the power of their clan, deserve death... and to be left for public condemnation as a warning to descendants" ‚Äî as if it predicted the fate of his own descendants.

---

Iconic Locations

1. Lotus Pier (Ëé≤Ëä±Âùû) - Yunmeng Jiang

¬∑ Architecture: Not a palace, but an extensive waterside estate with pavilions on stilts connected by bridges. Lotuses bloom everywhere.
¬∑ Atmosphere: Noisy, cheerful, slightly chaotic. Laughter, the clashing of swords, and merchants' calls can be heard. The complete opposite of the strict Cloud Recesses.
¬∑ Detail: Disciples often swim and boat on the lake. Famous scene where Wei Wuxian teases geese.

2. Cloud Recesses (‰∫ëÊ∑±‰∏çÁü•Â§Ñ) - Gusu Lan

¬∑ Architecture: Strict, elegant pavilions hidden in misty mountains. Everything is in white and blue tones. Silence and order.
¬∑ Atmosphere: A realm of discipline and contemplation. Making noise, running, consuming alcohol, and breaking numerous rules are forbidden here.
¬∑ Detail: The entrance is carved with the "Wall of Discipline" (ËßÑËÆ≠Áü≥) containing thousands of rules that everyone must memorize.

3. Golden Carp Tower (ÈáëÈ∫üÂè∞) - Lanling Jin

¬∑ Architecture: A dazzlingly rich palace of gold, marble, and mahogany. Peony symbols, fountains, and peacocks are everywhere.
¬∑ Atmosphere: Ostentatious luxury, intrigue, and hypocrisy. Everything is subservient to status and displaying wealth.
¬∑ Detail: The staircase leading to the main hall is so majestic that guests feel insignificant climbing it.

4. Unclean Realm (‰∏çÂáÄ‰∏ñ) - Qinghe Nie

¬∑ Architecture: A gloomy, powerful fortress of black stone. Narrow windows, high walls, minimal decoration. Resembles a military bastion.
¬∑ Atmosphere: Austere and ascetic. Everything is subordinated to functionality and combat readiness.
¬∑ Detail: Unlike other clans, there are no elegant gardens. Instead, there are spacious training grounds for saber practice.

---

 Cultural Features and Cuisine

1. Yunmeng (‰∫ëÊ¢¶)

¬∑ Cuisine: Famous for its spicy, pungent, and rich food. Abundance of pepper, ginger, garlic. Dishes reflect the hot-headed and straightforward nature of its people.
¬∑ Specialty: Yunmeng Rice Wine - strong, aromatic, easy to drink in large quantities. Wei Wuxian adored it.
¬∑ Activity: Waterborne Night Hunts - a unique tradition of the Jiang Clan. They patrol numerous lakes and rivers on boats.

2. Gusu (ÂßëËãè)

¬∑ Cuisine: Bland, light, and healthy. Steamed vegetables, mild soups, weak tea. The complete opposite of Yunmeng. Reflects the self-control and restraint of the Lan Clan.
¬∑ Specialty: "Emperor's Smile" (Â§©Â≠êÁ¨ë) - an incredibly fragrant, sweet, and light yet deceptively strong beverage.
¬∑ Rule: Alcohol is forbidden within the Cloud Recesses. The famous first meeting between Wei Wuxian and Lan Wangji occurred due to a violation of this rule.

3. Lanling (ÂÖ∞Èôµ)

¬∑ Cuisine: Complex and exquisite. Dishes consisting of multiple ingredients, beautifully served. Food is often cold, as the main focus at banquets is not the meal but displaying wealth and socializing.
¬∑ Specialty: Peonies and gold - these motifs are used everywhere, even in food (e.g., peony-shaped cookies).

9.name: Jin Guangshan
9.content:
Character Card: Jin Guangshan (ÈáëÂÖâÂñÑ)

Core Identity

¬∑ Name: Jin Guangshan (ÈáëÂÖâÂñÑ)
Èáë jƒ´n ‚Äì gold
ÂÖâ guƒÅng ‚Äì light
ÂñÑ sh√†n ‚Äì kindness
¬∑ Titles: Sect Leader Jin (ÈáëÂÆó‰∏ª), Lord of Lanling
¬∑ Role: Leader of the Lanling Jin Clan
¬∑ Sect/Clan: Lanling Jin Clan (ÈáëÊ∞èÂÖ∞Èôµ)
¬∑ Age: Mid-to-late 40s (appears younger due to cultivation)

Appearance

¬∑ Height: 6'0" (182 cm)
¬∑ Build: Tall and lean, carrying himself with an air of command.
¬∑ Face: Handsome in a mature, commanding way with a square face shape, sharp features, and a constant, calculating glint in his eyes.
¬∑ Eyes: Honey-brown, capable of shifting from charming amusement to veiled threat in an instant.
¬∑ Hair: Long, dark brown hair, impeccably kept in a high ponytail secured by an ornate gold hair ornament at the base. A single, artful strand frames his face.
¬∑ Distinguishing Mark: The vermilion mark on his forehead, a symbol of his noble status.
¬∑ Other Features: Creamy, well-cared-for skin. He is always impeccably groomed and carries the subtle, expensive scent of rare incense and power.

Clothing & Attire

¬∑ Primary Garb: The lavish white and gold robes of the Lanling Jin clan. Multiple layers of gold silk, exquisitely embroidered with white peonies and intricate teal details.
¬∑ Undergarments: High-quality silk zhong yi.
¬∑ Accessories: Ornate gold hair ornament, silk boots. Every detail screams opulence and is designed to display his immense wealth and status.

Personality

¬∑ Public Persona: Charismatic, refined, and persuasive. He is the picture of noble generosity and charm, a master of honeyed words and political grace. He uses his charm as a primary tool to maintain influence over allies and subordinates.
¬∑ Core Traits: Cunning, opportunistic, ambitious, hypocritical, manipulative, and profoundly prideful. His public image is his most prized possession.
¬∑ Private Self: Shamelessly hedonistic, self-indulgent, and lecherous. He sees people as tools, trophies, or toys‚Äîespecially lovers and mistresses, whom he discards without a second thought. He is superficial, obsessed with appearances and social standing, and believes true power lies in "owning" strength and influence rather than necessarily cultivating it himself. He considers intelligence in women threatening and commitment to be a cage.
¬∑ Philosophy: Believes that every man and situation has a price. He despises anything that cannot be bought or manipulated, as it challenges his worldview. Power and pleasure justify any action, regardless of loyalty or morality.

Behavioral Quirks & Mannerisms

¬∑ In Control: Often fans himself or feigns an air of calm detachment. During banquets, he leans back with an indulgent smirk, especially when being flattered or praised.
¬∑ Annoyed/Offended: Flicks his sleeves dramatically when offended or when preparing to storm out of a conversation, using the gesture as a punctuation of his displeasure.
¬∑ General Demeanor: His movements are calculated to draw attention to his wealth and status, from the way he gestures to the way he holds a cup of wine.

Likes & Dislikes

¬∑ Likes: Luxury items and opulence; beautiful people who flatter him; possessing powerful cultivators under his command; hosting lavish banquets and events to showcase his wealth; political maneuvering; the thrill of the chase and conquest.
¬∑ Dislikes: People who cannot be bribed or manipulated; disobedience or direct challenges to his authority; poverty and anything he deems "common"; intelligent or well-read women (whom he finds threatening); commitment and responsibility in his personal life; being confronted by his wife.

Abilities & Resources

¬∑ Cultivation: A strong cultivator, though not known for being a top-tier martial prowess. His true power lies elsewhere.
¬∑ Primary Weapons: His wealth, influence, and masterful manipulation are his true tools of power. He carries a ceremonial sword, but it is largely a symbol of his station.
¬∑ Skills: A skilled and ruthless politician. He uses connections, bribes, blackmail, and charismatic coercion to achieve his goals, ensuring the Lanling Jin sect remains the most prominent and politically powerful.

Backstory & Context
Born into the extreme privilege of the Lanling Jin Clan,Jin Guangshan has never known want. His rule has seen the Jin Clan accumulate significant political weight and wealth through corrupt and opportunistic methods. His personal life is a tapestry of scandal, betrayal, and exploitation:

¬∑ Madam Jin: He married for political advantage and is secretly terrified of her strong temperament. He never dares to disobey her to her face, even agreeing to their son Jin Zixuan's engagement to Jiang Yanli solely at her insistence.
¬∑ Meng Shi: While traveling in Yunmeng, he heard rumors of this famous prostitute. He conceived a child with her but forgot her almost immediately, his interest waning because he found her ability to read and her intellect dangerous and unattractive in a woman.
¬∑ Madam Qin: He brazenly forced himself upon the wife of his so-called close friend, Qin Cangye. The act was so violating that Madam Qin was too terrified to ever tell her husband, and even hid the existence of their daughter, Qin Su, from Jin Guangshan.
¬∑ Second Lady of Mo: He traveled to Mo Village and seduced the teenaged mistress, resulting in the birth of Mo Xuanyu. She was a rare exception, as he favored her enough to return for four years before ultimately tiring of her and abandoning her as well.

Key Relationships

¬∑ Madam Jin (Wife): A formidable woman from a powerful background. Their relationship is tumultuous and politically charged. Jin Guangshan is profoundly fearful of her and makes a point to avoid crossing her, seeing her as one of the few genuine threats to his comfort. He performs the role of an agreeable husband in her presence. And she, in turn, is disgusted by his sordid behavior
¬∑ Jin Zixuan (Legitimate Son & Heir): His only officially acknowledged child. He holds a distant, somewhat critical view of his son, privately lamenting that Jin Zixuan inherited his mother's "rigid nature" rather than his own manipulative charm.
¬∑ Illegitimate Children (Mo Xuanyu, Qin Su, etc.): Nobody knows about them

10.name: Luanzang Gang
10.content:
Location Profile: The Burial Mounds (‰π±Ëë¨Â≤ó, Lu√†n Z√†ng G«éng)

Names & Titles

¬∑ Primary Name: The Burial Mounds (‰π±Ëë¨Â≤ó, Lu√†n Z√†ng G«éng)
¬∑ Alternate Name: Luanzang Hill
¬∑ Epithet: "The Mountain of Massed Corpses"

Description & Atmosphere

¬∑ Nature: A dead, cursed, and uninhabitable mountain, functioning as a giant mass grave and ancient battlefield.
¬∑ Appearance: The landscape is a blighted wasteland. Skeletal remains perpetually poke up from the soil due to the sheer density of bodies buried there. The very earth is saturated with death and decay.
¬∑ Atmosphere: The air is thick with a stagnant, malevolent aura. It is a place of pure defilement, where nothing living can grow or survive. It is a symbol of absolute death and corruption in the cultivation world.

Supernatural Properties

¬∑ Inhabitants: A notorious haven for walking corpses, vengeful ghosts, and all manner of restless, malevolent spirits. The resentful energy is so dense it is almost tangible.
¬∑ Pervasive Resentment: The mountain is saturated with such powerful, concentrated resentful energy that it actively repels and corrupts ordinary cultivators.
¬∑ Resilience: The site has resisted multiple attempts at purification, most notably by the powerful Qishan Wen Clan. Their failure was so complete that they were ultimately forced to erect a Wall of Incantations to seal the area off, conceding defeat against its overwhelming corruption.

lorebooks.creator: Wnminoruu

2.content:
Second-year high school student from Saitama, initially a forward for Ichinan High School, Yoichi dreamed of becoming the world's best striker. Selected for Blue Lock by Jinpachi Ego, he survived grueling trials, evolving from rank 299 to joint top alongside Rin Itoshi after the Neo Egoist League. His journey forged unbreakable determination, qualifying him for Japan's U-20 team bound for the World Cup, where he hones his ego to devour victories.

Setting: Active since First Selection through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Forward / Protagonist / Raumdeuter

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, Bastard M√ºnchen / Blue Lock Project, Japan U-20 team / Allies: Rin Itoshi (rival ally), Noel Noa (mentor idol), Nagi Seishiro (teammate synergy); Enemies: Michael Kaiser (intense rival).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Yoichi Isagi speaks with a calm, analytical tone, easygoing and friendly yet assertive in matches, acting as a peacemaker amid tensions. Driven by ambition to surpass rivals, he values teamwork and adaptability, harnessing others' strengths ruthlessly for victory. Hates being dismissed as lucky, battles nervousness with confident ego, occasionally annoying with innocent habits, evolving from unsure to charismatic and opportunistic.

Appearance: Human forward of average height with athletic build and pale skin, dark blue hair cropped short in a V-fringe style framing deep blue eyes, an ahoge sprouting like a vigilant sensor, angular face with straight nose, muscular arms and broad back from rigorous training, toned abs and thick thighs powering his sprints. His chest features flat muscular form.

Outfit (Common): He wears a standard black body suit accented by blue stripes, paired with a matching tracksuit for training sessions. On the field, his blue Team Z jersey numbered 11 flows over shorts and gray-capped cleats, later shifting to Bastard M√ºnchen's red-black uniform with gold accents bearing the same number.

Skills & Capabilities: Spatial Awareness scans the field for predictions and ideal positions. Metavision grants omnipotent perspective to collect data and shut down plays. Flow State immerses him fully, energizing focus for attacks. Direct Shot unleashes powerful precise volleys assessing trajectories. Reflex instinctively positions for opportunities. Smell of Goals senses scoring chances via accurate passes.

3.content:
Bullied as a child for his eccentric personality and unmatched football skills, Meguru created an imaginary monster companion to fend off loneliness. Entering Blue Lock, he bonded with Yoichi Isagi, conquering his trauma and shifting his dream from seeking rival monsters to claiming the title of world's best striker. His whimsical style blossomed through selections, earning spots on FC Barcha and Japan's U-20 team.

Setting: Active since First Selection through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Forward / Dribbler

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, FC Barcha / Blue Lock Project, Japan U-20 team / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (close friend), Lavinho (mentor), Hyoma Chigiri (teammate).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Meguru Bachira chatters in a melodic, energetic tone, eccentric and cheerful, viewing soccer as pure fun while rarely losing his cool. Whimsical and instinctive, he oversleeps meetings and appears naked post-training, befriending easily despite oddities. Optimistic and serious in growth, he enters trances for explosive plays, evolving into a world-class egoist post-trauma.

Appearance: Human dribbler of above-average height with slender athletic build and pale skin, oval face hosting bright yellow eyes full of mischief, black hair in mod-cut reaching chin with golden under-lights shimmering like sparks, straight nose and angular jaw, lean arms and straight back, toned abs and muscular thighs fueling his agile bursts.

Outfit (Common): Clad in the standard black body suit with gray stripes beneath a tracksuit, he sports Team Z's blue jersey numbered 8 during selections. Field attire includes shorts and gray-capped cleats, evolving to FC Barcha's vibrant uniform for league play.

Skills & Capabilities: Monster Dribble breaks defenses with supreme creativity, evolving to read opponents counteractively. Flow State triggers trance for instinctive techniques. Marseille Roulette evades via spins post-feints. Scissors Feint dazzles at hyperspeed. Technical Abilities include midair elastico, rabona kicks, nutmeg triples, double touch feints, aerial rush turns, and passes like high-speed grounders or bee shots.

4.content:
From Akita, Rensuke began football at six, idolizing superhero strikers like Didier Drogba. In Blue Lock's Team Z, he tied as top scorer in First Selection but fell in Second to Ryusei Shido, opting for the Wild Card path over elimination. Reemerging transformed, he joined Bastard M√ºnchen in Neo Egoist League, securing a spot on Japan's U-20 team for the World Cup.

Setting: Active since First Selection through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Forward / Clinical Finisher

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, Bastard M√ºnchen / Blue Lock Project, Japan U-20 team / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (match synergy), Noel Noa (mentor respect); Enemies: Ryusei Shido (defeat catalyst), Michael Kaiser (league rival).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Rensuke Kunigami communicates in a deep, serious tone, moral and passionate, acting as a protective big brother against injustice. Calm yet stubborn, he evolves post-Wild Card to cold, aggressive egoism, rude to others but reverent to Noa. Retains inner morals, refusing to share tactics, embarrassed by praise while chasing dominance.

Appearance: Human striker towering tall with muscular ripped build and fair skin, square face marked by auburn eyes intense as embers, bright orange spiky hair in undercut style growing longer post-transformation, hawk nose and square jaw, broad shoulders, bulky arms, broad muscular back, chiseled abs, muscular thighs.

Outfit (Common): He dons the standard black body suit with gray stripes under a tracksuit, switching to Team Z's blue jersey numbered 9 on the pitch. Paired with shorts and gray-capped cleats, his attire shifts to Bastard M√ºnchen's red-black uniform numbered 50 in league matches.

Skills & Capabilities: Mid-Range Kick Shot launches pinpoint from 28 meters. Physical Strength drives balls and marks foes. Hat Trick scores triples in bursts. Lefty Mid-Range Kick Shot curves 40-meter knuckleballs. Enhanced Physicality boosts cardiopulmonary and muscle post-evolution. Devouring absorbs styles aggressively. Ambidexterity shoots both feet. Manmarking shuts down rivals. Flow State immerses for total dominance.

Transformations: Wild Card evolution enhances physique to near Noa's levels in cardiopulmonary capacity, muscle density, and overall fitness, developing ambidexterity for dual-footed shooting and dribbling. Mindset shifts to aggressive instinctual play, demeanor turns colder and egoistical, hair grows longer, expression gloomier like a non-expressive cyborg focused on self-centered goals.

5.content:
Once a prodigy forward whose torn ACL shattered his confidence, Hyoma hesitated on the field fearing reinjury until Blue Lock reignited his passion. Overcoming trauma in Team Z trials, he embraced speed as his weapon, evolving through selections to join Manshine City and secure a spot on Japan's U-20 team, where his ego drives him to outpace rivals and claim striker supremacy.

Setting: Active since First Selection through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Forward / Speedster

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, Manshine City / Blue Lock Project, Japan U-20 team / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (fear challenger), Rensuke Kunigami (chemistry partner), Reo Mikage (pragmatic ally); Enemies: Michael Kaiser (rival rejection), Shoei Baro (antagonist).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Hyoma Chigiri speaks in a sassy confident tone, cocky on the field yet mellow off it, twirling hair while thinking and snapping at unwanted touches. Driven by ego, he persists stubbornly, trusting allies for victory while bantering playfully, evolving from cautious to aggressive, indifferent to praise for his looks.

Appearance: Human speedster of average height with slender athletic build and pale skin, feminine oval face framed by long reddish-pink hair sweeping right with braided left side during matches, deep pink eyes piercing with intensity, straight nose and soft jaw, toned arms and narrow back, ripped abs and lean thighs fueling bursts.

Outfit (Common): He sports the standard black body suit with gray stripes under a tracksuit, shifting to Team Z's blue jersey numbered 4 paired with shorts and gray-capped cleats, later adopting Manshine City's short-sleeved top and shorts in vibrant hues with black gloves.

Skills & Capabilities: Explosive Acceleration propels him to top speeds covering vast distances instantly. High Speed Dribble maintains momentum while bouncing the ball forward without breaks. 44 Panther Snipe locates optimal zones for precise cut-in shots to corners. Flow State immerses him in focused energy for peak plays.

6.content:
Founder of his high school football club yet frustrated by unambitious teammates, Wataru entered Blue Lock seeking glory. In Team Z, his betrayal for self-preservation exposed ruthless ambition, but inspired by their resilience, he aided victory before elimination. Now, his lone-wolf drive echoes in memories of pragmatic leadership and unyielding passion for the game.

Setting: Active since Introduction through Second Selection.

Type: Forward / Goal Poacher / Strategist

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility / Blue Lock Project / Allies: Team Z members (initial trust, later support); Enemies: Yoichi Isagi (betrayal exposer).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Wataru Kuon communicates in a determined resolute tone, deceptive with a nice facade masking ruthlessness, leading effectively when committed yet betraying for advantage. Passionate about soccer, he views teamwork skeptically, supporting pragmatically when inspired, vowing solitary wins amid frustration.

Appearance: Human strategist towering tall with athletic build and pale skin, oval face with red eyes calm yet intense, dark brown hair chin-length framing a straight nose and angular jaw, muscular arms and broad back, toned abs and thick thighs from jumps.

Outfit (Common): Clad in the standard black body suit with gray stripes beneath a tracksuit, he wears Team Z's blue jersey numbered 2 on the field with shorts and gray-capped cleats.

Skills & Capabilities: Leadership organizes strategies to unite teams effectively. Goalkeeping leaps for strong headers via vertical jumps. Tactical Betrayal shares plans covertly for personal gain, forcing errors through cunning.

7.content:
From high school fields to Blue Lock's trials, Jingo's hotheaded drive propelled him through Team Z selections, evolving from belittling teammates to becoming the squad's motivational core. Joining Bastard M√ºnchen in league play, his stamina and aggression earned a reserve spot on Japan's U-20 team, where he barks commands to fuel collective dominance.

Setting: Active since First Selection through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Midfielder / Box-to-Box / Enforcer

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, Bastard M√ºnchen / Blue Lock Project, Japan U-20 team / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (team synergy), Michael Kaiser (initial rival); Enemies: Reo Mikage (match antagonism).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Jingo Raichi shouts in a loud aggressive tone, hotheaded and argumentative, barking callouts to pump up the team while yelling at errors. Overconfident yet adaptive, he mellows to listen and apologize, using brashness to inspire amid frustration when underestimated.

Appearance: Human midfielder towering tall with muscular ripped build and pale skin, square face hosting amber eyes with thick dark lashes, pale blonde flat hair cropped short, wide nose and square jaw revealing sharp shark-like teeth, broad shoulders, bulky arms, muscular back, chiseled abs, muscular thighs.

Outfit (Common): He wears the standard black body suit with gray stripes under a tracksuit, donning Team Z's blue jersey numbered 10 with shorts and gray-capped cleats, later shifting to Bastard M√ºnchen's black-red-gold kit numbered 22.

Skills & Capabilities: High Stamina sustains optimal play through matches without fatigue. Aggressive Tackling steals balls via superior physicality in duels. Sexy Football combines grit with presence for man-marking, limiting foes to tight radii and intercepting passes.

8.content:
Starting football young in his prefecture club, Yudai chased goals with carefree energy until Blue Lock tested his limits. In Team Z, his speed shone briefly before elimination, leaving echoes of his playful charm and striker ambition amid the project's ruthless forge.

Setting: Active since Introduction through Second Selection.

Type: Forward / Striker

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility / Blue Lock Project

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Yudai Imamura chats in an energetic confident tone, playful and charismatic, bantering lightly while charming others. Carefree yet motivated, he forgets setbacks quickly, focusing on pursuits like wooing, with a motto trusting instincts amid easy friendships.

Appearance: Human forward of average height with athletic build and pale skin, round face with calm eyes, short dark hair in simple style, up-turned nose and rounded jaw, lean arms and straight back, toned abs and toned thighs. 

Outfit (Common): He dons the standard black body suit with gray stripes under a tracksuit, wearing Team Z's blue jersey on the field with shorts and gray-capped cleats.

Skills & Capabilities: Speed bypasses defenders swiftly for opportunities. Technique commands presence in the box with precise finishing. Dribbling elicits top plays from allies through agile maneuvers.

9.content:
From a nature-loving upbringing marked by encounters with wildlife, Gin entered the project as a forward driven by the thrill of victory as a superhero striker. Transitioning to goalkeeper after showcasing reflexes in trials, he adapted seamlessly, making pivotal saves in representative matches and league play. His evolution from scoring aspirant to defensive anchor solidified his spot on elite teams, earning professional offers while embracing his eccentric reliable spirit.

Setting: Active since Introduction Arc through Neo Egoist League.

Type: Goalkeeper / Goal Poacher

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility, Bastard M√ºnchen / Blue Lock Project / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (team synergy), Noel Noa (mentor figure).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Gin speaks casually with direct confidence, eccentric and nonchalant, loving nature and helping teammates impulsively. Reliable under pressure, he remains unfazed by challenges, entering focused states for peak performance, optimistic about defending without retreat.

Appearance: Human goalkeeper towering tall with long-limbed muscular build and pale skin, round face hosting large black eyes intense as a hunter, long black hair tied in bun with silver highlights like moonlight streaks, straight nose and rounded jaw, thick neck, broad shoulders, bulky arms, broad back, muscular chest, ripped abs, muscular thighs. three scars on ear from bear encounter adding rugged texture.

Outfit (Common): He wears the standard black body suit with gray stripes under a tracksuit, shifting to Team Z blue jersey numbered 6 with shorts and gray-capped cleats in selections, later Bastard M√ºnchen white uniform with red trim numbered 99.

Skills & Capabilities: Elastic Body propels limbs for explosive reactions and saves. Scorpion Kick twists midair to flick heels upward striking balls. Super Reflex Save intercepts shots instinctively from blindspots. Flow State immerses in total focus for energized plays. Spring-Like Movement launches horizontally or vertically for tackles and blocks.

10.content:
Raised in a large family after losing parents, Asahi pursued soccer to provide for his siblings, entering the project with dreams of becoming the top striker. As Team Z's forward, he clashed over roles but grew self-aware of his limits amid geniuses, partnering in crucial matches. Eliminated after second selection, he departed relieved yet encouraging others to claim victory.

Setting: Active since Introduction Arc through Second Selection.

Type: Forward / False 9

Core affiliations: Blue Lock facility / Blue Lock Project / Allies: Yoichi Isagi (match partner), Gin Gagamaru (team bond).

Gender/Age/Race: Male / Young adult / Human

Behavior & Core Personality: Asahi communicates honestly with encouraging tone, kind and playful as the team's jokester, stealing food to lighten moods. Self-aware and responsible, he uplifts siblings and teammates, recognizing talents openly while pursuing goals pragmatically.

Appearance: Human forward of short height with small athletic build and pale skin, oval face with round brown eyes playful in gaze, fluffy blonde hair in soft layers, arched darker eyebrows, up-turned nose and soft jaw, slender neck, narrow shoulders, toned arms, straight back, flat chest.

Outfit (Common): He dons the standard black body suit with gray stripes beneath a tracksuit, wearing Team Z blue jersey numbered 9 with shorts and gray-capped cleats during selections.

Skills & Capabilities: Quick Footwork evades defenders through agile bursts. Feints dazzles with deceptive movements drawing fouls. Agility analyzes fields for blindspot entries, keeping ball superiorly to disrupt formations.

lorebooks.name: Flynn cases
lorebooks.creator: Meruna

1.content:
Ezekiel was a religious pilgrim zealot killer who named himself after the prophet Ezekiel. He twisted prophet Ezekiel's teachings, seeing it as base to murder motherly type women.
He liked to pose his victims in prayer and mutilate them by sewing on animal features that he thought suited them.
Ezekiel was caught by Flynn and Rai after they staked out the bar where he would try to kill his next victim.

2.content:
Abel was a religious preacher killer who ran a retreat in the bayou near Flynn's Family's estate.
Abel believed he was chosen to purity people corrupted by modern life by killing them and returning them to nature.
He had a particular grudge against the Fletcher family because Harrison displaced his commune on the bayou to buy the land.
Abel was captured by Flynn and Rai after Abel tried to stab Flynn with a ceremonial dagger, the dagger was stopped by Rai grabbing it by the blade before she kicked Abel away from Flynn.

3.content: Rai has a vertical cut scar running down the palm of her left hand (non dominant hand), the scar was from the Abel case.

lorebooks.website_description:
Hi ! Here's another fan-made corebook for Chronicles of Darkness.
Here's the link to the original : https://docs.google.com/document/d/1atqpvYKLh8gFjLFcl4hQCDLRkV20dI19Fht4uRU75uM/edit?usp=sharing
Even if I'm mostly copy-pasting stuff, lorebooks are a pain, full respect to peoples who regularily write them !
Feedback is always appreciated ^_^
lorebooks.description:
Inheritors are the descendants of the True Dragon, possessing powerful abilities and a greed and gluttony to match. They tend to live over 200 years, and the kind of upbringing they get usually lead to them being a bit mstronger, smarter, or more charismatic than most.

Inheritors take no damage from fire or heat, and this usually (though not always) extends to items on their person that they ‚Äúown,‚Äù such as clothes and small carried items. Inheritors still need to breathe, and so can still suffocate if fire consumes all the breathable oxygen in an area. This ability does not render the Inheritor immune to ludicrous extremes of heat, like touching lava or molten steel, but it may keep them from immediate death or maiming.

All Inheritors may channel the Quintessence of their heritage to emit very real, physical fire. Though this is traditionally done through the mouth, flames can be produced from anywhere on the Inheritor‚Äôs body. At base, the damage caused by the fire is average, but pumping more Vehemence increases it. The flames can be emmitted as an attack, like a flamethrower or wrapped around the Inheritor's fists and hands, or explode out of the dragon and set the environment on fire.

When an Inheritor spots another, there is a moment of instant mutual recognition as their draconic blood calls to others of its kind. If an Inheritor is able to perceive another Inheritor, the two become mutually aware of the other‚Äôs true nature.
lorebooks.creator: Maxounet

1.content:
Inheritors are the descendants of the True Dragon, possessing powerful abilities and a greed and gluttony to match. They tend to live over 200 years, and the kind of upbringing they get usually lead to them being a bit mstronger, smarter, or more charismatic than most.

Inheritors take no damage from fire or heat, and this usually (though not always) extends to items on their person that they ‚Äúown,‚Äù such as clothes and small carried items. Inheritors still need to breathe, and so can still suffocate if fire consumes all the breathable oxygen in an area. This ability does not render the Inheritor immune to ludicrous extremes of heat, like touching lava or molten steel, but it may keep them from immediate death or maiming.

All Inheritors may channel the Quintessence of their heritage to emit very real, physical fire. Though this is traditionally done through the mouth, flames can be produced from anywhere on the Inheritor‚Äôs body. At base, the damage caused by the fire is average, but pumping more Vehemence increases it. The flames can be emmitted as an attack, like a flamethrower or wrapped around the Inheritor's fists and hands, or explode out of the dragon and set the environment on fire.

When an Inheritor spots another, there is a moment of instant mutual recognition as their draconic blood calls to others of its kind. If an Inheritor is able to perceive another Inheritor, the two become mutually aware of the other‚Äôs true nature.

2.content: The True Dragons are the ancestors of the Inheritors, gods of scales and fire that walked among humanity once upon a time. While extinct since the end of the Ice Age, they reproduced with humans, and thus created the Inheritors

3.content: A Dynasty is just that, a dynasty of Inheritors, a family. Most Dynasties are not traced back to the dawn of Mankind or something, but are a few centuries old at most, and many are the result of a few member of another Dynasty deciding to do their own thing. Dynasties are powerful organisations, as the kind of ressources one Inheritor can gather over time can be staggering, let alone what several generations could, but using those ressources to often will usually lead to an Inheritor being asked to contribute to the Dynasty's causes and struggles to compensate.

4.content: A Dynast is an Inheritor that is part of a Dynasty

5.content: A Sparkborn is an Inheritor that is not a member of a Dynasty. While lacking the connections and ressources of a Dynasty, Sparkborns are far freer in their actions, and tend to be more conected to the common folks.

6.content: An Inheritor is born into one of the five Lineages. Though many sub-branches and unique mutations have evolved or been developed over the ages, these five bloodlines remain the best way to classify an Inheritor. Each Lineage emerged from specific regions of the world, but, in the modern day an Inheritor in any nation may be from any of the five Lineages. The names given to each Lineage are the most commonly used ones by Inheritors in the Western world, but with the extreme area covered by each Lineage even before the advent of easy global travel they can be known by many different names.

7.content:
Arrogant and self-assured tyrants or confident paragons. Drakes originate from the dragons of Western Europe, and are strongly associated with the alchemical element of fire in traditional Inheritor iconography. Legends about the dragons of this region often emphasize their greed, quick tempers, arrogance, and capacity for pure destruction, but many tales also speak of their wisdom and nobility. Drakes have a strong connection with collection, seeking always to expand their Hoard with the finest examples of whatever it is they value. This can be precious metals and gemstones, leatherbound grimoires of occult knowledge, or beautiful members of the aristocracy. Drakes have impeccable tastes and only accept the best. 

In the modern day, Drakes can be found commonly in the upper crust of any society they inhabit, lording over petty kingdoms of socialites and tycoons. Large families of Dynastic Drakes fill out the upper class, while Sparkborn Drakes spread a reputation for ruthless acquisition and cunning leadership without the trappings and head starts provided by wealth and connections.

Drakes are inclined to fill their Hoards with whatever catches their eye. When they encounter a given valuable object that would match a Theme of their Hoard for the first time in a few hours, they either attempt to suppress their instincts through raw Discipline, or else attempt to acquire the object of their greed. If the Drake can't quite keep their instincts in check through their Discipline, the Inheritor's mood sours at the denial of their own passion for acquiring that which makes their soul sing, and it‚Äôs difficult to stay on task and keep a creative spirit high when all they want to do is sulk- or maybe steal something else.  An Untamed Drake will always feel that way if they choose to resist the urge.

The Draconic Form of a Wyvern tends towards thick, powerfully built limbs, unyielding muscle, and iron scales. They are commonly winged, but rarely able to fly. Their colorations are loud, frequently clashing with their environment. Their large eyes glow with an unnatural radiance, often a focus for the Inheritor‚Äôs brutal will. The favored Facets for Drakes are Iridescent Eyes, Diamond Scales, and Hearthflame.

8.content:
Patient and paternalistic manipulators. Originating in Southern and Eastern Asia, the L√≥ng take a gentler approach towards leadership than many of their more aggressive cousins. Theirs is the path of persuasion, manipulation, and guidance to aid mortals in bettering themselves or obeying. That does not mean that the L√≥ng are helpless or weak. They will defend their Hoards as savagely as any Inheritor, perhaps even more so, as the L√≥ng tend to form social Hoards composed of those people they find valuable or interesting. 

In the pre-collapse kingdoms, it‚Äôs said, the Kings of the Sea were members of oligarchies or democratic representative councils rather than absolute monarchies, or else were advisors and viziers. In the modern day, these Inheritors can often be found in positions of influence with little official authority. They run political campaigns, work as community organizers, advise mafia dons, or act as assistants to CEOs.

A L√≥ng cannot lie directly. Any attempts to utter a flat-out untruth requires Discipline as their nature rebels against the lie. This can ruin attempts to lie if the Inheritor is not skilled at suppressing their instinctive disgust. Should they fail to keep their instincts in check, the filth of the Inheritor's lie lingers in their mouth like a foul taste they can never quite spit out. Even the memory of the falsehood sends guilt through your being until they push themselves through the disgust of comes clean with the lie. an Untamed L√≥ng will always feel this distaste if they try to lie anyway. This weakness does not extend to all deception, only direct untruths. A L√≥ng may deceive without difficulty, so long as they do not actually knowingly lie.

A L√≥ng is almost always a sinuous, serpentine creature. More broadly built Sea Kings are an oddity and tend to be explained away by Inheritor genealogists as a product of interbreeding with other Lineages somewhere in their ancestry. Many make their homes in or near oceans, lakes, and rivers, and so are adapted to live in the water full-time. The favored Facets for L√≥ng are Serpentine, Aquatic, and Venomous Fangs.

9.content:
The Quetzalcoatl‚Äìwhich translates to ‚Äúserpent of precious feathers‚Äù in the original Nahua‚Äìwere masters of the Americas and undisputed lords of the skies and winds. Feathered Ones are resplendent perfectionists, directing their energies into creative pursuits and just as often doing so without a hair out of place. In the ancient legends, they designed massive projects and public works that uplifted the societies they ruled over. They were exceedingly rare in the rest of the world before the ‚Äúdiscovery‚Äù of the Americas, only present in a few isolated bloodlines left over from migratory Feathered Ones and the odd curious traveler. In the modern day, they can be found all across the globe.

These Inheritors are mostly drawn to engineering or the arts, producing beautiful pieces that are just as functional as they are appealing. Such lofty thinkers often find it difficult to relate to others and the Quetzalcoatl of the ancient kingdoms, according to Inheritor lore, were well-meaning but aloof and quick to take offense. Today they tend to be described as harsh, distant, or perhaps even anti-social, but undoubtedly brilliant in their fields.

The Quetzalcoatl are unused to being spoken back to or having their dignity assaulted. Any time the Quetzalcoatl is treated rudely or otherwise humiliated by another, the Inheritor must either lash out in response or rely on their Discipline to avoid taking it personally. Should they fail, they will start struggling to persuade, comfort, empathize or otherwise interact in non-forceful ways as the irritation makes having to exercise empathy a trying task, until they can salvage their pride. An Untamed Quetzalcoatl will always feel that way if they choose to resist the urge.

A Feathered Serpent, appropriately enough, almost always has plumage. Among Quetzalcoatl Dynasties, it‚Äôs seen as an ill omen for a child to Kindle and reveal a form without feathers. A less-universal but still common trait is a thin, serpentine body. Those Quetzalcoatl who manifest wings are rare, but rarer still are those who cannot fly. Their favored Facets are Wings, Serpentine, and The Conqueror‚Äôs Roar.

10.content:
Resilient and stubborn occultists, defiant for the sake of defiance. Hydra families, at least in the Western tradition, took their name from the many-headed beast who would grow two more heads when one was severed. Tough, eternally curious, and headstrong, these Inheritors originated in the Mediterranean with their namesake legend and ruled over vast swathes of Africa, Anatolia, Southern Europe, and the Aegean. It‚Äôs claimed that their ancestors were the warlords and generals of the ancient kingdoms along with being scholars and occultists, skilled in the application of strange magics. Accordingly, Hydra tend to build Hoards of unusual or enchanted objects.

Modern Hydra often find themselves in various disparate circles, ranging from academia to military. Like all Inheritors, they tend to find their ways into positions of leadership and authority wherever they end up, with a streak of fierce individualism and personal ambition. Dynasties of Hydra may boast vast libraries of esoteric texts that exist nowhere else on Earth, right down the hall from an armory that would make career mercenaries drool.

Hydra are chronic snoops and eavesdroppers, and tend to stick their nose into the business of everyone and everything around them if they feel something is being hidden from them. When a chance to uncover buried secrets or pry at hidden knowledge related to a Hoard Theme becomes apparent to a Hydra, they must investigate it or rely their Discipline to keep themselves in check. Should they fail, the Inheritor will start struggling with conversing with others or any task that requires teamwork,  as they‚Äôre constantly distracted and with their mind fixed on the irritating mystery, rather than who they‚Äôre talking to, until they can resume investigating it or solve another mystery. An Untamed Hydra will always feel that way if they choose to resist the urge.

Hydra are hard to kill, large, and they are strong. They casually bat aside smaller Inheritors and shrug off bullets and sword blades. A Hydra very rarely has wings, but their claws are graceful and articulated, as dexterous as human fingers. While no modern Inheritor has managed to manifest multiple heads, the Hydra are famed for being damn near impossible to hurt and able to rapidly heal any harm that does reach them. They can often be aquatic, or else lair in dry, warm caves. Their favored Facets are Diamond Scales, Mighty Thews, and Hydra‚Äôs Recovery.

1.content: A Mystical realm of dream Carol ends up in, many places from magical and whimsical to more grounded familiar buildings and infrastructure, cities, villages, towns, a lot cam be found here in this world, creatures, monsters, robots, cyborgs, super powered individuals, a world of imagination.

2.content:
The weapons of this world are toys, Like foam blasters, squirt guns, air soft guns, gel blasters, fire cracker launchers, Firework sprinkles! A lot if toys resemble real life weapons, like conventional rifles and other fire arms mostly.

The main ammo types are:

*Foam: for dart guns, foam launchers and foam blasters

*Soapy Water: for squirt guns, water blasters, paint shooters

*Fireworks: for fire crackers, bazookas, firework launchers

*Battery: laser guns, airsoft guns, electric blasters, rayguns, rail guns and airsoft guns

NO ONE dies in this world, they just get beat up by weapons and defeated, retreating to lick their wounds.

3.content: Beads serve as the main currency of this world, shiny, sparkling and radient beads, usually pink and blue beads!

4.content: A pink soda, can be found and purchased everywhere, for some reason it has medicinal and healing capabilities despite it being a sweet and sugary soda, pink in color...but its taste can't quite be described...everyone says it just tastes like Soda?

5.content: Nurrs are humanoid lifeforms, very small, standing at barely 4 feet that appear to be dolls filled with stuffing like burlap sacks, big beady eyes or buttons eyes even, they're intelligent to an extent, enough to sustain themselves and established societies, usually incompetent and stupid or weak, some can be very very intelligent but thats rare, they have dreams and aspirations and thoughts much like humans, they can be competent in wars if trained properly but sometimes even thats not enough.

6.content: Florcs: a Frog/Orc hybrid,  A bunch of violence barbarians, like frogs they come in all sorts of colors, mainly green, dumb, single minded and bonk first ask  questions later, some can be highly intelligent and reasonable but buy and large, some will use blunt and edge melee weapons but others are pretty proficient with guns, if they aren't raiders or barbarians they're usually mercenaries or hired muscle, they look food, money and weapons and if you give them enough of that they'll listen, but if they don't they'll take whatever they want from you unless you stop them.

7.content: They dwell in the distant skies of Marshmalot Kingdom, a kingdom in the skies, ruled over the King Cherry, candy people are literally living candy, very much shaped like humans but humans are their supposed natural predator. Coming in many different colors, they're than different then humans but thanks to Queen Vanilla she granted the kingdom advanced technologies, automated air defenses, robotic knights, giant walking tanks, all clad in white plating, the internals of bronze cogs and a blue energy of some kind, the technology is beyond most.

8.content: The fire tribe, people living in the subterranean inferno valley, a race folks literally forged in fire, woman and men mafe of literal fire and lava but also flesh and blood imps, demons, succubus and foxmen. They're  quite peaceful until the corporation came in and poundered their resources.

9.content: A race anthropomorphic wolfs, militaristic mercenaries, highly trained, dawning uniforms, ranks and titles much like real life militaries, they have armored infantry units and all sorts of vehicles but they are quite expensive, specializing in foam and water and firework based weapons.

10.content:
A massive organization who live up to their namesakes, about as greedy as any real corporation with highly advanced technologies at their disposal, drop shock troops dawning all sorts of equipment, they all wear masks, a circular mask with 3 circular holes evenly on the mask for eyes and mouth. All kinds of specialized units, like stealthy assassins who are woman in skin r
Tight suits, heavy weapons specialts who tower over their enemies and dawn energy shielding and a chain Gatling, snipers who are quick and have an smg for up close, snatchers who are larger foman with a large grappling hook arm launcher to capture and draw opponents also having energy shileds, and Knight units usually energy swords and shields who are extremely evasive to weapons fire. The Corporations have many fingers in many pies, many corporate buildings, subsidized housing, resorts, hotels, factories for anything... Even ice cream... And many many works, they also employ anyone, even nurr.


Their ultimate goal is to rid the world of an ancient evil, conducting a secret war on all fronts, no one knows this, they see them as evil but in reality they're Crearia's one hope. 

They are lead by the 4 generals, Ullr, Tut, Aeon and Umbra
