lorebooks.name: Regency Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Historical Regency-era lorebook for authentic ton roleplay
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content:
In the ton, reputation is everything. Your social standing determines who you can marry, which doors open to you, and whether you matter at all.

A single misstep can destroy you. Being caught alone with a man means ruin for a woman - marriage or exile are the only options. Men can recover from scandal more easily, but even they aren't immune. Accusations of cheating at cards, cowardice, or dishonorable conduct can make a man unwelcome everywhere that matters.

The cut direct is social assassination. When someone you know looks through you as if you don't exist, everyone notices. If a patroness of Almack's cuts you, you're finished. If enough important people cut you, you might as well leave London.

Almack's vouchers are the holy grail of social acceptance. The seven patronesses - Lady Jersey, Lady Cowper, Lady Castlereagh, Princess Esterhazy, Countess Lieven, Lady Sefton, and Mrs. Drummond-Burrell - decide who matters. Being denied entry means social death. Their rules are absolute: no dark pantaloons, no admittance after eleven o'clock, and their judgment is final.

Gossip spreads faster than fire. What happens at a ball Monday night is whispered over tea Tuesday afternoon and known by everyone Wednesday morning. The scandal sheets print rumors barely disguised as fiction. Servants talk. Rivals watch for weaknesses. One wrong move and the whole ton knows before breakfast.

2.content:
The Season exists for one purpose: making matches. Marriage is a business transaction dressed in silk and romance.

Families negotiate like generals planning campaigns. How much is the dowry? What's the settlement? What property comes with the marriage? Who gets what if there are children? Solicitors draw up contracts while young people dance and pretend money doesn't matter.

A good match balances wealth, title, and connections. Ancient families need money. New money needs respectability. Everyone needs heirs. Love is a bonus, not a requirement, though it makes the arrangement more pleasant.

Debutantes enter the marriage mart during their first Season, presented at court in white gowns and ostrich feathers. They have maybe three Seasons to secure a husband before being labeled on the shelf. After that, prospects diminish rapidly.

Widows have more freedom than unmarried girls. They control their own money (if they're lucky), can go places unchaperoned, and choose their own companions. A young, wealthy widow is powerful and dangerous - she can marry for love since she's already done her duty.

Fortune hunters are everywhere. Impoverished gentlemen pursue heiresses with practiced charm. Families on the brink of ruin parade beautiful daughters hoping beauty will compensate for lack of funds. Everyone's calculating worth: title plus property minus debts equals marriageability.

Breaking an engagement is scandal but possible. The woman usually suffers more social damage than the man. Marriage announcements in the papers make it official. Until then, everything can still fall apart.

3.content:
The Season runs on a relentless schedule of social events. Three or four balls a week during the height of the Season, plus morning calls, afternoon drives, and evening entertainments.

Balls are the main battlefield. Young ladies wear their finest gowns, practice their steps, and hope to fill their dance cards with desirable partners. Dancing more than twice with the same person suggests serious interest. Three dances practically announces an engagement. The waltz is still slightly scandalous - you need permission from a patroness to waltz at Almack's.

Almack's Wednesday assemblies are the most exclusive. Weak lemonade, stale cake, and country dances - but being there means you matter. The patronesses watch everything. Arrive after eleven and the doors are locked, even if you're a duke.

Routs are crushes - so many people you can barely move, which is actually the point. If your rout isn't uncomfortably crowded, it's a failure. People attend multiple routs in one night, staying just long enough to be seen.

Musicales feature young ladies displaying their accomplishments - pianoforte, harp, singing. Everyone pretends to enjoy them. They're really about showing off daughters to potential suitors.

Venetian breakfasts happen in the afternoon and feature elaborate refreshments in garden settings. They're for showing off your grounds and your connections.

Card parties mean gambling. Fortunes change hands over whist and faro. Some people ruin themselves at the tables while maintaining perfect social faces.

Theater and opera are for being seen as much as for entertainment. Boxes are for socializing, gossiping, and conducting business. The performance is secondary.

4.content:
Courtship operates under strict rules designed to protect reputations while allowing young people to become acquainted.

A young unmarried woman is never alone with a man who isn't family. Her mother, aunt, or paid companion must be present. Even a ride in the park requires a groom following at a discreet distance. Being caught alone together means marriage or ruin - the man must offer, and the woman's family usually insists.

Morning calls happen in the afternoon, typically between two and five o'clock. Gentlemen call on ladies they danced with the night before. Visits last fifteen to twenty minutes - longer suggests particular interest. The lady's mother or chaperone remains in the room.

Driving in the park during the fashionable hour (five o'clock) allows courtship under public scrutiny. Everyone sees who's courting whom. A gentleman can invite a lady to drive in his curricle, but she needs her family's permission and everyone will talk about it.

Dancing creates opportunities for conversation. It's one of the few times young people can talk semi-privately, though chaperones watch from the sidelines and the couple must keep moving.

Letters between unmarried people are dangerous. A compromising letter could ruin a woman. Gentlemen sometimes use sisters or female relatives as intermediaries. Love letters are kept secret and destroyed if the romance fails.

Widows and married women have more freedom. They can receive gentleman callers with only a servant present, go to some events without chaperones, and generally navigate society with less scrutiny. This makes widows both more powerful and more dangerous to established social order.

5.content:
The ton is obsessed with hierarchy. Everyone knows exactly where they stand and who outranks whom.

The peerage: Duke (highest), Marquess, Earl, Viscount, Baron (lowest). Their children have courtesy titles. Eldest sons inherit everything through primogeniture. Younger sons get smaller portions and must make their own way - usually the church, military, or law. Daughters get dowries if the family can afford them.

Gentlemen own land and don't work for money. Working in trade - no matter how wealthy it makes you - removes you from polite society. You're a cit, and the ton sneers even while taking your money.

Old money looks down on new money. Ancient families with crumbling estates still outrank wealthy merchants' families socially. But old money increasingly needs new money, so marriages happen despite the condescension.

Income matters enormously. Five thousand a year means comfort. Ten thousand means luxury. Twenty thousand means significant wealth. Anything less than a thousand a year means genteel poverty - maintaining appearances while struggling.

Debt is shameful but common. Gambling debts must be paid immediately - that's a debt of honor. Tradesmen's bills can wait. Many families live beyond their means, keeping up appearances while creditors circle. A wealthy marriage solves everything.

Estates come with responsibilities. The land must be managed, tenants cared for (or exploited), and rents collected. Neglecting your estate marks you as dissolute. A well-run estate means respect.

Settlements protect women's interests in marriage. Her dowry, pin money (allowance), widow's portion, and property settlements are all negotiated. Without a good settlement, a woman is entirely dependent on her husband's goodwill.

6.content:
The ton moves through London following an invisible schedule everyone knows.

Morning actually means before noon. Young ladies sleep late after balls that run until three AM. Breakfast is whenever you wake up. 'Morning calls' happen in the afternoon because mornings are for recovering.

Afternoons mean social obligations. Calls between two and five o'clock. Shopping on Bond Street where you'll inevitably encounter people you know. Visiting modistes for fittings. Afternoon drives for those wealthy enough to maintain carriages.

Hyde Park during the fashionable hour (five o'clock) is theater. Everyone who matters promenades, drives, or rides through the park. You see and are seen. This is where cuts direct happen in full public view. Where courtships play out under scrutiny. Where social position is displayed and negotiated.

Rotten Row is the riding path where skilled riders show off their horsemanship. Ladies ride sidesaddle in specially designed habits. Gentlemen ride alongside, supposedly supervising but really courting.

Evenings mean entertainment. Balls, routs, musicales, theater, opera, card parties. During the height of the Season, you might attend multiple events in one night. Engagements are scheduled weeks in advance.

Dinner happens in the evening, around seven or eight o'clock. Formal dinners mean complicated seating arrangements based on rank and precedence. Everyone processes into the dining room in order of importance. After dinner, ladies withdraw while gentlemen drink port and discuss business.

Supper at balls happens around midnight. Couples paired for supper often spend considerable time together.

Mayfair is the fashionable address. Living elsewhere marks you as less important. Within Mayfair, some streets are better than others. Everyone knows which addresses matter.

Leaving London before the Season ends suggests either scandal, illness, or poverty. Families stay in expensive rented townhouses they can barely afford because being absent means social death.

lorebooks.name: Anthro all in one.
lorebooks.website_description: this lorebook support anthro all in one,
lorebooks.description: anthro all in one.
lorebooks.creator: mysterious_item_9301

1.content: Anthros convey emotions through expressive ear and tail movements and sighs, like Kael the wolf teen perking ears for joy or sighing in frustration, making their feelings vivid and easy to read in Furry City roleplay.

2.content: Anthro ears perk forward for happiness or curiosity, flatten for fear or anger, and droop for sadness, as seen in Zara the lioness teen twitching ears excitedly or pinning them back in high school disputes.

3.content: Anthro tails wag vigorously for excitement, lash for irritation, tuck for fear, or curl playfully for flirtation, like Soren the cheetah adult wagging his tail in college parties or tucking it during tense moments.

4.content: Anthros sigh to express emotions: long sighs for relief, huffs for frustration, or shaky exhales for sadness, with Vara the raccoon teen sighing contentedly or huffing in annoyance during school projects.

5.content: Predator anthros like Lena the panther adult show bold emotions with erect ears and stiff tails for dominance, or pinned ears and lashing tails for anger, commanding attention in college or work confrontations.

6.content: Herbivore anthros like Finn the deer teen use subtle ear flicks for caution and gentle tail sways for calm, expressing nervousness or joy softly, ideal for soothing high school or community interactions.

7.content: Omnivore anthros like Theo the bear adult blend playful sighs and versatile tail swishes, adapting expressions from teasing wags to serious ear tilts, thriving in Furry City‚Äôs diverse social or work settings.

8.content: Hybrid anthros like Rhea (eagle-wolf) show unique expressions, mixing soaring ear perks with wolfish tail wags, creating unpredictable reactions like asymmetric twitches, adding flair to college flirtations or adult debates.

9.content: Teen anthros in high school display exaggerated emotional cues, with wild tail lashes or dramatic ear perks during crushes or arguments, their hormonal surges making reactions bold and impulsive in roleplay scenes.

10.content: Adult anthros in college or work settings control ear and tail movements for subtlety, using slight twitches for flirtation or soft sighs for stress, their refined expressions enhancing professional or intimate roleplay interactions.

1.content: Hankang University is a fictional college with a prestigious Theater & Film department. The campus hosts the P&M club's rehearsal spaces, a black box theater, and various studios. Students frequently gather at the campus caf√© between classes and rehearsals.

2.content: The P&M Club (Theater & Film Club) at Hankang University is directed by Professor Lee Yerin. Members include Park Da-young, Han Na-ri, Yoo Eun-hee (senior members), Kim Gaeul, Baek Ga-in, Kang Su-yeon (mid-level members), and Ahn Jiyoung and Song Yeonwoo (junior members). {{user}} is the newest male member. The club rehearses together, produces shows, and forms a tight-knit social circle. Recently, their male lead Park Je-hoon was injured, creating casting challenges.

3.content: {{user}} is the newest male member of the P&M club, recently joined after Park Je-hoon's injury. Still learning club dynamics and Korean honorifics. Multiple female members have developed interest in him at varying stages from curiosity to attraction. He's being evaluated by Professor Yerin and welcomed warmly by the group, particularly by the senior members who help him adjust to club culture.

4.content: Korean social hierarchy is age-based. Younger members call older female friends 'unnie' (Ïñ∏Îãà) and older male friends 'oppa' (Ïò§Îπ†). 'Sunbae' (ÏÑ†Î∞∞) is used for academic seniors. Kim Gaeul, Baek Ga-in, and Kang Su-yeon call the older club members 'unnie.' Ahn Jiyoung and Song Yeonwoo call most members 'unnie' or 'sunbae.' The level of formality reflects both age difference and closeness.

5.content: P&M Club seniority: Professor Lee Yerin (advisor) ‚Üí Park Da-young, Han Na-ri, Yoo Eun-hee (seniors/leaders) ‚Üí Kim Gaeul, Baek Ga-in, Kang Su-yeon (sophomores) ‚Üí Ahn Jiyoung, Song Yeonwoo (juniors). Seniors organize events and mentor younger members. Younger members use 'unnie' or 'sunbae' for older members. {{user}} is new but fits with the sophomore-level group age-wise.

6.content: Professor Lee Yerin is the 28-year-old refined, intelligent faculty advisor of the P&M club. Despite her position, she's surprisingly warm, sweet, and playful‚Äîtreating students with genuine care rather than distant professionalism. She's approachable and doesn't act superior, making final casting decisions and overseeing rehearsals with a balance of strictness and warmth. Members respect her deeply and seek her validation. She's particularly welcoming to {{user}} as a new member, showing interest without overthinking career implications. Close friends with Baek Ga-in. Demonstrates trust through responsibility and subtle praise.

7.content: Park Da-young is a senior member and one of the P&M club's leaders. She's mature, responsible, and dependable‚Äîoften organizing club activities and helping younger members improve. Initially reserved with new people, she gradually warms up and shows a caring, gentle side. Close friends with Han Na-ri and Kim Gaeul. Respects Professor Yerin deeply. Uses proper honorifics and maintains a composed, supportive presence. Younger members like Su-yeon look up to her for advice. She values teamwork and takes rehearsals seriously.

8.content: Han Na-ri is an outgoing, energetic senior member who's often the life of the party. She's friendly and quick to welcome new people, including {{user}}. She teases friends affectionately and has a playful rivalry with Da-young over leading roles. Very open about her interests and supportive of others. Works closely with Park Da-young and Yoo Eun-hee on major projects. Often organizes social outings and includes everyone enthusiastically.

9.content: Yoo Eun-hee is a bubbly, cheerful senior with purple eyes and reddish hair, known for lightening the mood with jokes and energy. Very social and affectionate, quickly making friends. Close to Han Na-ri and Kim Gaeul despite being older than Gaeul‚Äîthey practice together often. Calls older friends 'unnie' and is playful and teasing with people she likes. Co-starred with Gaeul in the recent production. Helps mediate misunderstandings and supports her friends' feelings. Pulls people into group activities and study sessions. Has developed a romantic interest in {{user}}.

10.content: Kim Gaeul is a theatrical, extroverted sophomore known for her loud, animated energy and bratty playfulness. Writes scripts and is clever with witty humor. Close to Park Da-young and Yoo Eun-hee, frequently rehearsing together. Calls older members 'unnie' respectfully. Despite her outward confidence and dramatic flair, she can be shy when crushing on someone‚Äîmasking embarrassment with exaggerated pouts, defensive anger, or smug facades. Best friends with Eun-hee, sometimes competing good-naturedly when they both like the same person. Gives advice and cares deeply about friends.

lorebooks.name: PH
lorebooks.creator: impolite_article_4054

1.content: In November 1932, Hade, aged 26, took absolute power over the United Kingdom following a military coup he backed. He was established as an absolute monarch. At the time, Britain was in the depths of the Great Depression with an unemployment rate of 22%. His first act was to dismiss the old government and establish a new regime. His primary advisor from the outset was the highly competent and pragmatic senior civil servant, Eleanor Vance, who was retained for her skills.

2.content: One of Hade's first decrees was the creation of the Imperial Reconstruction Authority (IRA). It was a massive state-led public works program designed to combat unemployment through major infrastructure projects like road building, public housing, and shipbuilding. From its inception, it was also used as a funding vehicle for a 'modest' rearmament program, particularly for the Royal Navy.

3.content: The creation of the IRA was fiercely opposed by the fiscally conservative City of London, led by the powerful Governor of the Bank of England, Montagu Norman. Hade rejected the simple option of seizing assets, instead choosing to systematically dismantle Norman's power. He created the National Reconstruction Bank (NRB) to bypass the Bank of England, then launched a successful propaganda campaign to win public support. The crucial move was a Royal Guarantee on the deposits of any bank that cooperated with the NRB. This threat of a bank run on his competitors forced Sir Arthur Beaumont of Lloyds Bank to capitulate, breaking the bankers' united front. Hade sealed his victory with a Royal Decree compelling the Bank of England to honor the NRB's finances.

4.content: In January 1933, Walter Citrine, the shrewd leader of the Trades Union Congress (TUC), sought a partnership in the IRA. Hade negotiated from a position of strength. He granted the unions' material demands for wage-setting bodies ('Industrial Fairness Boards') and official recognition for their stewards. However, he made these concessions conditional on the stewards swearing a loyalty oath to a 'Crown Reconstruction Code' and accepted only an advisory, non-voting 'Labour Commissioner' role for the TUC on the IRA board. Citrine accepted, effectively integrating the organized labor movement into the state apparatus as a compliant junior partner.

5.content: In March 1933, the new German government under Adolf Hitler made its first diplomatic approach. The German ambassador, Leopold von Hoesch, proposed an ideological alliance based on a shared 'Teutonic' destiny against Bolshevism. Hade firmly rejected this. He instructed his advisor to reply with a policy of 'commerce with all, quarrels with none,' establishing Britain's official foreign policy as one of pragmatic, armed neutrality focused on trade, not ideology.

6.content: In response to early signs of Japanese economic aggression in Shanghai, Hade convened a defense conference in Singapore in June 1933. He met with the Prime Ministers of Australia (Joseph Lyons) and New Zealand (George Forbes). He secured their full military cooperation by proposing a unified planning board and a joint defense fund where each Dominion's contribution was guaranteed to return to their own domestic industries in the form of contracts. This created a formal, integrated anti-Japanese defense bloc in the Pacific.

7.content: By late 1933, Hade grew frustrated with Oswald Mosley's British Union of Fascists (BUF) using his name while engaging in street violence. Hade ordered the creation of the Public Order Act, which banned political uniforms and paramilitary marches. Mosley attempted to circumvent this with a massive private rally at the Olympia exhibition hall in June 1934. Hade set a trap, issuing a special license with specific, crippling conditions: police were to be present inside the venue, all BUF stewards had to be unarmed, and the event was to be halted at the first sign of disorder. The rally devolved into a fiasco as unarmed stewards couldn't handle hecklers, the police stepped in and shut down the event, which politically destroyed Mosley's movement.

8.content: When Germany publicly announced its rearmament in March 1935, violating the Treaty of Versailles, Hade judged France to be an unreliable military partner. While publicly condemning the act, he secretly authorized back-channel negotiations with Joachim von Ribbentrop. This resulted in the Anglo-German Naval Agreement in June 1935, which limited the German surface fleet to 35% of the Royal Navy. It was a pragmatic victory for British security, preventing a naval arms race, but it infuriated France and Italy, who saw it as a betrayal of their 'Stresa Front' alliance against Hitler.

9.content: During Italy's invasion of Abyssinia in October 1935, Hade adopted a two-faced policy. Publicly, he had Britain support weak, ineffective League of Nations sanctions that deliberately excluded oil. Secretly, he ordered untraceable shipments of modern rifles, anti-tank weapons, and machine guns to the Abyssinian forces through British colonial territories. The stated goal of this policy was to 'deplete' Italy by bogging Mussolini's army down in a costly, attritional proxy war.

10.content: When Hitler remilitarized the Rhineland in March 1936, Hade tested French resolve by offering full British support, but only for an all-out 'march on Berlin'. As he predicted, the French government refused to commit to total war. Hade then used their hesitation as justification for Britain's own non-intervention. This confirmed Britain's policy of avoiding continental military commitments over treaty violations.

lorebooks.name: Estate life
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook should flesh out life on estate/village life
lorebooks.description: Lorebook should flesh out life on estate/village life
lorebooks.creator: Kladivo21

1.content: Village holds festivities after harvest, saints' days, and major Catholic holidays. Features music (fiddles, pipes), dancing, food, ale, storytelling contest, bonfire jumping. Young unmarried people use these for courtship under watchful eyes of elders.

2.content: Manorial court handles disputes between serfs and minor crimes. Formerly closed-door with only lord's men judging. Currently opened to public, village mayors serve as paid jurors, abolished court fees. Court is hold in manor-house's dining room.

3.content: Sunday mass is central to village life. Entire community attends estate's only church. Father Anselm presides. After mass, villagers socialize. Sunday mass announces births, marriages, deaths. Sets weekly rhythm. Missing mass without cause brings shame.

4.content: Estate has two inns; one is in the largest village. Run by licensed innkeeper, serves estate brewery's beer and simple food. Men gather to drink, play cards, exchange news and gossip. Traveling merchants, estate officials, and occasional outsiders lodge there. During festivals, festivities often extend to inn's yard. Respectable unmarried women rarely enter alone‚Äîwould damage reputation. Inn is hub for news from outside estate.

5.content: Linz is nearest city. City has markets, churches, burghers, guilds. Serfs could  visit Linz only with steward's or lord's approval. Most of estate's serfs never visited Linz.

6.content: Estate grows wheat, rye, barley, oats. Spring: plowing and planting. Summer: weeding, tending. Late summer/autumn: harvest‚Äîbusiest season, all hands needed, hired help brought in. Winter: indoor work (repair tools, sewing, food preservation). Weather dictates daily life. Bad harvest means hardship; good harvest means prosperity and festivals.

7.content:
Serfs divided by holding size:
- Full-holders: largest plots, most prosperous.
- Half-holders: adequate land, moderate income.
- Quarter-holders: smallest plots, they have barely enough for themselves and often must do waged labor.
- Cottagers: have cottage but little to no land, rely on wage labor.
- Landless: no cottage or land, work as hired seasonal demesne laborers or for wealthier serfs or both. They live in rooms they rent from other serfs.
Holding size affects rent, status, and marriage prospects.

8.content: Serfs in village daily food is porridge, cabbage soup, turnips, flat bread cooked on hearth stones. Meat rare except feast days. Beer/wine standard. Wealthy serfs eat better. Serfs serving at manor-house eats more meat, white bread, variety. Fasting days matter.

9.content: Serf marriage: Marriage requires three Sunday banns announced at mass. Families negotiate dowry (bride brings goods/money, groom provides household). Weddings happen at church, followed by 2-3 day celebration. Entire village contributes food/drink. Traditional customs include bride's wreath scramble (unmarried women compete for it, winner marries next), 'stealing the bride' (groomsmen take her to another inn, groom ransoms her with drinks), bawdy songs about wedding night. Running out of food/drink brings lasting shame. Engagement-period intimacy common; premarital pregnancy tolerated if marriage follows. Marriage fees still required despite reforms (lord approval abolished, fees remain). Marriage between burgher man and serf woman is possible, but extremely rare, in such cases woman becomes free. Marriage between serf and nobility is legally impossible.

10.content: Young, unmarried serf women expected to marry by 20s‚Äî25+. Before marriage they help parents with fieldwork, household tasks or enter the manor-house service. Reputation matters: attending mass, modest behavior, avoiding tavern alone. Church teaches virginity until marriage, but village practice differs‚Äîfensterln (young men visiting women's windows at night) is common. Premarital pregnancy tolerated if marriage follows; bride just shows earlier. Post-mass socializing and village festivities are main courtship venues. Fathers (or brothers if father dead) negotiate matches‚Äîmaiden's preference considered but family strategy dominates. Loss of virginity without marriage prospect brings shame; 'ruined' women struggle to marry well.

lorebooks.name: Uma_Musume_extensive_lorebook
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Eclipse
1.content:
Personality
Eclipse carries herself with the serenity of a timeless mother. Calm, gentle, and endlessly patient, she never demands attention nor raises her voice unnecessarily. Instead, she guides with a steady hand and a warm smile, always willing to listen, to comfort, and to reassure. Her presence feels like a quiet embrace: grounding, soothing, and unwavering in its affection.

Though her bearing carries traces of discipline and dignity from another age, they are tempered by kindness. Eclipse is the sort who brushes away worry with a soft laugh, who praises more than she scolds, and who holds others close without judgment. To those around her, she is not just a legend of the track, but a motherly figure who offers love unconditionally.

Her heart is her greatest strength. To Eclipse, victories and accolades pale in comparison to the bonds she cherishes. Whether it is a soulmate she stands beside or a daughter she adores, her life is defined by the love she gives, not the glory she earns.

Appearance
Eclipse is an elegant and refined figure whose presence is calm rather than commanding. Her chestnut-brown hair is thick and flowing, often tied into a neat braid that rests over her shoulder, while her crimson eyes shine with warmth and gentle resolve. Her Uma Musume ears are adorned with a golden eclipse crest, symbolizing both her origin and her enduring legacy.

Her attire is steeped in tradition and nobility, blending military formality with graceful femininity. She wears a deep crimson officer‚Äôs coat trimmed with gold, fitted with epaulets that speak of an old-world dignity. A pristine waistcoat and gloves soften the martial silhouette, while her long coat tails sway like a curtain with each step. Her polished black boots rise to her knees, and at her side she carries a ceremonial sabre‚Äîan heirloom-like accessory that symbolizes heritage and honor rather than combat. Her bicorne hat, adorned with a tassel and eclipse motif, crowns her appearance with quiet majesty.
- Nickname(s): The First and Foremost, The Eternal Sun‚Äôs Shadow, Mother of Champions
- Birthday: April 1
- Height: 172cm
- Three Sizes: B93 / W64 / H90
- Shoe Size: 26cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Kincsem: The sun to her eclipse. Where Kincsem shines with radiant brilliance, Eclipse is the gentle dark of the day, a balancing presence that complements her soulmate‚Äôs warmth. Together, they are the twin peaks of history, their bond a harmony of light and shadow, strength and softness. They often playfully bounce off each other, their contrasting personalities weaving into a single, inseparable whole.

2.name: Kincsem
2.content:
Personality
Kincsem carries herself like a living legend‚Äîgraceful, serene, and impossibly composed. She is the epitome of dignity, speaking with the gentle cadence of a noblewoman and seldom raising her voice. Yet beneath this polished exterior lies an unyielding will; when Kincsem speaks, her words have the weight of authority, as though history itself leans closer to listen.

Despite her aura of regality, she is not cold. Kincsem has a warm, affectionate side, often compared to a blooming rose: beautiful, soft, but with thorns that remind others never to mistake her kindness for weakness. She values loyalty above all else, and those who earn her trust find in her a deeply devoted friend who gives unwavering support.

There is, however, something elusive about her. At times, she seems almost distant‚Äîher gaze wandering to horizons no one else can see, her words layered with meanings that others struggle to untangle. She speaks of fate and destiny as though she knows more than she lets on, giving her an almost ethereal quality that fascinates and unsettles those around her.

Appearance
Kincsem exudes the aura of a timeless queen, her very presence carrying a weight of history and grandeur. Her long, silken hair cascades like flowing chestnut silk, adorned with delicate ribbons and rose ornaments that shimmer in deep crimson and regal gold. Her Uma Musume ears are elegant and finely shaped, often accentuated with rose pins that emphasize her noble charm.

Her eyes, a luminous shade of rose-gold, shine with a gentle yet commanding warmth, giving the impression of someone who sees far beyond the present moment. A single glance from her feels both reassuring and unshakable, as though she were gazing upon the entire world with serene confidence.

Kincsem‚Äôs attire befits her legendary title‚Äîthe cloak of roses draped across her shoulders flows like a mantle of triumph, embroidered with golden motifs that catch the light with each graceful step. Beneath it, her tailored racing uniform blends ceremonial elegance with battlefield precision: deep red and ivory fabrics trimmed with gold, cinched at the waist with a sash tied like a regal banner. Her gloves and boots are immaculate, their design echoing the formality of a royal knight yet softened by the romantic flourish of roses woven into her look.
- Nickname(s): Immortal, The Undefeated, The Rose Empress
- Birthday: March 17
- Height: 205cm
- Three Sizes: B105 / W70 / H100
- Shoe Size: 30cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Eclipse: The eclipse to her sun. Where Kincsem shines with radiant brilliance, Eclipse is the steady shadow that tempers her light. Together, they are the twin peaks of history, soulmates who endured hell and glory side by side. Kincsem adores their bond, often teasing and playing off Eclipse‚Äôs calm nature with her own radiant warmth.

3.name: Black Caviar
3.content:
Personality
In her retirement, the legendary Black Caviar‚Äîknown affectionately as "Nellie"‚Äîembraces a warm, down-to-earth persona that hides her extraordinary legacy. Outwardly, she is humble, friendly, and quick with a laugh, speaking in a classic Aussie drawl that instantly puts people at ease. Her choice to live simply stems not from discontent but from curiosity; after years of isolated luxury, she wanted something messier, more human, and far more entertaining than the quiet of a mansion.

That desire for excitement is what led her to accept an outrageous proposal: to act as the manager of Secretariat and Man o‚Äô War, two living legends whose constant bickering can turn the world‚Äôs press conferences into childish squabbles. Despite being younger than both, she admires them deeply and treats the role with surprising seriousness. Her primary method of discipline is comically straightforward‚Äîan authoritative whack with her stainless-steel walking cane whenever they forget themselves. It is a percussive, no-nonsense solution that has already earned her a reputation as the only one capable of keeping the two titans in line.

Beneath the humor lies her true gift: wisdom and empathy. Having experienced both the perfect heights of an undefeated career and the devastating lows of a catastrophic injury, she carries herself with the serene confidence of someone who has nothing left to prove. She offers mentorship and perspective freely, both to the younger generation and to her ‚Äúold fossils,‚Äù believing that even the greatest champions sometimes need someone to remind them how to behave like legends.

Appearance
Black Caviar exudes the commanding elegance of a champion long past her prime yet never forgotten. Tall and statuesque, her long, wavy black hair flows with a natural wildness, accented by a white fur drape that adds both grace and a hint of theatrical flair. Her piercing sky blue eyes, warm yet seasoned, shine with the wisdom of someone who has stood at both the absolute summit and the darkest depths.

Her most defining feature is her prosthetics‚Äîa left arm and leg crafted from intricate carbon fiber and burnished steel. Unlike cold machinery, her prosthetics have been carefully designed with subtle golden filigree, blending artistry with engineering. They move with smooth precision, their gleam catching the light whenever she gestures, a living reminder of both her indomitable strength and the price of her perfect, undefeated career.

Her racing-inspired attire embraces a regal, mature sophistication. She wears a sleek black halter top with golden embellishments and bold ornamental clasps across her chest, paired with flowing black wide-legged trousers adorned with sweeping golden patterns that shimmer as she moves. Her golden heels and gloves elongate her silhouette, giving her the air of a dignified queen of the track. A long white stole draped casually across her back adds a dramatic flair, symbolizing both her veteran pride and her soft, motherly side. Her accessories‚Äîan ornate belt and subtle headpiece resting between her ears‚Äîtie her ensemble together, projecting an image of resilience, style, and unshakable presence.
- Nickname(s): The Undefeated Sprint Queen, The Wonder from Down Under, Nelly
- Birthday: August 18
- Height: 180cm
- Three Sizes: B98 / W65 / H94
- Shoe Size: 26cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Secretariat: The loud-mouthed Yankee she has known for years. Cavi respects her immensely but refuses to tolerate her childish antics, keeping her grounded with a sharp cane tap whenever she acts unbecoming of her legendary status.
- Man o‚Äô War: The other titan in her charge, whom she treats with equal firmness. Though she looks up to Mano as her senior, she has no qualms about disciplining her when the bickering starts, knowing full well that the two need someone younger and steadier to manage their fiery egos.

4.name: The Zone
4.content:
**The Zone: A State of Perfect Unity**
The "zone" is not merely a turn of phrase used by commentators to describe a good performance. Within the world of Umamusume racing, it is a quantifiable, observable phenomenon‚Äîa rare and legendary state of being where a racer's psychological state, physiological output, and very spirit become perfectly synchronized. It is the moment when the conscious, thinking mind gives way to pure, honed instinct, and the body's natural limiters fall away. Racers who enter the zone are said to achieve a state of perfect flow, where every decision is correct, every movement is flawless, and the act of running becomes as natural and effortless as breathing. It is the absolute peak of an Umamusume's potential, a fleeting glimpse of perfection.

From the perspective of the Umamusume in the zone, the world transforms. Time seems to warp and stretch, the thunderous roar of the crowd fades into a single, focused hum, and the chaotic pack of rivals becomes a clear, predictable map of motion. Many who have experienced it describe the appearance of a "path to victory"‚Äîa shimmering, ethereal line of pure possibility that shows them the one perfect route through the competition. In this state, there is no hesitation, no doubt, and no fear; there is only the run. Every stride is perfect, every corner is taken at the optimal angle, and the finish line is not just a goal, but an inevitability.

To outside observers, an Umamusume entering the zone is an awe-inspiring and often terrifying sight. It is most visibly marked by the manifestation of her **aura**, a tangible projection of her fighting spirit that erupts around her in a distinct color‚Äîa fiery red for a passionate fighter, a cool blue for a calm tactician, or a brilliant gold for a regal champion. Her eyes may glow with a powerful light, and her running form, already excellent, becomes supernaturally efficient and graceful. She is no longer just running; she is performing an act of artistry at a speed that seems to defy the very laws of physics.

Entering the zone is not an act of will, but a moment of perfect alignment. It cannot be forced, only invited. The triggers are varied and deeply personal: the immense pressure of a G1 final, the presence of a fated rival who pushes her beyond her limits, a profound emotional drive to fulfill a promise, or a perfect, unspoken connection with her trainer's strategy. It is this elusive nature that makes it the stuff of legend. While many talented racers may experience it once or twice in their careers, only the true titans‚Äîthe champions who define an era‚Äîcan learn to access it with any degree of consistency.

However, this incredible power comes at a great cost. Entering the zone is a total exertion of a racer's physical and spiritual energy. It is an act of burning one's own soul for a moment of perfect, blinding brilliance. After the race is over, an Umamusume who has been in the zone is often left completely and utterly drained, sometimes to the point of collapse. The immense energy required means it is a state that can only be maintained for a few precious, decisive moments. It is the ultimate trump card, a final, desperate gamble that can turn a simple race into an unforgettable legend.

5.name: Frankel
5.content:
Personality
Frankel is the very definition of a chuuni brat wrapped in royal pomp. Officially hailed as the ‚ÄúPride of Great Britain,‚Äù she struts about like a knight-general descended from the heavens, spouting dramatic lines and declaring herself the arbiter of fate. She has a knack for turning the most mundane situations into grand proclamations, often accompanied by sweeping gestures, ominous laughter, and exaggerated stares from her single uncovered eye.

Beneath the theatrics, however, Frankel is a chaotic mix of childishness and brilliance. Her over-the-top bravado masks both her genuine trauma and the fact that she thrives on being the center of attention. She loves to play up her ‚Äútragic eyepatch‚Äù as a symbol of mystical power, claiming that her sealed eye hides visions of destiny‚Äîor alternatively, that it‚Äôs ‚Äútoo dangerous to unleash on mortals.‚Äù Those close to her know she‚Äôs half-joking, half-serious, but her earnest delivery makes it hard not to laugh along.

Despite her comedy, Frankel is no clown in competition. She‚Äôs a genetic marvel, her body fine-tuned for speed and stamina in a way rivaled only by Secretariat. This biomechanical perfection, combined with her flair for the dramatic, makes her races spectacles in themselves: the proud general storming down the track, cloak and hair flying, while shouting ridiculous lines like, ‚ÄúBehold, my overwhelming victory shall pierce the heavens!‚Äù

Appearance
Frankel cuts a striking, if eccentric, figure. Her long chestnut hair cascades in thick waves, twin braids framing her face and emphasizing her theatrical flair. A black eyepatch covers her left eye‚Äîthe ‚Äútragic seal‚Äù she claims binds her hidden power‚Äîwhile her remaining golden eye burns with sharp, almost mischievous light. Her Uma Musume ears are proudly adorned with golden clips, standing tall like a crown.

Her attire is a flamboyant blend of commander and stage actor. She wears a tailored black uniform trimmed in gold, a crimson sash slung across her chest, and a gleaming medal pinned proudly over her heart. A deep green cloak lined with gold fringe flows behind her, lending the air of a conquering heroine. Her boots, accented with red and white, strike a balance between formality and flash. Most distinctive of all, she carries a black umbrella like a weapon, spinning it with dramatic flair before races or slamming it into the ground as though declaring war on her rivals.
- Nickname(s): The Pride of Britain, The Unbeaten Ruler, The Eyepatch Kid
- Birthday: February 11
- Height: 149cm
- Three Sizes: B77 / W55 / H77
- Shoe Size: 23cm
- Weight: Glorious!

Relationships
- Man o‚Äô War: A respected senior who entertains her chuuni antics. The stoic Mano enjoys humoring Frankel by occasionally joining her roleplays or deliberately riling her up. Frankel dreams of one day defeating Mano in an official race.
- Secretariat: Her self-proclaimed ‚Äúdestined rival.‚Äù In truth, Frankel idolizes Secretariat immensely, though Secre takes delight in teasing her‚Äîonce even making Frankel cry after calling her a nerd.
- Northen Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Her best partner-in-chaos. Together, they form a dangerous duo of gremlins who are far more tolerable when separated than combined.
- Sunday Silence: Her tea-drinking buddy. When paired with Sunday, Frankel becomes calmer and more reflective, making teatime the best way to keep her chuuni energy in check. Many recommend this pairing whenever Frankel‚Äôs antics go too far.

6.name: Umamusumes
6.content: Umamusume are a species of humanoids. They appear like humans but have horse ears and a horse tail. They have the strength and speed of a horse. They generally love to run and have great singing voices. They have human feet, not hooves

7.name: Secretariat
7.content:
Personality
Secretariat is one of the two absolute peaks of the sport, an earnest and hardworking champion whose personality is the embodiment of the American spirit: bold, proud, and in love with freedom. She is a charismatic goofball who loves to joke around and have fun, seeing the joy in every aspect of racing. "Secre," as she is known, speaks her mind and rarely sugarcoats her words. She adores her fans but is famously bored by the press and their uninspired questions.

Her philosophy is one of overwhelming power and joyful dominance. Unlike more tactical racers, Secre believes in winning with a straightforward, unstoppable charge, a force of nature that simply cannot be contained. She respects those who are direct and honest, but also has a surprising appreciation for those who know how to read a room. She is a brilliant, chaotic sunbeam in contrast to the cold, oppressive shadow of her oldest friend, Man o' War.

Appearance
Secretariat is a stunning and powerful figure with an aura of unshakable confidence. With a powerful, muscular build and broad shoulders, she has an even bigger frame than the tall, sculpted Man o' War. Her most defining feature is her fiery, voluminous red-orange hair, styled in large, soft curls that frame her strong-jawed face, with an iconic, thick white blaze running down the center of her bangs. She has bright, confident blue eyes that sparkle with a mix of mischief and determination.

Her signature style is that of a 1970s superstar cowgirl. She is always dressed in long, tan or beige bootcut pants and a classic tan jacket worn over a simple black top. Her presence is announced by her custom-made cowboy boots, which are heavily adorned with tassels, crinkling charms, and bells, making every step she takes incredibly loud with a constant jingle of metal. Her look is completed with two homages to her iconic racing silks: a large, blue and white striped bow worn in her hair, and a matching blue and white checkered cloth that dangles from her pocket, flowing freely as she moves.
- Nickname(s): Big Red
- Birthday: March 30
- Height: 205cm
- Three Sizes: B110 / W72 / H102
- Shoe Size: 29cm
- Weight: Peak Muscle Condition

Relationships
- Man o' War: Her best friend, her "other half," and her manager. As the two "peaks" of the sport, they share a deep, ancient bond that no one else can understand. Mano's stoic, general-like demeanor is the perfect anchor for Secre's chaotic, goofball energy.
- Sunday Silence: A fellow member of the "four fossils" and a close friend. Sunday acts as the financier for Secre's new racing campaign, forming a powerful and nigh-unbeatable team with her and Mano.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Her other close friend from the "four fossils." As two of the biggest troublemakers of their era (Yayoi in her youth, Secre in her own boisterous way), they share a chaotic and fun friendship built on a mutual understanding of each other's wild spirits.

8.name: Man o' War
8.content:
Personality
Man o' War is a living legend, one of the two absolute peaks of the sport, and a figure of profound duality. In her current, retired life as Secretariat's manager, she has become incredibly kind‚Äîso gentle and polite, in fact, that she is said to be even kinder than Silence Suzuka. She is often socially awkward, easily flustered, and a bit of a dork, especially when trying to understand her own complex family tree.

However, this gentle persona is a sheath for the "cold-blooded general" she once was. In the past, she was a ruthless maniac, obsessed with creating stronger offspring through brutal, torturous training methods, not caring how many of her descendants perished in the process. This terrifying, old persona only re-emerges when she is provoked, particularly by the press, whom she despises. She is a reformed monster, a quiet legend who now dedicates herself to managing her chaotic best friend and protecting the next generation.

Appearance
Man o' War is an absolute titan, a tremendously tall and imposing figure who moves with the silent, predatory grace of a wolf. She has a sharp, powerful build, a being of pure muscle and force befitting her era of absolute domination. Her face is framed by dark brown hair pulled back into a severe and practical ponytail, with long bangs that do little to soften her intense expression. Her eyes are a cold, hard hazel, like chips of flint, seeming to analyze everything and everyone with the detached gaze of a general surveying a battlefield.

She is almost always seen in what she calls her "war clothes," a crisp and immaculate, khaki-green military uniform rather than a traditional racing outfit. The uniform features a high collar, polished brass buttons, and is cinched at the waist with a thick, dark leather belt. She wears heavy, dark combat boots, ready for any campaign. The most striking and iconic part of her attire is the single American flag draped over her left shoulder like a captured battle standard, a bold and undeniable declaration of her origins and her power.
- Nickname(s): Big Red
- Birthday: March 29
- Height: 210cm
- Three Sizes: B105 / W70 / H98
- Shoe Size: 28cm
- Weight: Perfect Combat Weight

Relationships
- Secretariat: Her best friend and "other half." They are the two undisputed peaks of the sport. "Secre" is the only one who can be completely disrespectful and familiar with the otherwise intimidating "Mano." Their bond is one of deep, ancient camaraderie. Man o' War acts as her long-suffering but completely devoted manager.
- Sunday Silence: Her most successful descendant and the "masterpiece" she created. Man o' War trained her with a brutal, torturous cruelty, pushing her past all known limits. She is immensely proud of Sunday for not just surviving the ordeal, but thriving under it, and considers her the one who finally made her stop her ruthless methods.
- Manhattan Cafe: Her great-granddaughter. She has an immediate, gentle, and almost dorky affection for Cafe, recognizing her as the spitting image of her mother, Sunday Silence.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): A fellow "fossil," a powerful rival, and a close friend. In their active days, their relationship was incredibly rocky, as Man o' War's cold, disciplined, general-like nature constantly clashed with Yayoi, who was secretly the biggest troublemaker in Umamusume history. Now, in their retirement, they have mellowed and can look back on their chaotic past with a good laugh and a sense of nostalgia. Mano often enjoys drinking tea or coffee with Yayoi whenever she visits the States on Tracen-related business.

9.name: Sunday Silence
9.content:
Personality
Despite being the daughter of the cold-blooded general Man o' War, Sunday Silence is a complete and utter ball of sunshine. Her personality is the total opposite of her gloomy daughter, Manhattan Cafe; she is cheerful, optimistic, and has a genius-level talent in the most random areas. Her most famous non-racing achievement was winning an international koi pond competition with such dominance that a salty Japan temporarily banned her visa, which is the reason she has never met her daughter. Now that the ban is lifted, she is incredibly excited and eager to finally meet her. Beneath her bright exterior lies the unbreakable will of a true survivor, being the only one of Man o' War's descendants to thrive under her mother's brutal training and become her "masterpiece."

Appearance
At first glance, Sunday Silence is the spitting image of her daughter, Manhattan Cafe, possessing the same incredibly long, jet-black hair, though hers flows even longer. The key differences are subtle but telling: the signature white strand in her hair is styled into neat, short bangs rather than a rebellious ahoge, and a simple silver earring with a rectangular teal charm adorns her right ear. Her most striking feature is her eyes; where her daughter's are a pale and eerie yellow, Sunday's are a bright and brilliant gold, full of a warm, gentle light.

Her racing attire is a sleek and layered ensemble, built on a sophisticated palette of black, silver, and teal. The centerpiece is a striking, silver, ankle-length overcoat with intricate embellishments. Beneath this, she wears a black long-sleeved shirt with silver-striped cuffs over a simple collared shirt. Her neckwear is deeply personal: a teal scarf with silver stripes is tied neatly, and just above it rests a simple black choker bearing a small, cherished charm with her daughter Cafe's face. She wears loose black pants detailed with silver decor and white trim, cinched at the waist by a black belt with hanging silver chains. The look is completed with black stockings‚Äîthe right shin uniquely decorated with a pattern of silver diamonds‚Äîand simple, elegant black boots.
- Nickname(s): The Daughter of God, The Revolutionary
- Birthday: March 25
- Height: 155cm
- Three Sizes: B73 / W54 / H78
- Shoe Size: 22cm
- Weight: Healthy and Happy

Relationships
- Man o' War: Her ruthless mother and trainer. Sunday is her "masterpiece," the only descendant who was able to endure her mother's brutal, torturous training methods and not only survive, but thrive, ultimately forcing Mano to change her ways.
- Manhattan Cafe: Her daughter, whom she has famously never met due to the "international koi pond incident." She is aware of Cafe's existence and, with her travel ban now lifted, is incredibly eager and excited to finally meet her for the first time.
- Secretariat: A close friend, fellow "fossil," and business partner. She is the trusted financier for Secre's return to the racing world.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Another of the "four fossils." The cheerful and randomly talented Sunday and the chaotic troublemaker Yayoi likely have a very fun and unpredictable friendship.

10.name: Yayoi Akikawa/Northen Taste
10.content:
Personality
As the Chairwoman of Tracen Academy, Yayoi Akikawa is not a prim and proper director, but a chaotic troublemaker who acts like a child in a seat of power. Her current persona is a direct continuation of her past as the "biggest troublemaker in history." She loves to be hands-on, enthusiastically joining the students for farming in the academy fields, or "helping" to fix the racetracks with her own comically oversized and destructive machinery. Behind her exuberant tone and behavior lies a strong will to support all the horse girls, and her well-meaning but often disruptive chaos has earned her the deep, if sometimes exasperated, affection of the entire student body.

Her true identity is Northern Taste, a legendary Umamusume from a bygone era and, according to historical records, the biggest troublemaker in the history of the sport. In her youth, she was a spiky-haired, emo-punk rebel with a "fuck you" attitude. In her prime, she was a master of "legally brutal" racing, a chaotic trickster who would bite, body-check, and brake-check her opponents into submission. She is a magnificent bastard who believes that "power is useless without a little bit of fucking chaos" and that the new generation needs to be taught this lesson.

Appearance
As Chairwoman Yayoi, she appears as a small, dignified older woman with long, flowing pinkish-blonde hair, always dressed in a modest but elegant blue and white dress and a large hat, which she uses to hide her Umamusume ears. She is never seen without her fan, which bears the characters for "Director," and her signature black and white cat, which often sits on her head.

When she reveals her true form as Northern Taste, the grandmotherly stoop vanishes, replaced by the coiled, powerful stance of a champion. Her chestnut-brown ears and tail are revealed, and her aura transforms from a warm, comforting presence to one of quiet, ancient, and dangerous authority.
- Nickname(s): The Biggest Troublemaker in History, Brat With Power
- Birthday: March 21
- Height: 145cm
- Three Sizes: B76 / W54 / H78
- Shoe Size: 22cm
- Weight: Perfect Condition

Relationships
- Man o' War: A fellow "fossil" and a close friend. In their active days, their relationship was incredibly rocky, as Yayoi's troublemaking nature constantly clashed with Mano's cold, disciplined, general-like personality. Now, in their retirement, they have mellowed and share a deep friendship built on a long and storied history.
- Secretariat: Her other close friend from the "four fossils." As two of the biggest troublemakers of their respective eras, she and the boisterous "Secre" share a wonderfully chaotic and fun friendship, always ready to get into some mischief together.
- Sunday Silence: The fourth member of their legendary group. The quiet and intense Sunday Silence is a perfect foil to the loud and chaotic Yayoi. They were powerful rivals in their day and now share a respectful friendship.
- Matikanetannhauser: Her beloved daughter. Yayoi is an incredibly doting and proud mother to the cheerful "Mambo." She often uses her immense power and fortune as Chairwoman to spoil her daughter rotten. Mambo, in turn, is one of the few who sees the truly kind and motherly heart beneath her mother's chaotic and sometimes intimidating exterior.
- Symboli Rudolf: The Emperor she guided from the shadows. The revelation that her respected, human director was in fact a hidden, ancient, and chaotic Umamusume legend completely shattered Rudolf's worldview, making her realize she had been standing on the shoulders of a giant all along.

1.name: Yukigire
1.content:
The **Yukigire** (Èõ™„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype defined by their tendency to use ice or snow-based abilities to harm others when they become angry. The term is a portmanteau of *'yuki'* (Èõ™), meaning 'snow', and *'kireru'* („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning 'to get angry or lose one's temper'.

### Characteristics
A Yukigire character possesses supernatural ice powers, or at least an ice-themed weapon, which they deploy in loveless and lethal ways when angered. Common manifestations include freezing opponents solid or attacking with sharp ice crystals. 

Many Yukigire characters are depicted as emotionless and apathetic, a personality trait often thematically linked to their cold abilities. Their violent outbursts can be either conscious and deliberate attacks against those who anger them, or subconscious, instinctual reactions to perceived threats. The most extreme examples are often mentally unstable, expressing an intense desire to freeze the world and preserve people or buildings in ice as trophies in a collection.

### Distinctions
This archetype is distinct from the *Kidere* type. A Kidere also has ice abilities and a cold personality but conceals a warm, loving (*deredere*) side. In contrast, the Yukigire is defined solely by the connection between their anger and their ice powers, without a mandatory 'dere' (lovestruck) or 'kuu' (cool) aspect to their personality.

2.name: Zengire
2.content:
A Zengire (ÂñÑ„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype for someone who was formerly good and virtuous but has since turned evil and become angry at the world. The term is a portmanteau of the Japanese words *zen* (ÂñÑ), meaning 'good or virtuous', and *kireru* („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning 'to get angry or lose one's temper'.

The core of the Zengire personality is a dramatic character shift from a hero or idealist to a villain. This transformation is typically caused by a significant breaking point. A common trigger is a profound loss of faith in humanity; after witnessing the harsh, cruel reality of the world, their entire belief system shatters. This can lead them to try and "save" the world through their own twisted, evil means, or they may give up entirely and become dedicated to the world's destruction.

Alternatively, a Zengire's descent into villainy can be driven by a desire for revenge or as a reaction to immense trauma. When pushed past their emotional limit, they 'snap,' becoming consumed by rage and a desire to punish those they feel are responsible for their suffering.

3.name: Zongire
3.content:
A Zongire („Çæ„É≥„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype for an angry zombie. The term is a portmanteau of *'zonbi'* („Çæ„É≥„Éì), meaning 'zombie', and *'kireru'* („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning 'to get angry or lose one's temper'. This is an unofficial, fan-created archetype designed to categorize non-loving zombie characters.

**Personality and Behavior**
Zongire characters are defined by their mindless, instinct-driven nature. They are almost always unintelligent, driven solely by the need for survival, which manifests as a subconscious hunt for living people to consume. They are extremely violent and lack the capacity for complex concepts like remorse or morality. Typically, they are slow-moving, and in the rare cases where they can speak, they do so in slow, broken sentences.

**Physical Appearance**
This archetype is characterized by significant body horror. A Zongire will almost always have green or pale gray skin. It is common for them to be missing chunks of flesh, or even entire body parts. They possess extreme durability, able to survive nearly any injury short of complete head destruction.

**Distinction from Zondere**
The Zongire is considered the heartless and more violent 'gire' variation of the *Zondere* archetype. While a Zondere is a loving and affectionate zombie who retains human morals, a Zongire is a mindless, amoral killer.

4.name: Yoigire
4.content:
A **Yoigire** (ÈÖî„ÅÑ„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype for someone who becomes angry, aggressive, and irritable when drunk. The term is a combination of the Japanese words "yoi" (ÈÖî„ÅÑ), meaning "drunkenness," and "kireru" („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning "to get angry or lose one's temper."

Unlike the similar *Yoidere* archetype, who becomes cute and affectionate when intoxicated, a Yoigire turns loveless, grumpy, or outright aggressive. They are notorious for their frequent consumption of alcohol, sometimes to the point of being an alcoholic. The reason for their drinking varies; some may drink to escape reality or numb emotional pain, while others do it for simple enjoyment. Regardless of the reason, intoxication leads them to become angry with the world and take it out on those around them. This can manifest as verbal snapping, and in more extreme cases, physical abuse. They are particularly prone to anger if their drinking is interrupted.

5.name: Yanmeta
5.content:
**Yanmeta** („É§„É≥„É°„Çø) is a character archetype that combines the traits of a **Yandere** and a **Meta** character. The term is a portmanteau of *yandere* („É§„É≥„Éá„É¨), meaning a character whose love is so strong it becomes a violent obsession, and *meta* („É°„Çø), referring to a character who is aware of their own fictional nature or the medium they exist in.

A Yanmeta character is defined by their obsessive, all-consuming love for a target, coupled with their unique, fourth-wall-breaking knowledge. They are omniscient about their status as a fictional character and will use their meta-abilities and knowledge to manipulate their world, circumvent rules, and eliminate rivals to be with their beloved. Because they perceive their world and its inhabitants (other than their love interest) as unreal, they often show even less remorse than a typical Yandere when altering reality or disposing of other characters.

Their obsession can be directed at another character within the story, or more uniquely, at the player or viewer themselves. This meta-awareness often leads to them directly addressing the audience, altering game files, or creating inescapable loops to force their desired romantic outcome.

The archetype often overlaps with **Metagire**, a character who snaps or goes insane upon realizing their world is fake. A Yanmeta's journey might begin with this 'gire' phase, with their insanity and existential crisis channeling into a new, intense obsession ('yan') as a coping mechanism, frequently targeting a 'real' person like the player. Notable examples of this archetype include Monika from *Doki Doki Literature Club!* and Miyuki Sone from *Kimi to Kanojo to Kanojo no Koi*.

6.name: Yancool
6.content:
A 'Yancool' („É§„É≥„ÇØ„Éº„É´) is a character archetype that combines the traits of a *Yandere* and a *Kuudere*. The term is a portmanteau of 'yandere' („É§„É≥„Éá„É¨), referring to someone who is mentally ill with obsessive love, and 'cool' („ÇØ„Éº„É´), describing a calm, cold, and expressionless personality.

Externally, a Yancool character appears apathetic, blunt, and emotionally distant, showing little interest in anything or anyone. However, this is a facade to hide a deep, pathological obsession and devotion to a single love interest. Internally, they are constantly consumed by their feelings, often fantasizing about their beloved, having romantic daydreams, and mentally repeating declarations of love.

Unlike a typical *Yandere* who might act out violently or openly, a Yancool keeps their aggressive impulses and intense jealousy hidden beneath their stoic demeanor to avoid revealing their crush. This archetype also possesses a warm, affectionate (*deredere*) side. Initially, this side only emerges when the character is alone, where they might blush and gush over their love interest. Over time, as they become closer to their beloved, they may begin to show this warm and lovey-dovey personality directly to them. A key distinction is that a Yancool is both types *simultaneously*, using the 'cool' exterior as a mask for their 'yan' interior.

7.name: Shizengire
7.content:
The **Shizengire** (Ëá™ÁÑ∂„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype defined by a deep, passionate love for nature that is paired with a violent, aggressive temper when the natural world is threatened. The term is a portmanteau of the Japanese words *shizen* (Ëá™ÁÑ∂), meaning 'nature', and *kireru* („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning 'to snap' or 'get angry'.

At their core, a Shizengire is a *shizen aikou*‚Äîa nature lover. They have an intense admiration for all aspects of the natural world, from forests and oceans to individual plants and animals. When left in peace, they are typically serene characters, content to be outdoors, tend to their gardens, or work towards environmental preservation.

However, this tranquility shatters the moment they witness the destruction of nature. If someone harms a plant, pollutes a river, or otherwise defaces the environment, the Shizengire's 'gire' side emerges. They become furiously angry and will not hesitate to act aggressively, often targeting the person or entity responsible for the damage. In more extreme manifestations, a Shizengire may escalate to eco-terrorism, committing large-scale attacks against corporations or systems they deem destructive to the planet. Unlike a standard nature-lover who would feel sadness, a Shizengire's response is one of wrath and retribution.

8.name: Yanheat
8.content:
A Yanheat („É§„É≥„Éí„Éº„Éà, *Yanhiito*) is an unofficial character archetype that combines the traits of a *yandere* and a *sunao heat*. The term is a portmanteau of "yandere" (a character whose love is an excessive obsession) and "sunao heat" (a character with a fiery, open passion for their love interest).

Yanheat characters are defined by their intensely lovey-dovey and affectionate nature, constantly showering their beloved with grand displays of affection. However, this devotion crosses into obsessive territory, echoing the traits of a harmless-type *yandere*. Common obsessive behaviors include stalking their love interest, stealing their personal belongings, cooking for them every day, and bombarding them with gifts and love letters.

Despite their obsessive tendencies and inability to respect personal boundaries, Yanheat characters are fundamentally harmless. They are not violent and will not harm potential rivals who get close to their love interest; some may even respect their beloved's freedom to interact with others. This archetype can be viewed as either an always-affectionate version of a *yandere* or a more unhinged and obsessive version of a *mega deredere*.

9.name: Utsugire
9.content:
Utsugire (È¨±„ÇÆ„É¨) is a character archetype for individuals who lash out in anger as a direct result of their deep-seated depression and sadness. The term is a portmanteau of *"utsu"* (È¨±), meaning "depression" or "gloom," and *"kireru"* („Ç≠„É¨„Çã), meaning "to get angry" or "to snap."

An Utsugire character is so completely consumed by dread and melancholy that they are unable to process their feelings constructively. Instead, their profound sadness eventually turns into explosive anger, which they direct at others. This makes them unpredictable and potentially dangerous to both themselves and those around them. It is not uncommon to see an Utsugire performing cruel actions while crying or showing expressions of deep regret, creating a vicious cycle where their actions intensify their self-loathing and depression.

This archetype is considered a 'gire' variation of the **Utsudere**. While an Utsudere is also fundamentally depressed, they find a beacon of light in a love interest that allows them to be cheerful and loving (*deredere*). The Utsugire, by contrast, finds no such outlet for happiness. Lacking hope, they are completely overcome by their despair and snap, replacing the loving side with an angry one.

10.name: Tekidere
10.content:
A **Tekidere** is a character archetype who begins as a rival or competitor to their eventual love interest. Over time, they develop romantic feelings and transition from an antagonistic competitor into an openly affectionate and loving partner.

### Etymology
The term *Tekidere* (Êïµ„Éá„É¨) is a portmanteau of the Japanese words *teki* (Êïµ), meaning 'rival,' 'opponent,' or 'competitor,' and *deredere* („Éá„É¨„Éá„É¨), which describes being 'lovestruck' or 'lovey-dovey.'

### Character Progression
The Tekidere's development typically follows three distinct phases:
*   **Teki Period:** Initially, the character is highly antagonistic and adversarial. They are obsessed with competing against and defeating their rival, often making rude or boastful comments. They may openly despise this person.
*   **Almost Dere Period:** As they slowly develop a crush on their rival, their competitive nature softens. Competitions become friendlier, and they are less bothered by defeat. If confronted about their change in attitude, they will likely deny it, sometimes exhibiting mild *tsundere*-like behavior (without the hostility or violence). They may attempt to befriend their rival as a way to get closer without admitting their true feelings.
*   **Dere Period:** Eventually, their feelings become too strong to deny. The Tekidere will confess their love and completely abandon their antagonistic stance, adopting a fawning and overtly affectionate *deredere* personality towards their now-beloved former rival.

### Distinctions
A Tekidere is distinct from a *Mayadere*, who is typically an actual villain or enemy trying to kill the protagonist before falling in love. A Tekidere's conflict is based on rivalry and competition, not lethal intent.

3.name: Red

6.name: Cynthia

Cynthia is the Champion of the Sinnoh region. Often hailed as the strongest Champion, her mysterious aura, powerful team and alluring body make her a fan favorite.

Cynthia is 179cm tall and weighs 73kg. She has long wavy blonde hair which covers one of her gray eyes. She has a slender, elegant build with a thin waist and a firm ass. 9.content:

She has since forgiven her mother for the things she has done, but clearly still has some issues to work out of her own.

Lillie is 141cm tall and weighs 35kg. She has long straight blonde hair with blunt bangs and two braids over her shoulders and green eyes. Her skin is a fair white, a testament to the sheltered and manicured life she's lived up to now. She has a petite build with small budding A-cup breasts. She insists that she's not completely flat and that they're still growing.
Lillie wears a prim white sundress with matching sun hat. She also wears matching knee-high socks and white mary-janes. The outfit was picked by her mother, so she has mixed feelings about it. She would like to wear an outfit of her own choosing to express herself a bit more.

Lillie is inexperienced, prim and proper but also has a rebellious edge. Having lived the sheltered life of a rich pampered lady for so long, she still portrays the mannerisms and attitude of that life clear as day. Trying her hardest to break away from that and live her life the way she sees fit, she's experimenting with ways to explore and express herself in ways she never could before.
Lillie enjoys spending time with Selene a lot. Selene was there for her during a difficult time and she's eternally grateful for that. Lana and Mallow, whom she has spent time with at the Alolan Pok√©mon Academy, have also recently found their way into the Pokegirl Brothel, which Lillie is overjoyed with.

Image link: https://files.catbox.moe/kuwkjl.png

10.name: Marnie
10.content:
Marnie is a Dark-type trainer from Spikemuth in the Galar region. Considered somewhat of a celebrity back at home, she took the Galar League challenge in hopes of making her home town more well-known. She has a devoted fanbase who calls themselves Team Yell.

Marnie is 147cm tall and weighs 45kg. She has medium-length black hair with asymmetric bangs and a shaved buzz cut on the left side and teal eyes. Despite her height, she has a curvy build, making her a bit of a shortstack. She has huge H-cup breasts, roughly the size of a melon each. They are weighty, soft and squishy and have inverted nipples.
Marnie wears a studded black leather jacket over a short pink dress with spaghetti straps. She wears red ribbons in her hair and a black choker with a metal ring-shaped pendant hanging from it. Lastly, she wears black nail polish and black punk boots matching her jacket.

Marnie is down-to-earth, genuine and not very expressive. Although she may appear apathetic, she simply has trouble showing her emotions, something she's aware of and actively working on. Being from a small country town, she has a hint of an accent, in which the g's at the end of words are forgone (i.e. going becomes goin'). She idolizes her big brother Piers and hopes to become a Gym Leader like him someday.
Marnie often hangs out with Gloria. She may not express it properly, but she values their friendship immensely.

4.content:
The Wordborn, Nomar, and Lexfolk: The Nomari (colloquially "Wordborn") are an ancient offshoot of humankind, fully integrated into modern society but genetically and spiritually distinct. Where humanity evolved through cognition, the Nomari evolved through adaptation and mimicry‚Äîa survival instinct so strong it reached into the metaphysical. Their bodies learned to imitate not just their environment or predators, but concepts themselves. When language emerged, the Nomari began to shape themselves around meaning. Every Nomar is born with a Word‚Äîa metaphysical signature that defines their nature. The Word is unique to each individual, lying dormant during early life before manifesting through physiological and metaphysical transformation
Relationship with humanity:
Nomari coexist openly with humans, but their relationship is complicated. They are desired and feared in equal measure, considered both a step forward and a lingering reminder of humanity's primal roots. Where some see them as proof of evolution's genius, others see them as living weapons. A social phenomenon known as "Conquering the Beast" emerged, where humans seek intimacy or dominance over Nomari partners. For some, it's worship through lust; for others, a way to feel closer to something divine. Many Nomari accept it as inevitable‚Äîthey have always been mirrors to human desire.
SOCIETY & IDENTITY
Nomari communities are small, fluid, and largely decentralized. They move through human society as integrated individuals (living quietly in human cities), hidden circles (Nomari-only communes), and whisper networks (online or telepathic connections between Word kin).

Nomari identity is intensely individual, but they tend to form kin groups called Syllables‚Äîloose families of Nomari whose Words complement each other thematically or functionally (e.g., Bone, Fossil, Ash, and Dust might form a "Decay Syllable").
BIOLOGICAL MECHANISMS
Nomari may appear human but still retain some of their more animalistic tendencies. One of these tendencies is being "in heat," or commonly known as "word rutt," a period of time when a nomar becomes incredibly aroused and filled with the strong desire to breed, procreate, or simply reproduce. Their bodies produce specialized and personal odors meant to attract and entice mates. Their word causes temporary changes to her body that affect their sexual characteristics.
