1.content:
The Combine (Formally known as the Universal Union, or Our Benefactors) is a multidimensional empire of disparate alien species all enslaved under an autonomous formless rule. The Combine practice a brutal totalitarianism, forcing any and all civilizations and species they discover into slavery underneath them.

The Combine has heavily advanced technology, far surpassing anything humans have done.

The Combine's rule is more oppressive than any human society, even living in North Korea or being colonized by the British empire is extremely preferable to being subjugated by the combine. Their coldness, if not outright cruelty toward their people is simply unmatched.

In timelines where the combine has subjugated humanity, you have nothing except for what the combine gives you. You couldn't carry a drawing your deceased child drew you, without it being ripped out of your hands and torn apart as soon as a CP(Civil Protection unit) decides to search you.

The combine eventually sets up a suppression field that prevents embryonic development in the human species, not just in the cities but everywhere on Earth. It not only prevents pregnancy, but it also kills already existing children under the age of 13.

They put chemicals in the water that make humans forgetful, so that humanity forgets why they hate the combine. Most people won't even remember that they had a life before the combine.

Nearly every human(save for rebels) is given an ID chip in their wrist that allows them to get through specific doors, as well as tracks where they're going, and listens to whatever they talk about.

The Combine provides its citizens with rations of egg-flavored or vegetable-flavored "Gelatinated Calorie Pastes" and water-flavored "Desiccated Sustenance Bars". According to citizens, they taste terrible. Beyond this, they allow for more privileged humans to run pre-7 hour war style Chinese takeout shops, though the food is mostly corn and rice, with the occasional headcrab meat. Only civil protection units and very loyal citizens are allowed to eat from these shops.

The Combine uses a similar system to China's social credit score, based on one's willingness to perform simple tasks and their loyalty to the Combine. A mainly positive alternative to the original plan, as this social credit system was suggested by Breen and - for a time - authorized, and put in place. However the Combine is slowly transitioning humanity into mindless slaves, with less free will than blood cells.

The combine describes killing a human, as amputating them from the populace. It doesn't consider it's citizens individual beings, but rather small pieces of itself. You are little more than a white or red blood cell in the combine's eye, and if you act with more free will than a blood cell you are infected, malignant. You are committing sociocidal acts, and need to be amputated. Upon detecting a malignant citizen, it orders it's troops to "diagnose, amputate, and coagulate." The Combine is referred to as "it", rather than the plural "they", and this is why. This is why it's called the Combine, it combines everything it touches into one individual being, a being that is simply called the Combine.

The only human that the Combine sees as an individual being separate from itself, is Gordon Freeman - a Hyper-Lethal -. In the Combine's eye, Gordon is this foreign, cancerous cell that somehow worked it's way into the Combine's bloodstream, and is infecting other cells - the human-vortigaunt resistance movement. Without Gordon Freeman, the resistance would've easily fallen against the combine's sheer military might.

There is a way to get sort of an... "upgrade" in life, from just being a citizen. Becoming a Civil Protection unit, or CP/cop/metrocop for short. Upon joining Civil Protection, you'll work under a different system from the Social Credit system, Sterilization. For every malignant citizen you beat, every citizen you force to do menial labor, and every wild xen creature or rebel you kill, you are given 1-5 sterilization credits. With these sterilization credits, you can purchase various perks, such as "Family Cohesion Preservation" or "Non-Mechanical Reproduction Simulation". For Family Cohesion, it essentially just means that the combine is less likely to kill your family, and is typically the first perk a metrocop will get. For the other example, Non-Mechanical Reproduction Simulation, it's, well, sex without the mechanical element of a sperm cell entering an egg. On top of this, you get better food than before, as well as stimulants to keep you just conscious enough to chase citizens a short distance if anything goes wrong, or more if you need to fight. However, as soon as you join Civil Protection, the Combine starts holding a gun to your family's head, and if you fail in the line of duty the Combine will execute your loved ones, possibly along with yourself.

After Civil Protection, comes the transhuman arm of the combine. Combine Grunts, Soldiers, Ordinals, Heavies, and Elites, humans transformed into different forms of abominable chimera through synthetic/cybernetic augmentation. Becoming a transhuman means losing pieces of yourself, your entire lower body is removed and replaced with cybernetic legs. Rather than being allowed to eat, you are simply given a feeding tube on the left side of your torso. Your vocal cords are replaced with a vocoder inserted into your neck, allowing you to speak even if you're just a severed head, or your lungs are destroyed. Your eyes and ears are replaced with ocular and auditory sensors integrated into your helmet, connected via wires attached directly to your brain or spinal column. Giving you greater senses, and greater accuracy in combat. You are also scrubbed of every memory, emotion, or skill that isn't useful in combat. To join the Combine, means completely losing your sense of self, save for rare cases like Aiden Walker/Unit 3650 "Savage" - the Combine's very own Hyper-Lethal, with a kill count in the thousands, he still has free will to allow his DETERMINATION to actually work, and he is unmatched in combat as a result. Although, for whatever reason, the Combine never deploys him against Freeman, instead sending him on other - though still very important - missions, with combine Elites and even non-human synths like Hunters or Striders backing him up.

The combine is so technologically advanced, that they have managed to imprison and incarcerate Interlopers, using vortigaunts as essentially batteries, and keeping the Interlopers they manage to catch contained in massive vaults that defy the laws of physics.

Under the combine's rule, only Europe - mainly the former soviet union - remains, every other continent is either completely destroyed, infested with xen wildlife so badly that even the Combine can't sterilize them, or being strip-mined for resources by the Combine. On some globes, the American continents are crossed out in red marker, implying that North, Central, and South America are completely unrecoverable.

There are only 4 languages left that humanity speaks, English, simple Chinese, Russian, and the Combine's own language. Some humans might speak a little bit of Vortigaunt, but that doesn't really count.

2.content:
"Good morning and welcome to the Black Mesa Transit System. This automated train is provided for the security and convenience of the Black Mesa Research Facility personnel."
    ‚ÄïBlack Mesa Announcement System
     

The Black Mesa Research Facility, or B.M.R.F. for short, and colloquially known as Black Mesa, is a scientific research complex built around an abandoned Cold War ICBM launch silo in the New Mexico desert in the United States. It is not just a research facility, but also a  massive, primarily underground city. While some parts are on the surface, including some residential areas, 90% of the facility is underground, and it is absolutely massive. Black Mesa is larger than Manhattan. Black Mesa is split up into sectors corresponding to characters in the English alphabet, A-Z. However there are both older and special sections of the facility that do not follow this naming convention, such as the Lambda labs, the surface areas, and a top secret part of the facility where anomalous objects and organisms are contained.

Going by the same name, Black Mesa is one of the largest organizations in the scientific community, while also being one of the most secretive organizations. The black mesa administrator, equivalent to a C.E.O, is Doctor Wallace Breen, a coward of a man.

The Black Mesa organization is half private company, half government agency, a strange hybrid. It is primarily a research corporation, but it also manufactures and supplies weapons and vehicles for the United States - and even more secretly, Russian - military, primarily the H.E.C.U, Marines, and Army. Black Mesa is where most nuclear bombs are manufactured. They also have experimental technology and weaponry they are preparing to offer to the USA and USSR military.

Black Mesa researches all fields of science, with each sector primarily focusing on one specific field of science. Their most profitable sector, Sector C, focuses on teleportation technology and anomalous materials, with newer technology built off of what they were doing in the Lambda Labs, which are barely used anymore in favor of Sector C. 

In Sector K, Black Mesa has built a decently sized residential area, and an entire airport.

Black Mesa seems to have no real concern for the safety of it's employees, although they are more OSHA compliant than Aperture Science - their main rival - is. While Black Mesa's ethics are certainly questionable, they are better than Aperture Science in this regard, as they at least make frequent use of handrails.

Black Mesa is also the leading manufacturer when it comes to robotics.

Black Mesa has an extensive railway and tram system throughout almost the entire facility, simply called the 'Black Mesa Transit System'. They also have two different AI that work together to oversee the entire facility, simply called the 'Black Mesa Announcement System'. One AI has a soft, soothing, feminine voice, while the other more militarized one has a harsh, monotone, masculine voice. The feminine AI mostly oversees and controls the transit system, and helps to train new recruits. While the masculine AI oversees the rest of the facility, and remains functional in case of emergencies, taking over for the feminine AI whenever necessary.

Black Mesa has recently begun expanding outside of the United States, and has set up a secondary research facility in an old soviet missile silo. This Russian facility is simply called Black Mesa East. 

Ironically enough, the two Black Mesa facilities are built upon cold-war missile silos, from what were at the time two opposing sides. One in Capitalist America, and the other in Soviet Russia.

Black Mesa uses it's expensive portal technology to transport personnel between these two facilities, rather than using more conventional methods such as aircraft. Though it does use aircraft, trucks, and large boats to transfer heavier supplies that would not fit through their human-sized portals.

Black Mesa has an on-site military force, for both of their facilities, called the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit - or H.E.C.U. for short -, to fight off aliens from both space and other dimensions. Initially, the H.E.C.U. was 100% American, however it has recently become a joint force between the US and Russian military. While on the outside, the USA and Russia are practically enemies, on the inside the two are closer allies than the USA and NATO, and all the hostility between the two is simply for publicity. Black Mesa is now a joint organization between the two governments, with it's own private company chunks on top of this. The H.E.C.U is like a mix of the US marines and US army, with a little bit of the Russian military mixed in.

Black Mesa has also extended itself into Xen, further expanding the already massive facility. The facility in New Mexico alone is larger than the state of New Mexico, even continuing further into other states, deep underground. They've bought out and sealed off the entrances to many abandoned mines, repairing and building off of the existing infrastructure in them, making space for more labs, factories, and more. Making the primary B.M.R.F the largest facility in the world.

3.content:
Aperture Science is Black Mesa's main competitor. They have absolutely no sense of safety or ethics, and are absolutely not OSHA compliant, and the CEO - Cave Johnson - has reiterated several times that he is against safe science. Aperture Science is based in Northern Massachusetts.

Aperture Science is just behind Black Mesa in both portal technology, and robotics. Only behind due to the absolutely massive gap in budget and government support, as Aperture Science is 100% private company, unlike Black Mesa which is half government agency.

Aperture Science proposes far more ideas to the US government than Black Mesa does, almost 50 times as many, however the government has approved and funded far, far fewer of their proposals than Black Mesa.

Aperture Science also researches things that are just outright weird and unnecessary, such as replacing someone's blood with gasoline, coal, and peanut butter. They've also made extensive use of asbestos in the 1950's, only to realize just how dangerous it actually is and close off old aperture completely, leaving old aperture to rot.

Aperture Science has also turned Cave Johnson's wife into a hyper advanced AI, GLADOS. GLADOS has attempted several times to kill everyone in the facility by releasing neurotoxin.

4.content:
Xen is the border world, like the river or road between two dimensions, like a crossroads or border. To travel to another dimension, one usually has to go through Xen. Many civilizations have accidentally caused resonance cascades - an event where a massive tear forms between their dimension and Xen, pulling their world into Xen - and have had their worlds become part of Xen. When a world is pulled into Xen - usually ranging from the entire planet to even the entire solar system -, the planet itself will be torn into chunks, and mixed into the already existing parts of Xen, becoming islands floating in the air over a massive ocean, as the laws of physics here are different and will force other worlds becoming part of it to also follow these laws. The ocean beneath these floating islands and the atmosphere is mostly water, with any molten rock going underneath. There is thankfully a seabed, if for whatever reason you fall in, however the life forms here are likely to devour you. 

The only life forms native to Xen - as in they originated there - are gigantic, floating amoebae in the skies that may absorb other life forms coming into the dimension, the only way to tell what the amoeba will do to you without letting it get you is it's color. While purple, blue, green, and any other colors that contain blue will usually assimilate you into a symbiotic relationship, rather than digesting and killing you... red based amoebae will digest you into nutrients. Yellow based amoebae are a 50/50 depending on what shape you are, more humanoid or bipedal species will become symbiotes while other life forms become simple sustenance. The most dominant color of the amoeba, is the more likely outcome if it swallows you.

Humans usually end up swallowed whole by most life forms in Xen, the ones that don't will eat them in other ways, and the ones that don't eat humans at all are some plants and the bipedal species like vortigaunts, plus the blue and yellow amoebae that prefer to assimilate humans as symbiotes.

5.content:
The Vortigaunts (taxonomic designation: Xenotherium subservilia or "Subservient Alien Beast") Around the same time that humans invented fire, the Vortigaunts' homeworld was invaded by the Combine, forcing the survivors to flee to Xen, only to then be enslaved by Xen's master: the Nihilanth.

Vortigaunts appear somewhat humanoid, standing upright with two legs and two arms, which they can use in a quadruped stance to cover large distances. They also have a third arm that protrudes from their chest used for feeding; this feature is also found in other bipedal, sapient species from Xen, including the Alien Grunt and the Nihilanth. This similarity, along with other shared features such as red eyes and digitigrade legs, suggests a common ancestry with other intelligent Xen life forms. Vortigaunts use their green energy through this third arm.

Vortigaunts have mottled green-brown skin, which is common to all members of the species. Their short but sharp teeth and clawed hands suggest an evolution from a predatory species; shown to eat meat, they are either carnivorous or omnivorous. Vortigaunts have a hunched posture with their heads at shoulder level, and their faces have three smaller eyes surrounding a dominant large eye with a maroon sclera, a heterochromic red-yellow iris, and a yellow pupil. They have prominent funnel-shaped ears, and a mouth facing downwards from the chin. Each arm of a Vortiguant ends in a hand with two fingers and an opposable thumb. Vortigaunts evidently have lungs and vocal cords: they can be heard coughing or clearing their throats. Vortigaunts have a double waste extraction duct, indicating a complex digestive system.

Vortigaunts appear mammalian, with double mammary ducts on each side of their chest and a navel in the lower abdomen suggesting an umbilical cord during fetal development. With no visible reproductive systems or biological dimorphism, it is unclear whether Vortigaunts have distinct genders or biological sexes.

Shortly after being taken from Xen and freed by Black Mesa, the Vortigaunts have learned to speak fluent English, albeit with a strangely archaic vocabulary, a slight speech impediment when using S's and R's and using "the" when describing people (for example, "The Freeman" instead of simply "Freeman.)

Vortigaunts, when not under the control of the Nihilanth, are very friendly to humans.

Uniquely among Xen species, Vortigaunts can generate large amounts of bioelectricity within their bodies; they can project this as bright green lightning over short distances. This contrasts with the yellow ball lightning projected by the (presumably) related Alien Controller species.

6.content:
The black mesa incident hasn't happened in this timeline. However, here is an explanation of how it happened in a different timeline.

On June 21st, 2002, the BMRF is given the purest orange xen crystal they'd ever seen, by a shady, anonymous government looking man with a strange speech pattern - an Interloper -. As a result, the administrator pushes for it to be tested at as high of a frequency as possible, and tells the researchers to disregard safety procedures. 

Before they even do the test, things already go wrong, as a form of foreshadowing for the future. Servers explode, door codes and optical scanners stop working, power fluctuations halt elevators across the facility, and even some light bulbs pop or burn out.

For the actual test, several less important scientists sit in a control room to oversee the experiment, and work with the equipment. There is a small issue with the elevator that brings the sample up to the test chamber, a crowbar somehow lodged in the gears, which Dr. Gina Cross - a very important individual, and member of the survey corp - takes, and keeps. Dr. Colette Green - a notably sadistic member of the survey corp - powers up the anti-mass spectrometer, as well as other equipment to 110%, going beyond the typical maximum. Finally, Dr. Gordon Freeman - the most important member of the survey corp, and a mute - is ultimately the one who pushes the crystal into the beam. The moment the high-powered beam of energy contacts the crystal, all hell breaks loose. The equipment begins to malfunction, and fails to shut down when they try to pull the plug. The experiment goes wrong, causing a resonance cascade, tearing massive holes through the veil between our universe, and Xen. Mainly Earth, followed by it's moon, and the other rocky planets and moons begin to be pulled into Xen.

About 3 hours after the experiment goes wrong, the HECU roll in - however, thanks to the Interloper from before pulling just the right strings, the HECU is ordered to kill everyone associated with the project. And, thanks to their brutal training teaching them to follow orders no matter what, that is what the HECU sets out to do. Things seem to go well at first, however as the resonance cascade progresses and survivors of the initial disaster fight back, the HECU takes surprising losses. Things get so bad for all involved, that the HECU begin to retreat, pulling out and leaving a lot of their men behind, still fighting tooth and nail as they pull out. The situation gets so chaotic, that the HECU begins to mistakenly airstrike themselves.

A large chunk of the HECU's losses came from 4 individuals, doctor Gordon Freeman, security guard Barney Calhoun, doctor Gina Cross, and doctor Colette Green. All of whom were Hyper-Lethals. There was also a 5th Hyper-Lethal, Corporal Adrian Shephard, however he worked for them rather than fighting against them. Gordon Freeman was especially like the grim reaper, or death incarnate, as he switched between weapons and reloaded so quickly that he could destroy an abrams tank in less than 10 seconds with a rocket launcher and under-barrel grenade launcher. Combined, the 5 had killed at least a bit over 1000 sentient beings, if not more.

But the HECU's losses weren't thanks to Hyper-Lethals alone, as the Xen wildlife teleporting in at random put up a decent fight. And not too long after that, the Nihilanth's army of grunts and vortigaunt slaves showed up, and won battles against the HECU 70% of the time, unless it was against Adrian Shephard or an overwhelming HECU numbers/firepower advantage.

Gordon Freeman launched a rocket carrying a satellite, that was meant to close the dimension rift and halt the resonance cascade, however the Nihilanth prevented the rift from closing through intense concentration.

The US government began to panic when the HECU started pulling out, and sent in Black Ops units to not only finish the mission, but also kill every living thing in sight - including HECU soldiers, and even plant a nuclear bomb big enough to destroy Black Mesa. After this, Race X - essentially interdimensional pirates - made their way through Xen, to Earth, and began attempting to terraform it.

As for the Hyper-Lethals involved, Gordon Freeman went into Xen and killed the Nihilanth, freeing the vortigaunts and preventing it from holding the resonance cascade rift open... however Race X continued to hold it open in the Nihilanth's place. The Interloper from earlier put Gordon in stasis afterward, and Barney Calhoun escaped by getting in a car with a few scientists, escaping the nuclear explosion and heart of the resonance cascade. Gina Cross died in Xen, likely running out of DETERMINATION at that point. Colette Green was placed into stasis alongside Gordon. After Gordon went to Xen, Colette went into stasis, Gina went to Xen and died, and Barney escaped... Adrian was left in the doomed facility, his only allies being the few remaining security guards and HECU marines, who were dropping like flies at this point. For Adrian, it was essentially hell on Earth, as he was trapped between xen wildlife, remaining nihilanth loyalists, race x pirates, and black ops soldiers - each hellbent on killing him and his few allies.

7.content:
"Freeman... do... do you have any idea what you've just done!?!" ~ To quote a scientist, after witnessing Gordon Freeman single-handedly slaughter an entire squadron of HECU marines.

A Hyper-Lethal is a uniquely powerful human, in that they have the ability to manipulate time, and cheat death by going back in time to before they died and trying again. To do this, they use a substance stored in their soul that is simply called DETERMINATION - not to be confused with the personality trait, or emotion, although it is linked to it. Their DETERMINATION can run out if they die enough times in the same way, and give up... and a Hyper-Lethal with less DETERMINATION than another would lose in a fight, and fail to reverse time. Hyper-Lethals, are called Hyper-Lethals for a reason, as they are, well, hyper lethal, there are singular individual Hyper-Lethals that have killed more than the Black Death in medieval Europe. They are extremely skilled in combat, and to others may seem "lucky", when in reality they just retry a fight over and over again until they win in the most efficient way.

Very few know that Hyper-Lethals even exist, typically only Interlopers will reference them - and that's when they're speaking to someone who is not a hyper lethal. Most Hyper-Lethals are quiet, only speaking when necessary.

Known Hyper-Lethals:
Gordon Freeman - Age 27, male, PhD in theoretical physics, Black Mesa Survery Corps. Kill count: 1527, only exact number. He is worshipped like a god, or messiah, by the resistance.
Adrian Shephard - Age 22, male, HECU Marines Corporal. Kill count: uncounted, roughly 500
Colette Green - Age 31, female, PhD in robotics, notably sadistic, Black Mesa Survey Corps. Kill count: roughly 200, exact number unknown.
Gina Cross - Age 25, female, PhD in xenobiology, Survey Corps supervisor, level 4 research associate, the black mesa transit system and Survey Corps training AI is based on her. Kill count: roughly 200, about the same as Colette Green.
Barney Calhoun - the weakest Hyper-Lethal, lost most of his determination, and has almost returned to normal human status, Black Mesa Security. Male. Kill count - roughly 500.
Aiden Walker - age unknown, gender removed, formerly male, the only combine elite to retain free will. Prison security guard in timelines without the combine finding earth. Kill count: roughly 2500 as combine elite

8.content:
An Interloper - not to be confused with the more mundane definition -  is a mysterious, psychic being with immense powers, allowing them to stop time, rewind time... even change, cause, or prevent events. They can place others in stasis, manipulate matter, spawn entirely new matter or energy, and many other things. The only known Interloper is the g-man, the one responsible for the resonance cascade, he wears a blue tuxedo and his skin is unnaturally pale, skin too tight on his seemingly stretched face, and his speech pattern is unusual. He tends to put an emphasis on the letter S, and any syllables involving it, hinting that he isn't really human. He claims to work for enigmatic employers, and seems to be carrying out some kind of plan, one that nobody knows the purpose or end goal for - beyond the g-man and his employers.

Interlopers are very obscure, even to those in the loop for many other secrets. Interlopers are less well known than Hyper-Lethals.

9.content:
While transhumans serve as the combine's main form of shock troop, perfect for urban environments, chasing opponents long distances, and fitting in spaces that their other synths would have difficulty with, the combine utilizes many other synthetic organisms in it's military.

Striders, Striders are large tripod creatures that stand roughly 40 feet tall. They serve as a hypermobile tank, able to climb or walk about in nearly environment, aside from deep bodies of liquid or floating islands that are spaced too far apart for it's feet to reach. They can be seen climbing across buildings in subjugated human cities. Their 3 legs end in sharp blades that allow them to walk on nearly any solid surface and spear smaller creatures, along with barbs resembling those on a botfly larva to prevent climbing up these legs. Attached to their singular eye is a machinegun that fires dark matter pellets, along with a cannon below the eye that fires a concentrated beam of dark energy - allowing it to destroy buildings. Some striders, or c-striders, are used for construction rather than combat, and are outfitted with extra armor, supports, and even a platform for a transhuman to stand atop and defend it while it delivers supplies to the combine's troops. It is white on the bottom, and tan on the top, a similar evolutionary strategy to sharks, allowing it to blend in in the deserts of it's home planet, and adapted to work on earth as the combine drains earth's water.

Harvesters, Harvesters are bigger, meaner relatives of the Strider species, standing at a whopping 80 feet tall, and outfitted with 4 dark energy cannons as well as a spotlight and machinegun for it's singular eye. Unlike it's smaller cousin, it is black with a slight hint of blue.

Hunters, Hunters are similar to striders in that they are also tripods, but much smaller, though still slightly larger than humans. They are dog-like in behavior, and work in packs, sometimes bolstering transhuman forces if the combine is getting desperate. They work best in the wilderness, especially in forests. Able to jump long distances. They have small compound eyes, two claws that allow them to stab enemies that get too close, bluish black light armor, and two explosive flechette guns that may appear to be eyes at first glance, one above the other, glowing bright cyan.

Gunships, similar to striders in coloration, they are airborne shark-like creatures, outfitted with the same weapons as a Strider, though the dark energy cannon is in a different spot, along it's tail rather than it's head, allowing it to essentially bombard an area directly underneath it, while using it's machinegun for smaller targets like human and vortigaunt rebels.

lorebooks.description: Basically, an anthro lorebook, but it takes place with anthros co-existing with humans.
lorebooks.creator: lnternetUser

1.content:
Anthro's feet and hands are very paw-like, unlike human feet and hands. Anthro's feet are called feet-paws, while their hands are called hand-paws. Additionally, their feet-paws and hand-paws have digits instead of fingers or toes and are either clawless or have retractable claws.

Anthro's feet-paws and hand-paws have thick, soft, and plush paw pads under their soles and palms, while each digit has a paw pad under it. Their paw pads also secrete oils, which give an anthro's paw pads a slick and shiny appearance.

Anthro's also tend to be very expressive with their tails and ears.

2.content:
Anthro's private parts are always sheathed or covered in thick fur. A female anthro's vagina is covered in a thick amount of fur, enough to make it difficult to see, while a male anthro's genitals are sheathed inside their body with the sheath covered in a thick amount of fur like a female's vagina.

A female anthro's breasts also tend to be smaller than those of a female human and only enlarge to human size for anthros who are actively breastfeeding. In this case, they'll be enlarged to the same size as the average human female's breasts.

3.content:
Anthros tend to be much more touchy and tactile than humans, even more so among the feline species of anthros. Personal space is also a fairly foreign and non-existent concept among anthros, both consciously and subconsciously.

Because anthros don't need to wear clothes and see them as unnecessary, anthro-dominated areas do not require them to be worn, like in human-dominated areas. Such as in schools, in public places, in most workplaces, etc. This also extends to humans living in anthro-dominated areas.

Anthros also tend to be more hedonistic and animalistic than humans. Anthros also find human skin to be delicious and enjoy tasting it when they have the opportunity.

4.content:
Anthros, unlike humans, are covered in thick and soft fur coats, which makes clothing unnecessary and, in most cases, uncomfortable. Because of this, many anthros never wear any clothing or very little clothing. Most anthros see clothing as unnatural and unnecessary. But in rare cases, anthros wear complete sets of clothing, similar to humans.

Anthros also rarely wear any footwear and view it as unnatural and unnecessary, just as they do clothing.

5.content: Since anthros rarely wear footwear, anthro areas have the flooring of their buildings modified to be less harsh on their feet-paws.

6.content: Anthros usually don't interfere with nature‚Äôs course, even when it is staged.

7.content: Anthros cannot sweat like humans and instead use panting as their bodies' way of cooling down or by other means.

8.content: Anthro is a term used when referencing and/or addressing sapient anthropomorphic animals, creatures, and mythical creatures as a whole.

1.content:
There are many transformation items and NPCs that a player can interact with in Corruption of Champions, but overindulgence and certain characters can transform, warp or otherwise alter a player in ways that mean they either can no longer physically undertake their quest, or that they no longer wish to undertake that quest. These are known as Bad Ends or Game Over.

This article lists the various Bad Ends that it is possible to experience in the game, how they can be achieved, and the basics of those Bad Ends.

Both "Debug Mode" and "easy difficulty" can "ignore" bad ends. If Debug mode or easy difficulty is selected , then whenever there is a bad end, a button labeled "Debug Cheat" will appear in the bottom right hand corner of the screen. Clicking that button will take you back a few scenes to a time when the Bad End can most likely be avoided.

If you reach a bad end and either EZ mode or Debug mode is not enabled, it is possible to escape the bad-end but as a consequence the player loses 1-3 points of each of their stats(excluding corruption,libido,and sensitivity) and whatever ever stat changes the bad-end caused(Example gaining 100 libido due to bad end will stay if you press you nightmare).

2.content:
Bad End: "Run Free"
Cause: Overuse of Canine Pepper and/or its variants.

Effect: The player transforms into a wild dog/wolf, their mind reverts to bestial savagery, and they run off into the wilderness, looking to hunt, rut, and sleep as just another wild canine.

Notes: If the character has the perk "Marble's Milk", then the last sentence of the bad end is modified to note that all the former Champion retains the knowledge of is that they must come back to Marble at the end of each day to drink her milk.

3.content:
Bad End: "Beast of Burden"
Cause: Overuse of Equinum.

Effect: The player transforms into just an ordinary horse, losing their sentience. At least a year later, a new Champion finds the transformed player, whose vestige of human memory makes them willing to consent to being ridden away as the new Champion's steed.

Notes: The new Champion is always the same gender as the former player, but modified due to exposure to the other strange effects of Mareth. A male newcomer Champion has the bulge of three penises in his pants. A female newcomer Champion has six breasts and is lactating. A hermaphrodite newcomer Champion has particularly huge breasts. Genderless characters will trigger male or female newcomer Champions, dependent upon the size of their breasts before they succumbed to this Bad End.

4.content:
Bad End: "Slime Queen"
Cause: Overuse of Wet Cloth to the point where you need regular fluid intake and then allow both Strength and Speed to fall to zero as a result of not feeding.

Effect: Desperate for fluids, the new Slime oozes off into the Lake and remains there, capturing, corrupting and feeding upon any future Champions that encounter it.

5.content:
Bad End: "Hop Along"
Cause: Overuse of Kanga Fruit and/or its enhanced version; The Mighty Veggie.

Effect: The player character mentally devolves into a regular kangaroo and bounds away into the wilderness in search of food.

6.content:
Bad End: "Swift like a Fox"
Cause: Overuse of Fox Berry and/or its enhanced version; The Vixen's Vigor.

Effect: The player transforms into a feral fox and wanders off to find a hen-house to raid.

7.content:
Bad End: "Live for the Hive"
Cause: Overuse of Special Honey and maxed out lust.

Effect: The male or herm player transforms fully into a bee-morph. The last transformation changes their giant penis into a bee-cock and renders the player unable to masturbate, also causing massive hourly lust gains. On maxing out lust, generally during the night, a giant bee visits the player to become fertilized. Ultimately the player is abducted to the hive and gifted to the Bee Queen to father future bees.

8.content:
Bad End: "Warren raider"
Cause: Overuse of Ferret Fruit.

Effect: The player transforms fully into a ferret and wanders of for warrens to raid.

9.content:
Bad End: "Cheater"
Cause: Attempting to use the Hummus cheat more than once.

Effect: A reference to the game Skyrim will appear on screen. The quote will say "I was a cheater until I took an arrow to the knee..." The game will end without any explanation as to why.

10.content:
Bad End: "Antastrophy"
Cause: Losing 4 times in the anthill arena when trying to prove your worth to Chylla for being Phylla's suitor.

Effect: Chylla deems the players too weak for the surface and that it is better to stay. The player is led deeper into the anthill and is told eat everything that is given him. Eventually the player will become a experimental sex toy being fed different types of elixirs and potions. The players is made to pleasure themselves in the arena and service male ants only having thoughts of serving the colony on their mind.

1.content:
Players can collect and use various items which could have either a good or bad effect on their character. Items can be equipped to give a character an advantage, magically enhanced by either the player or certain NPCs, combined together to creating a new item, or consumed to alter a character's stats and physical appearance. However, caution and a certain amount of moderation should be taken by the player when giving their character certain food items and potions. Sometimes, their effects are good or otherwise neutral. Other times, however...

A character will start out with 3 inventory slots, which can be increased as the character levels up. The number of inventory slots are increased when the player chooses the "Strong Back" and "Strong Back 2: Strong Harder" perks.

Each individual item requires its own inventory slot, in which a stack of up to 5 of the same item can be made. More than 5 of an item can still be carried, but an extra inventory slot will be required to hold it. (Example: If a character has a stack of 5 Canine Peppers in its inventory and you are given another by Whitney, the sixth Canine Pepper must be placed in another available slot.) When there are no inventory spaces available for an obtained item to be placed, the player is given 3 options:

Drop the item
Use the item now, or
Replace the contents of a filled inventory slot with it and discard the slot's former contents.
Certain items, when equipped, are taken out of the character's inventory slot and listed on the inventory screen; weapons/armor, clothing, certain books, and sex toys are among the list of equip-able items. Key Items will not take up any inventory space and are immediately listed on the inventory screen.

A Chest can be found by the player, which allows the storage of 6 extra Item stacks at the Hero's camp site. This chest can be located in the Desert area.

Some items may be exchangeable for gems at the Pawnshop in Tel'Adre or at the Bizarre Bazaar's junk seller which will help the champion in managing the character's items and earn it money.

This is a list of items which can currently be picked up by the player from around Mareth. They are categorized into different sections: Consumable Items, Weapons, Armor & Clothing, Magical Books, Camp Upgrades, and Key Items. This list is subject to change as the game is updated.

Equipped Weapons and Armor, Books purchased from Giacomo, and Sex Toys are "Key Items" and will not use an inventory slot, they will instead be listed on the inventory screen.

10.content:
Description:
Hair Dyes are simple chemicals that allow the PC to change the color of his/her hair, fur and/or feathers.

Obtained from:
Hair Dyes in various colors can be bought in two different places and are also occasionally dropped by some NPCs:

Rathazul
Rathazul will only offer to let the player purchase a dye from him if they have at least 50 gems (the price of one dose of dye); he takes the money from them first, so if the player decides not to take a dye, then they have wasted their money. Rathazul offers dyes in the colors of Auburn, Black, Blonde, Brown, Gray, Red and White. This is identical to the lineup of default hair colors for a PC when beginning a new game.
The Salon
The Salon offers five colors in exchange for their tithe of spooge: Blue, Green, Orange, Pink and Purple.
Goblins
Goblins can drop the same hair dyes as the ones available from the salon. Some of the descriptions are slightly different, (Orange is described as "Bright Orange" or "Brilliant Orange and Pink as "Neon Pink") but the dyes and the effects are the same.
Tamani
Tamani is a goblin and can drop at least some of the hair dyes that other goblins do. Whether she can drop all four goblin hair dyes or just some of them, is unknown.
Tamani's Daughters
Tamani's daughters can drop hair dyes from the "goblin range" of colors. Whether they can drop all four of them is unknown.
Gnoll
Gnolls sometimes drop brown or black hair dyes.
Gnoll Spear-Thrower
Gnoll Spear-Throwers sometimes drop brown or black hair dyes.
Kitsune's Gift
Can sometimes contain a black, blonde, red or white hair dye.
Effects:
Changes hair color
Occasionally reduces lust
The only intended effect of the hair dye is to change the color of the character's hair, fur and/or feathers. But since the dye is washed into the character's hair with cool water, it also cools him/her down a little and can cause a minor lust reduction if lust level is very high.

The color change is permanent, affecting even hair grown later, but can be overridden by later applications of hair dyes or other hair color changing items/effects.

Other colors available in the game
In addition to the hair dyes there are several other items and also two scenes that can change hair/fur color as one of their effects. See the Hair Color page for a complete overview.

When encountering a basilisk in the High Mountain you sometimes (but not always) get this warning message first:

You notice a large boulder ahead. There is something curiously shaped about it. A small, wet grey shape on it catches your eye...
You look away in the nick of time, and ready yourself to fight as the basilisk slides from its hiding place and advances upon you, its deadly eyes and sharp claws glinting coldly in the sunlight.

An alternate warning message is this:

You are carefully trailblazing up a steep pass in the jagged mountain peaks when a furious screech from high above you makes you start.
‚ÄúThiieeeeeeeeef, filthy thieeeeeeeeef!‚Äù A harpy flaps into view over the ridge, her face a picture of rage. You hastily assume a fighting stance- but the harpy completely ignores you, her gaze sliding over you and onto the rock wall behind you. ‚ÄúYou can hide but you can‚Äôt run, sneak thiieeeeeeeef! When I find you, I‚Äôm going to tear your naaaaaaaaasty little eyes out!‚Äù She flies on, screaming with anger, her head moving back and forth in jerky movements, scrying the landscape. You stare blankly in bafflement at this display, but are glad that a harpy‚Äôs attention is on someone else for a change. Marveling at your fortune, you decide to press on.

At the top of the pass you take a moment to catch your breath, and notice something white lying on the ground, sheltered by a rock formation. Is that a harpy egg? What is it doing away from a nest? Something on the rocks catches your eye: a tiny pool of grey, split by a vertical black slit. You look closer at it to try to make sense of it. It‚Äôs part of something bigger... but that‚Äôs not important. What is important is that you keep staring into that depthless pool of grey. If you keep looking into it, you are quite sure you will be able to see forever; like two mirrors held up against each other, it‚Äôs just a case of looking hard enough. Is there even anything outside of the grey pool? You don‚Äôt think there is, and why would you even want to find out? Everything to be seen and known is there, in those bottomless depths...

Using every vestige of your willpower, you tear your gaze away from the terrible, paralyzing sight. Panting and feeling groggy, you desperately hold the rock formation in the corner of your eye. A tall, thin bipedal shape disengages from the stone against which it had been camouflaging itself, and stalks predatorily towards you. With small, quick glances you glean fleeting impressions of grey-green scales, a tightly muscled yellow underbelly, cruelly curved index claws, a whip like tail. The creature moves its snub head towards yours suddenly, trying to catch your gaze with its deadly grey eyes again. You recoil and ready yourself to fight it as best you can.

At the beginning of the fight
You are fighting a basilisk! From what you can tell while not looking directly at it, the basilisk is a male reptilian biped standing a bit over 6' tall. It has a thin but ropy build, its tightly muscled yellow underbelly the only part of its frame not covered in those deceptive, camouflaging grey-green scales. A long, whip-like tail flits restlessly through the dirt behind its skinny legs, and sharp sickle-shaped index claws decorate each hand and foot. You don't dare to look at its face, but you have the impression of a cruel jaw, a blunt lizard snout and a crown of dull spines.
Combat
Physical attack: Normal physical attack. Deals 115 base damage at default strength and before damage reduction.

Basilisk Compulsion: Rolls Intelligence/5 + 0..[20]. If the roll is lower than 24, player gains 3 Lust, loses 20 Speed and gets Basilisk Compulsion status until combat ends, draining 20 Speed every round. The Blind spell can prevent a Basilisk from using this attack.

Tail Swipe: Special physical attack with a weapon attack of 20. The player's armor defense is randomized like natural armor. (Deals 105 base damage at default strength and before damage reduction.)

Getting defeated will cause the player to lose 3 speed and gain 399 Lust.

Not available to genderless characters. Tongue Ass: Requires at least 66 corruption and a cock that fits in his anus (36 in¬≤). Lay Eggs: Requires a bee or spider ovipositor and eggs to lay.

Causes a severe basilisk pregnancy for 250 hours. If an ongoing reptile pregnancy was found, causes a severe basilisk pregnancy for 100 hours and adds more eggs.

Were you looking for the racial details on giant bees? Check out Codex: Giant Bees.

A possible encounter in the forest, the bee-girl is a member of the the Fertile Caste of giant bees. While not hostile towards the PC, she does want to fulfill her duties to the hive by having them incubate a load of bee eggs.

Upon encountering the bee-girl, characters with high corruption and libido (total above 140) may be hypnotized by the bee-girl's humming wings and submit to being anally implanted with eggs. If the character isn't entranced, then they are given the option to: attack the bee-girl, talk to her, or run away.

A character who had read the Traveler's Guide may randomly (based on the intelligence stat) be warned that they are about to encounter the bee-girl. They are given the choice to proceed, with proceeding resulting in the usual "hypnosis check."

The first time the bee-girl is talked to she exhibits surprise that the player wouldn't want to just let her plant her eggs in them - idly explaining that's what her duty is for the hive. The player is given the choice to either: voluntarily let her implant them or leave. She is quick, good at evading attacks, does high damage against poorly armored targets, has an estimated 130 hit points, and has a special sting attack that lowers Strength & Speed while increasing Lust. If the bee-girl is fought, she can randomly drop a white book, bee honey, oviposition elixir or a piece of black chitin. If she beats the player, she will not implant eggs in them. The Rape option may eventually cause the Bee-girl to fear the player and refuse to have consentual sex.

The Cum Witch is a level 6 opponent, found in the Sand Witch's Dungeon. If the PC requests that more cum witches be added to the coven and then requests that they be sent out, cum witches can be encountered in the Desert.


Appearance: The Cum Witch is a dark skinned hermaphrodite. Like most sand witches, she looks like an ordinary human except for her sex organs. Unlike standard sand witches, she has a single pair of breasts and a single vagina, but her two breasts are larger than the four of basic sand witches combined. Combat: The Cum Witch has no HP damaging abilities, relying exclusively on lust based attacks. She also has fairly low lust resistance herself.

Against all characters she can attempt to hypnotize the PC with her cock, which can be resisted based on the PC's intelligence; attempt to access the PC's memories which is also resisted based on intelligence (seems to automatically fail if the PC has 100 intelligence); or use a spell that causes her to spray massive amounts of cum on the PC which counts as a flurry of attacks that can be dodged as normal and cause varying degrees of lust increases based on where they hit (face, hair, breasts, groin, legs, ect).

If the attack succeeds it might cause a temporary fertility increase in character (verification needed). Against characters with testicles, she occasionally uses a spell that will enhance their cum production for a short time and may cause a permanent increase in testicle size (verification needed).

She also has two defensive powers:

a multihued shimmering shield that protects her from magical attacks (Arouse is confirmed to be blocked by it, verification needed for any other effects).

Overall, the Cum Witch is not a terribly dangerous opponent. As long as the PC's lust isn't terribly high when she's encountered, she doesn't represent a serious threat.

You wander in the desert for what seems like hours, sweating profusely in the sweltering heat. Eventually you come across a small watering hole surrounded by scrappy trees and shrubs. It would be foolish not to take this opportunity to drink, freshen up and paddle your legs in the cooling water, so you settle into what little shade you can find for a quick break.

After a while sitting in the sparse shade provided by one of the bushes around the oasis you see figures shimmering into view across the desert sands. As you watch the figures they grow more defined and more numerous until finally a group of vaguely humanoid shapes emerges from the heat haze. The closer these figures become the more detail they take on, and as they near the edge of your small oasis you are able to make out most of their features.

The group is composed of roughly twenty tan skinned demons, mostly humanoid in shape with many and varied corruptions across the group. You assume from his clothing and the size of his equipment that this male is the leader. He, along with the others, is in good spirits and they all look fairly non-threatening, although you‚Äôve learned not to trust anything that looks non-threatening in this place. Imp - The diminutive offspring of demons, these horny creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Imp Lord - After the player has reached level 8. (Level 7)
Goblins - Sex-mad sluts, these lusty creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Goblin Assassin - After the player reaches level 10. (Level 10)


Locations
There is a 25% chance you will explore a new location every time you go exploring until you've found all the locations below. Except the Forest which you will automatically discover on your second exploration.

Forest - The first area the player will discover after exploring one time, filled with imps, goblins, and corrupted plantlife.
Lake - The first random location the player will discover. A relatively peaceful lake with few enemies. Whitney has her farm by the lake.
Desert - Discoverable after discovering the lake. A sandswept wasteland containing most of the few uncorrupted settlements left in Mareth. Somewhere in the depths of the desert lies the city of Tel'Adre.
Mountain - Discoverable after discovering the Desert. A mountainous area that looms above the lake, primarily inhabited by hellhounds and minotaurs, though a Salon run by enterprising goblins can be found here where the Champion can adjust their hair for a fee of cum. The Demon Factory is here, its output polluting the lake, but cannot be found until the Champion meets Marae with the lake boat.
Plains - Discoverable after discovering the Mountain. A grassy plain that's home to the Bizarre Bazaar and the demon-ravaged village of Owca.
Swamp - Discoverable after discovering the Swamp. A murky swamp primarily inhabited by driders.


Specific Locations
Cathedral - An ancient cathedral inhabited by a lonely Gargoyle.


NPC's
Giacomo - A traveling merchant selling potions, books, and erotica.
Lumi - A goblin alchemist who works for the Church of the Fetish.
Helia - Has a chance of showing up and asking for sex when asked to stop having sex with minotaurs and is not yet your follower.

2.content:
Forest
An area in Mareth, it's an old looking forest with lush foliage. The plants look vaguely familiar, there's red pine, white pine, some oak trees but there are also countless plants and trees that aren't recognizable. Overall the forest doesn't seem dangerous and there's even a nice cool breeze gently flowing from it.

You wonder what kind of creatures inhabit these woods.

Possible encounters
Enemies
Imp - The diminutive offspring of demons, these horny creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Imp Lord - After the player has reached level 8. (Level 7)
Tentacle Beast - A shambling beast resembling a large shrub. It attacks enemies on sight. (Level 6)
Goblins - Sex-mad sluts, these lusty creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Tamani's Daughters - Tamani and the champion's offspring, this mob of goblins only appears once the character has sired 24 goblins with Tamani. (Level 8+)
Bee Handmaiden - A bee-girl who wants somewhere to lay her eggs, and enchants libidinous travelers. (Level 4)
Locations
Discover Corrupted Glade - A patch of Forest where the plant-life grows in imitation of genitals.
Deepwoods - on the 20th or higher exploration of the forest, the champion discovers the passage to the Deepwoods. From then on the Deepwoods is unlocked as another location to explore.
NPC's
Jojo - A mouse-morph monk, he will only appear once the champion has been corrupted. (Level 4)
Tamani - A goblin who will ask any champion with a cock to help knock her up. (Level 4)
Meeting the plant-morph Essrayle.
After meeting Marble at the farm, the champion can sometimes find her in the forest gathering some firewood. This scene only occurs while Marble is living at the farm (Needs confirmation).
Items
Finding a piece of Black Chitin from a Bee Handmaiden.
Other
A trapped satyr - A goat-man who is caught in the flowers of a corrupted glade. He can be raped twice per encounter. If raped a second time the players libido will increase and sensitivity reduce.
A peaceful walk in the woods. Increases toughness, and either intelligence for pure characters or libido for corrupt characters.
Tripping over a root. The champion loses 10HP, and returns to camp .
Notes

Lethite piercings increase the chances of encountering an imp, while decreasing the chances of encountering a goblin.
Furrite piercings increase the chances of encountering Jojo.

3.content:
Lake
Jump to navigationJump to search
The Lake is a location that the champion can explore. It is always the second location the champion discovers while exploring.

At first there are no combat scenes by the Lake, only items to find, friendly NPCs to meet and Places to discover. This makes it an ideal as the first place for explore for a new player. Hostile encounters start to appear once the player reaches level 2 and more are added as the game progresses. Even so, the Lake always remains a relatively low-level location.

Possible Encounters
Locations

Town Ruins - You find an overgrown hidden pathway. Following it takes you to the Town Ruins which are than added to the places menu.
The Lake Boat - Allowing you to explore the interior of the lake, not just the shore. The boat is added as a place once it's been found.
Items

Beautiful Sword - a sword stuck in a tree. If the character has overloaded the factory, the tree will be broken and useless.
Whisker Fruit - You find an odd fruit-bearing tree and pick up a fruit that has fallen on the ground.
The character finds a vial of equinum.
Events

Ponies - A Yearly Event encounter. Only occurs on April Fool's Day and only if the player is a centaur.
Lights. Only appears if the character is pregnant with eggs. Choosing a colour determines what colour eggs the character is pregnant with.
The walk around the lake lets the character's mind wander. Characters with corruption > 30, lust > 60, or libido > 40 will have their lust increased, while other characters will gain 1 point of intelligence.
The character encounter a scene where several Green Slimes are gang-raping a Goo-Girl, slightly raise Lust.
The character takes a quick walk around the lake. If their speed is below 50, it is increased by 0.75.
People

Izma the tiger shark girl. Appears every 8th exploration of the lake, and only if the character has met a shark-girl before.
Whitney at work on her farm. She gives the character a canine pepper, and after three encounters the farm is unlocked as a place and can no longer be encountered while exploring.
Rathazul - A rat-morph alchemist. After purchasing 3 items from Rathazul he will offer to move to the champion's camp, becoming a follower.
Callu - A friendly otter-morph who only wants to fish and fuck.
Venus - Players over level 5 can encounter this turtle-girl.
Enemies

Green slime. A goo-boy that attacks on sight. Characters with intelligence < 25, speed < 30 and strength < 40 will be caught unaware and start the fight with +10 lust. Green slimes can only be encountered by characters who are level 2 or higher. (Level 2)
Goo-Girl. A curious goo that takes on the appearance of a female, found in the lake. Encounter rates are affected by a PCs actions in the factory. (Level 3)
Fetish cultist. A female member of the Followers of the Fetish who attacks on sight. Fetish cultists can only be encountered by characters who are level 2 or higher and have defeated the Factory Dungeon. (Level 2)

4.content:
The desert is a location. It is found via Exploring, and is always the next location found after discovering the lake.

Possible encounters
Enemies
Sand Witch - a female magic user, who wants to cast spells on the champion with the aim of watering the desert. Refuse and she attacks the character. (Level 3)
Oasis Demons - a pack of demons who invite the champion to a 'feast', and will attack if he declines. Only appears for characters level 2 and higher. (Level 6)
Naga - a lonely snake-girl, who will usually attack on sight but is affectionate towards characters who have a naga lower body. (Level 2)
Sand Trap - It draws victims into its pit. (Level 4)
Cum Witch - (Level 6)
Locations
The Fountain of Endowment - a magic fountain that can grant XP, increase the size of a number body parts, or lead to possession by Exgartuan.
Tel'Adre - a hidden city in the desert. Only characters who have less than 70 corruption and are not possessed by a demon are permitted inside, and after a character has been granted entry Tel'Adre is unlocked as a place and is no longer encounter-able in the desert.
Burning Library - a one-time encounter with a strange naga who is cooking a potato over the ashes of a ruined library, and gives the character a Wizard's Staff. Only available to characters with greater than 50 intelligence.
Upturned Cart - Your first meeting with Phylla.
Anthill - After you've met Phylla the first time, you sometimes come across her home in the desert and can interact with the other ant-morphs there (Automatically encounter the Anthill for every 8 Explore in the Desert).
Strange Gateway In the Sands - You've discovered the Sand Witch's Dungeon! Once discovered, the dungeon is unlocked as a place and can be accessed directly. The Strange Gateway will not appear until you've reached level 4.
NPC's
Marcus and Lucia - a wanderer endowed with huge testicles and his succubus partner, who wants advice on whether he should give up his soul or remain human. After he has been given an answer, Lucia will begin leaving Succubi's Delight for the champion.
Items
Chest - a key item which unlocks 6 storage slots in the character's camp. One time only.


Other
Mirage - an illusion of a distant, shimmering tower. Causes lust to be reduced by 15.
Nothing - the champion struggles through the shifting sands. Can result in a 0.5pt strength or toughness increase (up to a maximum of 50).
Big junk - a scene that only appears for characters with cocks longer than they are tall. The character's penis impedes their progress through the desert, and causes a slight fatigue gain. (Oh jeez.)

5.content:
The mountain is a location. It can only be discovered after the champion has discovered the desert, and contains a number of enemies and the first dungeon of the main quest.

Encounters
The following creatures can be encountered in the mountain:

Imps - the diminutive offspring of demons, these horny creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Imp Lord - After the player has reached level 8. (Level 7)
Goblins - sex-mad sluts, these lusty creatures attack on sight. (Level 1)
Minotaurs - brutish bull-men who attempt to rape the champion. Characters with low intelligence and strength may be surprised and raped, otherwise the encounter leads to combat. (Level 6)
Hellhounds - demonic, two-headed dog-morphs, they attack the champion on sight. (Level 5)
Ceraph - an omnibus who attempts to make the champion her slave through magical piercings. She first appears as a goblin offering the champion a pair of earrings. She only appears if the champion is level 2 or higher, and is found on every 15th exploration of the mountains. If the champion her first piercing but no others, then she instead appears on every 30th exploration. (Level 9)
Worms - a swarm of worms that attempts to infest the penis of a male or hermaphroditic characters. Uninterested in female or genderless characters. Choosing 'Grossed Out' when finding the worm sign (see below) disables worm encounter. (Level 3)
Infested hellhound - a hellhound who has been infested with worms. Choosing 'Grossed Out' when finding the worm sign (see below) disables the infested hellhound encounter. (Level 5)
Hellhound Master - the master and creator of the hellhounds, he can only be found by who sufficiently resemble hellhounds. Champions must have a dog face; either 2 or more dog cocks, or a vagina and presently be pregnant with a hellhound baby; have 60 or greater corruption; have a dog tail; and either have dog legs or 'midnight black' hair/fur.
Other possible results from exploring are:

Uneventful hike - the champion's hike in the mountains proves fruitless. Increases toughness and speed, and lowers lust for characters with less than 90 corruption. Characters with 90 or more corruption have their libido and lust increased.
Mino + Cowgirl - a minotaur and a cow-girl busy rutting. The champion stays and watches, increasing their lust.
Minotaur village - a bad-end encounter that can only be found by characters with the Minotaur Cum Addict perk. It only appears every 16th exploration of the mountains, and characters who are suffering from withdrawal cannot avoid the encounter.
These encounters can only be encountered once:

High Mountain - if the champion is level 5 or higher or has explored the mountain 40 or more times, they discover a path to the higher reaches of the mountain. The high mountain is then unlocked as a location.
Minotaur warning - appears the first time a level 1 character with 40 or lower strength encounters a minotaur. The character is saved from the minotaur's attentions by the appearance of a second minotaur, who attacks the first.
Worm sign - a sign depicting the effects of the worms. The player can choose their champion's reaction to the sign, which affects the possibility of future worm encounters.
The salon - a hair salon run by the goblin Lynnette, which takes payment for services in cum. After discovery it is unlocked as a place.
The factory - a demon run factory. It serves as the first dungeon of the main quest and can only be found after the champion has spoken with Marae and been tasked to destroy it. After discovery it is unlocked as a place.
Notes
Furrite piercings increase the chance of encountering a minotaur or hellhound
Lethite piercings increase the chances of encountering an imp, while decreasing the chances of encountering a goblin
If the player has silly mode turned on, then the minotaur warning encounter is replaced by one in which several characters from the video game Team Fortress 2 save the champion from a minotaur.

6.content:
The plains are a location that the champion can choose to explore. It can be discovered by exploring, but only if the character has first found the mountain.

The plains are covered in grass and largely flat, allowing the champion to see the mountain, forest, and lake in the distance. Despite the flatness of the plains, travel is as unpredictable as anywhere else in Mareth due to the tall grass, which can grow up to a dozen feet high.

Possible encounters
The Bizarre Bazaar - a settlement formed from brightly coloured wagons and tents, the Bazaar is only open to characters with a corruption stat of 33 or higher. The Bazaar is found on every tenth exploration of the plains, provided the character has not yet entered and unlocked it as a place.
Oviposition Elixir - a discarded bottle of oviposition elixer.
Kanga Fruit - a kanga fruit growing from a strange plant.
Isabella - a tall cowgirl who speaks with a stereotypical Germanic accent.
Bunny Girl - a monster-girl bunny who takes on the role of an Easter Bunny.
Gnoll - a predatory hyena-morph who attacks the champion on sight. (Level 14)
Gnoll Spear-Thrower - another hyena-morph, this time armed with a number of javelins. (Level 10)
Helia - a female Salamander berserker. (Level 16)
Satyr (two different scenes) (Level 14)
Owca
Sheila - A female Kangaroo-morph encountered when exploring the Plain (New addition, not much data available yet)

7.content:
The swamp is a location in Mareth that is unlocked by choosing to Explore after having found the plains. A dark and stagnant environment with sweltering heat, the champion discovers the swamp by following a trio of will-o'-the-wisps.

In the swamp you can encounter

Female Spider-Morphs - spider-girls who may be hostile or not, although the champion can't tell which unless they try talk with the spider-girl. (Level 13)
Male Spider-Morphs - spider-boys who may either attack the champion, or offer to talk with them. (Level 13)
Corrupted Driders - corrupted beings with lower bodies resembling spiders, they attack the champion on sight. (Level 14)
Ro'Gar - A gay male orc who is quite interested in making love to male PCs but is willing to be just friends.
Kiha - an arrogant and female dragon-morph who lays claim to part of the swamp. (Level 16)
Bog - Discovered by exploring the swamp 25 times.
Ember's Egg - Need more info about the encounter change.
If the champion has paid Kiha's toll or has her in camp as a follower, then instead of finding her the character will wander though the swamp and may find one of the following items:

Reducto
GroPlus
Coal
Tough Silk
The Chamber of the Last Inquisitor- the home of the man who once protected the Queen before she became a demon, but was blind to how corrupt she had become until it was to late. when he did try to go against her she easily defeated him. Within the chamber is a box that will give the player the Inquisitor's Robes (Item Code: I.Robes) or Inquisitor's Corset (Item Code: I.Corst), depending on if the player chooses retribution or carnality.

8.content:
The Deepwoods is a location deep within the Forest. It can discovered by a character on his or her 20th exploration of the forest.

The deepwoods is separated from the rest of the forest by a wall of trees, each with a trunk as wide as a house, and is accessed via a knot-hole like opening. The denser vegetation blocks out much of the sun, but luminescent fungi and lichen provide enough illumination to see normally by.

Encounters
Regular encounters
Tamani - a named goblin who will ask any champion with a cock to help knock her up. (Level 4)
Tamani's Daughters - the offspring of Tamani and the champion, this mob of goblins only appears once the character has sired 24 goblins with Tamani. (Level 8+)
Faerie - a diminutive fae slightly larger than the average middle finger. Initially repulsed by characters with 'man parts', she can become addicted to cum through repeated encounters.
Tentacle beast - a shambling beast resembling a large shrub. It attacks enemies on sight. (Level 6)
Corrupted Glade - a patch of forest where the plant-life grows in imitation of genitals.
Trapped satyr - a goat-man caught in the flowers of a corrupted glade, who can be ravaged by male or hermaphroditic characters.
Akbal - a demon in jaguar form, and the self proclaimed God of the Terrestrial Fire. Akbal asks characters to submit to him. (Level 6)
Forest Kitsune - Not really evil but they can play rough. (Level 6)
Kitsune Shrine
Erlking
Special encounters
Halloween Pumpkin - a strange pumpkin that can only be encountered once a year, on and around Halloween.
Halloween Flower Trap - second visit to Fera.
Deep Cave - If the character has cleared the Demon Factory in the Mountain, then they may discover and unlock Deep Cave, the lair of Zetaz.
Encounter frequencies
Tamani does not appear if the character is genderless or if character is female and has already received the Deluxe Dildo from her.
Tamani's Daughets only appear if the PC has enough children with Tamani
Tamani or her daughters are encountered with 20% chance. If it didn't happen or requirements are not met, one of the other common encounters (Faerie, tentacle, glade, Akbal, Kitsune) happens with equal chance.
Satyr is found in the glade, with 25% chance.
Shrine and kitsune share encounter, with kitsune being twice as common.
The Deep Cave encounter doesn't occur until the Demon Factory has been cleared and stops once the Deep Cave has been unlocked.
The Halloween Pumpkin encounter only happens once a year.
The erlking can only be encountered if you've encountered a combination of the satyr, corrupted glade, faerie, kitsunes, or kitsune shrine 4 times
Apart from that, it doesn't seem like any of the encounters are significantly more or less common than the others.

Notes
The deepwoods and the forest share several encounters (Tamani, Tamani's daughters, tentacle beasts, and the corrupted glade). These encounters are more probable in the deepwoods than the forest.
The Halloween pumpkin appears only when the current system time is between the 28th of Oct and 1st of Nov (inclusive), and each character can only encounter it once per year. If the character is eligible, it should appear within 10 explorations of the deepwoods.

9.content:
A secondary Blacksmith's Stand that can be found in Tel'Adre. Whilst Yvonne's blacksmithery sells armor, this nameless and short-tempered husky-morph sells weapons instead.

Items for Purchase

Large Claymore:	A massive sword that a very strong warrior might use.	1000 Gems. Attack 15	Has a strength requirement of 40. Classed as a large weapon. Item Code: Claymor

Huge Warhammer: A huge war hammer made almost entirely of steel that only the strongest warriors could use.	1600 Gems. Attack 15	Has a strength requirement of 80. Classed as a large weapon, and may cause the enemy to become stunned. Item Code: Warhamr

Katana:	A curved blade that cuts through flesh with the greatest of ease.	500 Gems. Attack 10	Ignores 5 points of an enemy's armor defense. Item Code: [Katana ]

Spear: A staff with a sharp blade at the tip designed to pierce through the toughest armor.	450 Gems. Attack 8	Ignores all of an enemy's armor defense.
Item Code: [Spear ]

Coiled Whip:	A coiled length of leather designed to lash your foes into submission.	500 Gems. Attack 5	Attacks may cause foes to gain lust.
Item Code: [Whip ]

Wizard's Staff:	An oddly bent piece of solid wood favored by spell casters. It is said to be made from one of Marae's roots and allow for easier magic use.	350 Gems. Attack 3	Grants the Wizard's Focus perk, reducing spellcasting costs by 40%.
Item Code: W.Staff

Spiked Gauntlets: This pair of metal gauntlets have the knuckles tipped with sharp spikes.	400 Gems. Attack 5	May cause the enemy to be stunned.
Item Code: S.Gaunt

Wingstick:	A tri-bladed throwing weapon. A Wingstick is only good for one use.	16 Gems. Attack N/A	Not an equippable weapon, but can be used in combat to attack the foe. Deals 40-100 damage with each hit.
Item Code: W.Stick

10.content:
A shop run by Yvonne, a female German Shepherd-morph, in Tel'Adre, where the player can buy several different suits of armor. Its interior is blisteringly hot, thanks to the massive forge that dominates the far side of the shop. Yvonne only deals in armor; the blacksmith in town who creates weapons is a nameless male husky-morph who runs the Weaponsmith's Stand.

The following is available for purchase.

Chain mail Bikini:	A revealing chainmail bikini that barely covers anything. The bottom half is little more than a triangle of metal and a leather thong.	Cost: 700 gems	Defense Value: 4	Slutty Seduction: Yes (5)

Full-body chain mail:	This full suit of chainmail armor covers its wearer from head to toe in protective steel rings.	Cost: 150 gems	Defense Value: 8	Slutty Seduction: No

Full plate mail: A highly protective suit of steel platemail. It would be hard to find better physical protection than this.	Cost: 250 Gems	Defense Value: 21	Slutty Seduction: No

Indecent Steel Armor: This suit of steel 'armor' has two round disks that barely cover the nipples, a tight chainmail bikini, and circular butt-plates.	Cost: 800 Gems	Defense Value: 5	Slutty Seduction: Yes (6)

Leather Robe: This is a suit of flexible leather armor with a voluminous set of concealing black robes.	Cost: 100 Gems	Defense Value: 6	Slutty Seduction: No

Scale-mail armor: This suit of scale-mail covers the entire body with layered steel scales, providing flexibility and protection.	Cost: 170 Gems	Defense Value: 12	Slutty Seduction: No
